Very interesting flavors and a very nice and friendly staff! The ice cream shop feels super cozy and inviting, and it feels like a place to catch up with friends and family. They switch their flavors every season and have sorbet options that are dairy free.

I have been here twice, and the first time, I ordered the ice cream flight. The flight comes in small shot glasses, which is a very innovative idea. We had ordered the mint chip, peanut butter, chocolate sorbet, and a fruit sorbet. From first taste, I was not extremely impressed with the ice cream; the ice cream was somewhat icy and the flavors weren't too strong. Some of the flavors tasted like cream and sugar instead of the flavor they said they should be. I did, however, enjoy the mint chip most, since it tasted like a fresh mint leaf speckled with dark chocolate. 

The second time I came to the creamery, I ordered the mint chip again and really enjoyed the taste. Once again, it was super light and it tasted like I was eating a mint leaf. The ice cream was super creamy and rich. 

Overall, the ice cream is a 3.5/5, but the staff was so kind and the ambience was so inviting that they deserve a 4/5.
author: Sandra S.

description:
SF Hometown Creamery is right up there with Bi-Rite in the Mission and Humphry Slocombe at the Ferry Building, but with...less notoriety, in my opinion. And in their case, I suppose that's a good thing because there wouldn't be any lines to try their flavors!

I came here on a first date with the intention of stopping by the Botanical Gardens afterwards (which wasn't a particularly good idea at the time as most of the flowers weren't at peak bloom). We opted for the flight of ice cream, and picked the following 5 flavors: 

- Dubliner (Irish cream and cinnamon and something else): Delicious. My personal favorite as it was the most balanced of all the flavors

- Chocolate sorbet: For a water-based ice cream, it sure packed a lot of chocolatey flavor. This flavor should have been renamed to "fudge sorbet", because that's what it seriously tasted like. 

- Mint Chocolate Chip: It was my date's favorite flavor, as she likes mint. I prefer mint only in its leaf and gum form only, so I'll decline to rate this one. 

- Squash and strawberry flavor: Hmm, this was a regrettable flavor to choose. The savory squash paired with the naturally sweet strawberry flavor clashed like oil and water. 

- Madagascar vanilla: People say vanilla is boring. I say when you're in a pinch, you NEVER go wrong with vanilla! There is a very strong and rich flavor to this one, and easily would have been my favorite had it not been for the Dubliner. 

In any case, this is an intimate enough spot to take a date, and with the variety of flavors, you can expect to embark on an ice cream adventure for the tastebuds!
author: Viet N.

description:
Ice cream? Meh. 

Service? Disgusting. 

Jan 2, 2018 at 9pm

Whoever worked that night (a male and a female) need to get retrained on customer service. Not one smile or greeting, or even a man "thank you" and just had a vibe that they didn't want to serve us at all. I didn't even want to eat my ice cream anymore. They totally killed my vibe. 

Thumbs way down!
author: Chai S.

description:
Big fan of the flavours they have here. They're always varied and very tasty. Shout out to the ice cream flight which is a concept I hadn't heard of but now believe is the best thing ever. You get to sample 5 different ice cream flavours in a cute little array. Great for sharing!

The staff are friendly and there's seating available inside. You can sample anything you want before ordering, and then they offer a 'smidge' size which is actually larger than you'd expect given the name. It's perfect for a hot day in the sunset.
author: Joe B.

description:
SF doesn't have a lack of ice cream shops to try, so it's hard to choose which one is best. Honestly, I think a lot of ice cream shops have pros that make them more appealing than others. So I'll focus on why this creamery is good.

They make their ice cream in small batches, so you can try new flavors pretty often. 

They give you decent sized scoops.

They use compostable materials, so yay environment!

The flavors are tasty and they have very unique ones! The last one I tried was a special that they made and all the proceeds went to hurricane relief. I think it was called the big heart! And it was bourbon flavored with toffee and caramel(?) But it was yummy!

My favorite thing about this creamery though is that you can order a flight of ice cream. This is awesome when you come with friends and can't decide which flavor to get. Simple solution - try them all!

The location is also easy to get to, inner sunset, but parking can be a pain depending on day/time you go. I'll keep going back because it's yummy ice cream with options and conveniently located.
author: Melissa W.

description: So far this is my favorite ice cream shop in SF. I have yet to try a flavor that I did not like. My favorite thing to get is a flight of the rotation flavors to split. They change up there flavors pretty often, and I love to try as many as possible.
author: Amanda S.

description:
10/10! I come here so often and am never disappointed. 

There are several things I love about this place:
- There are rotating flavors and they're all so unique! 
- They have Fresh Mint Chip - no, not the typical green chocolate mint chip flavor you'll get at supermarkets, this one is the actual mint leaf!! 
- You can try any flavor before deciding
- There is a  "smidge" size option for those who want to satisfy ice cream cravings but aren't ready to fully indulge :). Personally, the smidge in a cone is a perfect snack size!
- Smells soo good inside the shop! It's especially cute at night when the xmas lights turn on.
author: Kris C.

description:
We stopped by this place impulsively on our way home from a day trip to SF.  It's in a cute little building tucked away in the Inner Sunset District.  Once inside there are cute murals on the wall depicting the different districts in SF.  We were greeted by the inviting aroma of freshly baked waffle cones while in line. 

When I got to the counter I tried a few different flavors and finally settled on salted caramel ice cream in a waffle cone.  The flavor is subtle, not overly sweet, and delicious.   My wife got canteloupe sorbetto in a cup, which did not disappoint.  

My only suggestion would be to improve efficiency and get people through the line more quickly.   We had to wait for a very long time to get served, but it was definitely worth it.

I also like their serving sizes.   You can get a tiny amount of ice cream which won't leave you feeling sick afterwards.

Overall I definitely recommend you check this place out next time you are near the Sunset District.
author: Howard B.

description:
Love this place! Amazing quality of homemade ice cream PLUS creative seasonal flavors. Of course, they also offer flavors year long of the traditional variety (I particularly like their peanut butter chocolate one). And best of all they list their current flavors online! So you can see ahead of time if a stop in is a must-do (trust me, it usually is).

But hands down my fav of their creations so far was the spicy elote one. So ingenious and unique. A perfect amount of sweet and heat. Might be my favorite ice cream ever, hope it comes back!
author: VM T.

description:
The flight is a great choice if you are going with a group. The flavors are mint chip, black sesame and white miso, Pluot sorbet, Madagascar vanilla, and the French roast coffee. The texture was smooth for all of them and the Pluot helped cut through the creaminess of the dairy. 

Black sesame was a pleasant surprise with the low key nutty flavor and definitely my favorite. 

Bonus: it's really close to San Tung!
author: Amy N.

description: By far one of the best ice cream places in San Francisco. Love the fact everything is made fresh including the waffle cones. Even though they don't have a huge flavor selection everything that they do offer is absolutely amazing. I recommend the flight, this way you can try different flavors at the same time. Love this place, if you haven't been here, you must give this place a try.
author: Roman L.

description:
The chocolate sorbet. Get the chocolate sorbet. 
This place is pricey but worth it. Clean ingredients! Plus the chocolate sorbet will change your life.
author: Anna J.

description: My favorite place for Ice Cream in the city. I have been coming here since they opened and I love them. The smidge is worth it all and I respect a place that has such delicious ice cream. They are nice employees that take care of the customers no matter how busy they are. And they get busy!
author: Aili P.

description:
Omg. Why have I not come here sooner? Well, tbh my former neighborhood go-to ice cream shop turned me off when they charged a credit card fee for a $3 scoop of ice cream. Noooo thank you!! 

This shop doesn't charge you with a swipe and just for that, I'm a big fan.

Now really, that's not the only reason why I'm giving this place a perfect 5 stars. I was really impressed with the ice cream. The peanut butter and chocolate drizzle scoop on a crisp waffle cone was a taste of heaven with the very first bite and the bite after and so on. The flavor of the peanut butter packed a punch and definitely showcased the quality ingredients used by Hometown Creamery.

I'll be back soon and I'm looking forward to try the rest of the flavors!
author: Briana H.

description:
Amazing ice cream - great flavors that are special but not so 'out there trendy' and creamy quality.

Adorable space - cozy with murals and lots of sitting and standing room.

Awesome people - the guys who run it are the sweetest.

The quintessential local ice cream spot!
author: C W.

description: Stopped by on a random night after getting dinner in the neighborhood I never came across hometown creamery. It was amazing to say the least I walked in tried the peanut butter chocolate fudge ice cream which was absolutely amazing  and it came in a nice waffle cone. No lies I'm coming back again! Great little ice cream  shop in San Francisco.
author: Mario G.

description:
Ice cream is so magically tempting. It doesn't matter how much you just ate for dinner. Standing inside a creamery tricks your stomach into thinking there's always room for dessert. And this is exactly what happened to me when I visited SF's Hometown Creamery with a few friends.

I was going to decline ice cream altogether when I saw that they offer something called a "smidge" which is a cup smaller than a small. Genius! There's always room for just a smidge of ice cream. I caved in when I made eye contact with the peanut butter and chocolate ice cream. One of my few ice cream weaknesses.

The staff members who worked here were super sweet (no pun intended) to all of us, especially as they were cleaning up and closing. I would definitely come back here to explore the rest of the ice cream flavors and to someday order an ice cream sandwich. That sounds awesome! I mean, not that I haven't had one before, but one from this place sounds especially good.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I have been to here a few times on warm days which aren't that many in San Francisco. They make the ice cream on site and they always have interesting flavors that you don't find elsewhere.
The place is clean, bright and spacious with a bathroom and water dispenser for customers. People there are very nice. Naturally, you can taste the ice cream before you order. They use ordinary washable small spoons for tasting, not plastic. You can see they are green. There are regular scoop sizes, but they also offer smidge scoop size. So if you want to have two flavors, but you don't want to have two regular scoops, this is the option which won't stuff you. They also make fresh waffle cones you can also buy a pint of your favorite flavor home!

I enjoy this place immensely.
author: shan t.

description:
I am so happy I found this lil gem of an ice cream shop through social media and Yelp. The cute ice cream flight photos made it a priority go-to places when my friends and I took an SF trip! We came on a Friday evening sort of near closing time and the store was still bustling with couples, friends, and family! The environment is so peaceful and cozy and the service is extremely friendly. 

Ice cream flavors rotate daily and also seasonally. I believe they keep some flavors always on their menu, such as Fresh Mint Chip. You can also ask for free waffle crumbles on the side or on top of the scoops. In addition, there is also free water in the back of the shop.

For the ice cream flight, you get to choose 5 flavors in 5 small shot glasses. Based on what was available, we decided to go with what sounded interesting and adventurous: French Roast Coffee, Apple Pie, Romeo e Julieta (queso fresco & guava jelly), Navajo's Squash Blossom (pumpkin butternut squash and prickly pear jelly), and Taysia's Thanksgiving Special (spiced sweet potato with marshmallow fluff). The flavors are very strong and tasted very fresh. We really enjoyed the coffee one and I personally enjoyed the interesting sweet potato one. I am excited to come back in the future to try other their other unique flavors.
author: Mary Q.

description:
This little gem is such a delight. I came here through a friend's recommendation and I was not disappointed. The ice cream is made onsite and they have a variety of temporary flavors. I tried the vanilla, I know I know it's vanilla but it was absolutely delicious and I paired it with some sweet potato pie and it was a great companion to the flavors. I also had the tiramisu and the temporary oatmeal breakfast flavor (Asmara's breakfast) which was very delicious. People complain about the cost of ice cream but to be honest, you could not get any fresher and experimental than this. 
If you're in the neighborhood, I recommend you try this spot.
author: Tina Y.

description:
Was so excited to try this place out because of Yelp and a couple of friends recommended it! Def did not disappoint.

Workers were really friendly and they knew we were from out of town so they took the time to explain their ice cream and all the fresh ingredients that go into it. Customer service makes a big impact 

Get the STRAWBERRY BALSAMIC! Soooo yummy. The word balsamic threw me off and almost didn't get it. We got a flight which comes in mini scoops of various ones. Very cute and Instagram worthy!
author: Brittney T.

description: Awww!!! What a cold cream in my mouth!! Its amazing ice cream,I don't like super sweet but not !
author: Sally W.

description:
An excellent find!

It's not Friday yet, but we got ice cream, YUM!

Found parking across the street from the creamery in the public lot on 9th - Entrance to the parking lot is on 8th street; it's a one way parking lot and its free after 6pm. PERFECT!

Arrived around 5:45pm and it was empty. The girl in front help us immediately. We went for the flight. 

Orders:
1. Flight - 5 flavors: Fresh Mint, Chocolate sorbet, strawberry, banana peanut butter, and forgot the last flavor. 

The entire flight was excellent, very refreshing to taste something unique. Would definitely recommend this place for dessert/ice cream; not your typical creamery.
author: Maria H.

description:
Came on a Saturday night and the place was quite busy. I chose the sake ginger pear sorbet. I liked it a lot! Reminded me exactly of a sweet pear. Even the same texture as a pear lol. I really like how they offer the smidge size. It's the perfect size! Just the right amount to satisfy a sweet tooth after dinner. Wish all ice cream places offer this size. 

Only negative is that I wish they offered better flavors. There were so many chocolate flavors. Not too big a fan of chocolate, which narrowed my options quite an bit.
author: Annie H.

description:
This is a solid ice cream shop. Their ice cream or flavors weren't mind blowing, but they are okay! And they have a pretty unique ice cream flight option. Price point is great, it's not as expensive as some of these other shops in SF. 

So I came here with some friends and we got the ice cream flight to share. You get to pick five flavors. One scoop of each and a cup of crushed waffle cones. The waffle cone is pretty delicious, it isn't your typical waffle cone, it tasted like cookie butter! So the five flavors, ranked from my favorite to least, that we chose were the chocolate sorbet, mint chip, coconut sticky rice, matcha, and cream with apple. The chocolate sorbet was great, rich, thick, tasted like a brownie! The mint chip is really good too, I never liked mint chocolate chip ice cream because of that artificial mint flavor, but this was the real deal! As if I bit right into the mint leaf itself. This is probably their most unique/well-known flavor, and it's good! The coconut sticky rice was good, tasted like your typical coconut dessert. The matcha was as expected as matcha ice creams go, I would have liked a stronger green tea flavor, but that's just me. And the cream with apple was essentially vanilla ice cream with apple bits which was alright. But all this for $12 and a cute little flight, so worth!

Five scoops might sound daunting, but I believe in you, you can do it! But if you don't think you can tackle the flight, you can opt for the single scoop which was about $4. They also have mini, double and triple scoop options!
author: Eva C.

description:
[3.5 stars]

Came on a Sunday a little after they opened and the place wasn't busy at all. We ordered a flight, in which you get to choose 5 different flavors. They allowed us to try as many flavors as we wanted to before choosing, so that was really nice. We settled on the cookies and cream, chocolate, espresso, black sesame, and earl grey lavender. As for the icecream itself, I wasn't the biggest fan of the icecream since it wasn't as creamy and old school as I usually like. On the other hand the flavors itself were really good, espresso and earl grey lavender being my favorite.

Service was really great, the lady putting together our flight paid a lot of attention to detail and made sure it looked perfect. Along with the flight (which isn't as hard to finish as you might think), it came with a small cup of waffle cone crumble for some added texture.
author: Megan K.

description:
I had the Aztec chocolate and my girlfriend had the "Breakfast Ice Cream". While mine was great hers was fantastic. 

Brown sugar ice cream, toasted oats, cinnamon, and peanut butter swirl.  Definitely try this one!!! 

Place has plenty of room to enjoy your ice cream inside or you can head out to the park nearby.
author: John T.

description:
I often eat in the Inner Sunset area since I reside here, and I absolutely love ice cream, so I find myself walking by or visiting this place a fair number of times. It is in a convenient location for me and would have loved to love this place, but I just find it mediocre. 

I appreciate that the flavors are pretty unique and when I walk by, I'm always interested in what kind of flavors they have at the moment because they change up their flavors quite often. They do have a few classic flavors that they usually keep around as well. I think their flavors do sound interesting and appealing, but I hold to my opinion that this place isn't bad, but it isn't my go to place for ice cream. From what I have tried, I do think that their ice cream is more on the icy-er side and not as smooth and silky. This has been the case during more than one experience for me. It wasn't extremely prevalent in the ice cream but noticeable. 

Although I'm not a fanatic about this place, I do think that their ice cream flight is pretty great. I think that if you have never been here and would like to try a variety of different flavors or if you simply can't choose, the ice cream flight is definitely a must. It's a sampler of your choice of 5 flavors. If you come here, this is worth the try. I think this is the reason I would come here again as it is the perfect thing to share especially for someone as indecisive as me.
author: Christina C.

description:
I've had my eye on this place ever since I heard that they served an ice cream flight. That's right, five scoops of ice cream served with waffle cone crumbles? I'M THERE. Finally got the chance last night to go. The ice cream man was like "Your first time here and you're getting the flight? That's a ballsy move." That's how I do ice cream man, that's how I do.

Rating Breakdown:
2/2 Stars for Taste -- I went with a friend and he chose mint chip and coconut. At first, I eyed him askance for the mint chip (because basic), but the minute I took my first bite, my eyes almost rolled up into my head. The taste of fresh mint exploded across my taste buds. None of that artificial mint extract over here, nope. YUM. The coconut was creamy and tasted exactly like you would expect it to taste. 

I chose the roasted black sesame with miso caramel, caipirinha, and fresh ginger. The roasted black sesame was SO good -- almost savory, but still decadently delicious. I didn't really taste the miso caramel though. The fresh ginger wasn't as strong as I thought it would be, but the light fresh taste of ginger was really refreshing. The caipirinha was like a punch in the face, but one you would welcome over and over again. As I puckered my lips and squinted one eye, I thought "damn, that's good."

The ice cream melts a little quickly, but the flight is served in shot glasses so at the end, you can shoot the leftover liquid. No shame!

On top of all this, the waffle cone crumbles were delicious and tasted better than any free crumbles have the right to taste. The cone was thick, crunchy, and had a light cinnamon taste.

1/1 Stars for Value -- It was about $13 (with tax) for the flight. To give you an idea of size, the five scoops were served in shot glasses. With the first taste, you know immediately that all the ice cream is made fresh with real ingredients. You are definitely getting what you pay for -- top notch ice cream with FREE waffle cone crumbles. 

1/1 Stars for Customer Service -- The first thing our server said to us was, "Any flavors you want to taste?" YES. That is what I like to hear at an ice cream store. After meticulously preparing our flight, he looked at the bucket of waffle cone crumbles, grabbed another cone, and crumbled it before our eyes to make sure we got nice big pieces. MY MAN (slow clap). 

As we were eating, I also saw the owner (?) prepare a milkshake for another guest. He and the guest were discussing what ice cream flavors would make the best shake and in the end, I'm pretty sure they settled on a very complicated ratio of chocolate sorbet and mint chip ice cream. When he handed the guest the finished product, he said, "Let me know how that tastes". Let me tell you, every last worker here is an artist. 

Bonus star because this place is dangerously close to school and I can see myself coming back for a scoop of any of those flavors that I tried last night. 

TL;DR: Fresh and delightfully delicious ice cream that comes in both interesting and basic flavors. Come for a scoop or a flight, topped off with free cinnamon waffle cone crumbles. YUM.
author: Abby W.

description:
This was a cute find! Parking is difficult since it's in the busy streets of Irving but we found parking just around the block. The place is beautifully decorated with paintings of the different hubs of SF. All the ice cream was freshly made so there was a limited variety. You can sample the flavors too! My sorority sisters and I decided to share a flight of ice cream... which consists of 5 flavors all put into its own shot glass. Our lady also shaped each scoop into a perfect dome. The flavors we got:

Basil- think of pesto ice cream. Lol. It's creamy! Made me want pasta.
Darlin' Clementine Sorbet- very good. Flavor was on point & it was refreshing!
Sephardic style haroset- a traditional Passover dish with apples, cinnamon, walnuts, dried dates, apricots & cranberries. I liked this flavor because all the ingredients blended together very well. 
Madagascar vanilla- your typical vanilla!
Carrot cake- MY FAVE OF THE FIVE. Cream cheesy goodness. MMMMM. I'd go back for this. 

I was also able to sample Teatime on the Thames... which is a mixture of earl grey & lavender. I enjoyed it!! Lavender was a bit overpowering. I would've added this instead of the vanilla... but my friend didn't like it. Lol. We also got to sample their waffle cones. Fresh made too!

A very cute concept! Check it out!
author: Gwyne P.

description:
Don't doubt yourself, get the FLIGHT. You won't regret it.

Here's what I got, from lightest to strongest flavor, which is how you should be eating it to fully enjoy the flavors without overwhelming the palette.

HONEY LEMON ROSEMARY
I was pleasantly surprised by this one. I got it because I couldn't decide on the last flavor but this combination was amazing. The light citric notes were just what I needed. 

CARROT CAKE
I love this so much, I thought about ordered an additional scoop. They don't always have it so if you see it, I would definitely ask to try it, you might love it too. It tasted a little like Kara's Carrot Cake Cupcake in ice cream form, which is always a good thing. :)

MANGO SORBET
We actually didn't get a fall scoop because this was so popular so they scooped us all they could from the bin and topped us off with some waffle cones, which I didn't complain about because it added to the ~aesthetics~.

PEANUT BUTTER CHOCOLATE FUDGE
I'm not a big fan of chocolate flavored things but this was decent. Theres additional chocolate syrup to complete the Reese's-copycat taste.

CHOCOLATE SORBET
Also- not a big fan, its definitely heavy on chocolate flavor. This might be a plus for chocoholics but I could do without it.
author: Anna F.

description: This is the best ice cream I have ever had. Made from fresh ingredients and tastes as if it were homemade. The rotating flavors are unique and delicious!
author: Justin K.

description:
This was a great ice cream place with a good ambiance, but nothing spectacular that merits a 5 star. I would say the mint ice cream was the best I've ever had though because it really tasted like legit mint. Kevin prefers the fake tasting mint ice cream. So he didn't love it.

The woman at the front was really nice and gave me a sample of pretty much everything. Tipped her for sure!
author: Nadia H.

description:
When I first walked into this establishment, I was pleasantly greeted by the sweet aroma of freshly made waffle cones. The service here was outstanding. There were 3 workers and they had the biggest smiles on their face. You can truly tell that they love their job. They were very friendly and generous with the scoops. 

They have a great selection of flavors. I fell in love with the carrot cake icecream. The texture was perfectly creamy, had bits of carrot, raisins, and pecans. I don't really care for raisins, but I truly enjoyed them in the icecream. 

The creamery is quite small. The decorations make the place feel very cozy. They have a few tables and chairs, as well as free water towards the back. The prices are somewhat expensive (2 scoops will run you about $6 already). However, the quality of the icecream is great. Definitely worth a try! I will be back to try the icecream flight!
author: Sandra N.

description:
If I was blind folded and asked to eat the ice cream here, it's a 3, but after coming here and being in the "moment", it's a 4. 

I came here after lunch, and it was kind of packed! However, line moved quickly. 

I ordered:
-1 regular triple scoop with dixie delight, fresh mint chip and chocolate peanut butter fudge ($6.95) // 
1.Dixie delight reminds me of a churro (which I loved)! 
2. Fresh mint chip...OH HOLY. My favorite! I LOVE mint, and this was the freshest mint chip I've ever had. You are literally eating mint! 
3. Too chokingly sweet for me, but my SO LOVED it!

Pros:
-Good variety of scoop options! (Mini, regular, with or without cone, cookie sandwich)
-Fantastic service. Super friendly people! The place is also well-kept.

Cons:
-Limited flavors. Too many sorbet flavors...it would be nice to have more regular flavors for the less adventurous. 
-Interesting texture. The mint chip had fantastic flavor, but it wasn't creamy. It felt more like a sorbet...and same with all the other flavors I tested- not creamy enough.

Tips/Observations:
-Ask for the free cone crumble....I was a n00b and forgot. 
-Seems like cone or cup, same price. Might as well get a cone, right?
-Super cute wall in the back with a map! Where did you come from?

Overall, I would come back here for a smidge ice cream. It's the cutest thing ever!
author: Hurjane V.

description: The place is nice. The service was great. They will ask you if you need to try any flavors. I got rose ice cream.
author: San N.

description: Very cute ice cream shop that gives off a very SF vibe - lots of wood paneling and muraled walls. Unfortunately I found the decor of the place to be better than the ice cream. While the flavors were unique, including black sesame and ginger pear, I found the taste to be underwhelming. We got the mint chip, peanut butter chocolate chip, and French pressed coffee. The mint chip and coffee both had very light flavors, so light you couldn't really get an impression of the taste. The texture of the ice cream was also not very creamy, and there were icy chunks. It hits the ice cream cravings, but I would not go back again.
author: Hali M.

description:
I tried a few flavors, and settled on the Black and Tan(chocolate and caramel) and tea time(Earl grey and lavender) on a waffle cone. Both flavors were amazing and right up my alley. The tea time was fragrant and sweet while the Black and Tan had an almost dark chocolate with sweet caramel mixed in. 

Definitely worth stopping by!!
author: Vy T.

description:
Dessert review. Ice cream.

Flavors:
Fresh mint chip - 4/5
Strawberry balsamic - 3/5
Rapscallion & Speculos - 5/5
End of summer s'mores - 3/5
Cookies and cream - 3/5

Pastry:
Bourbon Maple Pecan Bar - 3/5

Overall, "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
After my food buddy showed me Hometown Creamery's flight picture, I've wanted to go try it. We had a late dinner after my flight came in and just barely made it before their 10 pm closing time. One of the employees let us know that they stopped serving flights at 9:45 pm. Bummer. We decided since we went out of our way to go there, we should try the ice cream anyhow. 

This shop serves ice cream in smidge, single, double smidge, double, triple, and flight (5 flavors in 5 small glass containers). 

I opted for the smidge Tea Time on the Thames (earl grey and lavender). If you love lavender, this would be for you. The lavender overpowered the earl grey. My friend got a double smidge of the Dubliner (Irish cream, cinnamon, chocolate stout) and the Sake Ginger Pear Sorbet. He thoroughly enjoyed the Dubliner (no surprise there). The Sake Ginger Pear Sorbet was good; almost tasted like a mushed up sweet pear in liquid form. 

We'll come back for the flight some other time but our first experience was a pretty good one given we got there at 9:50 pm and they close at 10 pm.
author: Olivia C.

description:
I love everything about this place! Their ice cream is home made and come in a variety of interesting flavors. The smidge size (the smallest size, size of a golf ball) is the cutest thing ever, it even comes in a baby homemade waffle cone upon request. A little goes a long way, and only $2.50!

On my most recent visit, I got to try the blueberry cheesecake and it was delicious! It wasn't too sweet, which is a big factor for me. There were also real graham cheesecake bits mixed in. 

The strawberry balsamic is always a good choice too! The flavor will make you never want basic strawberry ice cream ever again. 

And the customer service is great, their employees are very attentive and don't mind letting you sample multiple flavors.
author: Nancy C.

description: Yummy hot chocolate on a cold day in San Francisco! The answer is yes! Missed our Indian summer hot days to try the ice cream but I will certainly be back!
author: Marie P.

description: The first time I came into this place, I tried the Horchata and it was memorably delicious.  They have a lot of unique flavors here and rotate their flavors.  Today they didn't have the Horchata, so I tried a coconut, sticky rice, mango flavor.  My husband really liked it.  We also tried the peanut butter chocolate.  It did remind me of peanut butter cups but it was way better than other places that have the same flavor and not overwhelmingly sweet.
author: S Y.

description:
I was really excited to come here to get the flight! The venue has plenty of seating and the outside looks sort of Japanese with the blue roof. I didn't really know much else about the place when I got here but was really excited to see they had really unique homemade flavors. This place can get a bit crowded and the staff here were a bit slow, so I think efficiency is something they could work on. The staff were friendly enough though and I was able to try the flavors to decide on the 5 I wanted to try for the flight.

We ended up getting basil (very herby), purple rain (pancakes and blueberry), peanut butter chocolate fudge, chocolate chip cookie dough, and fresh mint chip (super duper minty!). I like that the flight are shot-sized portions of ice cream so you can switch between flavors and can't get tired of one flavor. Although we did get the unique flavors, I still enjoyed the more typical peanut butter chocolate fudge and cookie dough ice cream. The ambience here is very fitting for a date or for a family!
author: Catherine S.

description:
After looking for a place for dessert with some friends, I came across San Francisco Hometown Creamery. Initially, I thought it was related to the San Francisco Creamery known for the kitchen sink but after looking at the flavors and the layout, I realized they are completely different. I was pleasantly surprised to see that all of their ice cream was made locally and they had over a dozen unique flavors. My friends and I decided to share a "Flight" with 6 different flavors. We went with: 

1. Cardamon- Very unique flavor which tasted alright. We just wanted to try it. Not something I'd order again but it's worth a try. 

2. Honey Lemon Rosemary- Very lemony flavor and you can taste each ingredient. The mix works well together. 

3. Salted Caramel- Maybe I've been spoiled by birite's salted caramel but the salted caramel here was not up to par. It was average at best. I felt like it tasted more syrupy than natural salted caramel. 

4. Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge- This flavor was pretty good. The thick peanut butter wasn't overpowered by the chocolate. It was extremely sweet however so its kind of difficult to eat an entire scoop on your own. 

5. Maple Pecan- This flavor was good but not amazing. Tasted just like what you would expect pecan to taste like but it didn't have any special touch to make it unique. 

6. Cookies and Cream- Again it was alright. I've had better at different locations. Pretty much vanilla ice cream with some Oreos in it. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall, the service was great and the worker were very patient as we decided on the flavors to order. 5 stars there but I think the ice cream is below average. I felt like most of the flavors were comparable to Safeway brand. I think when I hear home made ice cream, I expect very creamy with chunks of fruit or nut depending on the flavor with their unique touch and interpretation. However, I felt like the ice cream here just tasted generic. I also felt the scoops are pretty small for what you pay. I really want to like this place and I'll probably go back to give them another chance but with Birite and Mitchell's everywhere, there's a lot of competition. 2 stars for the ice cream.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Handmade ice cream here. They have some interesting and seasonal flavors. Great selection of fruity and non-fruit flavors. Sorbets offered too. They have a flight of 5 single scoops too. Some flavors a little subdued like the ginger and fresh mint. The madagascar vanilla was rich and creamy. I found the coffee and cookies n cream a little icy. The waffle cone pieces were much appreciated. Chocolate chip cookie was okay. Nice service. Roomy interior. Great vibes.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
There are many fancy ice cream places in San Francisco so I was eager to see how this place was going to be different from all of the other places. I think the differentiating factor here is the yummy homemade cone that is available at no extra cost. I am usually not a cone person but the cones here are just too adorable to pass up.

The guys were patient with me and let me try several flavors before I settled on the blueberry cheesecake. I sat there on my "non-date" eating this ice cream and people watching. I think what could really benefit this ice cream shop is a feminine touch. The handwriting on the boards inside and outside could be improved to make it more appealing and the décor in the shop could use more finesse.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Initially came with the intent of ordering a flight, however the chances seemed less and less likely with each sample we tried.

The plan went from a 5 flavor ice cream flight, to double scoop, to single scoop.. real quick. 

We ended up sharing one scoop of chocolate chip cookie dough because that was the only flavor we liked out of the four we tried.. and we didn't even like it that much. You can tell it's on the icier side. The cookie dough chunks seemed non-existent, but hopefully Shawn C. was eating them because I sure didn't taste any. 

Excellent, friendly service and the waffle cones were delicious, but the ice cream was lacking. I'd be willing to give it another try on a day when they have different flavors.
author: Laverne N.

description: The balsamic strawberry and cantaloupe sorbet were great! The strawberry nutella crepe was good in theory but I personally had a lot of crepe pieces that were all really soggy and I understand it's inside of the ice cream but it was not great having all of those pieces.
author: Janet Y.

description:
This probably my boyfriends favorite ice cream shop. He likes it more than bi-rite. We ordered the flight just to try a little of everything. 
Bread pudding - really light with a hint of cinnamon
Matcha green tea - must try if you're a matcha fan 
Mint chip - mint is strong and you can taste the flavor of actual mint leaves
Peanut butter chocolate fudge - our favorite. Hands down. Worth fighting over 
Vanilla - smooth and creamy 

 Well be back !!
author: Betty T.

description: We stumbled on this ice cream spot on our walk today. I'm really glad they had their sandwich board out with their flavors in rotation because I would have thought it was still the old Japanese place. The flavors on the board were enticing so we decided to go in. We both had the Rocky Road (marshmallows, walnuts, and brownie pieces) in the single size on their homemade cone. The ice cream was delicious and very fresh tasting. The brownies were a different version of Rocky Road and it was great. The cone held up well and didn't leak at the bottom and was yummy. Our ice cream was scooped with a friendly smile and the place including the restroom was clean.  There was a constant stream of people. We love that it's a place offering homemade small batch ice cream made on site. They have a number of sizes and different items like shakes and floats too. A winner!
author: Jen L.

description:
Best decision of the night!

This is no overstatement as finding good ice cream in any city can be quite a challenge. There are so many wonderful creameries in San Francisco, but what made this place stand up to the rest is their super unique and rotating homemade flavors being served in a flight of ice cream. The ice cream has to be the most worth item getting because it's 5 flavors for $13 (you save 50 cents, not a huge difference I might add). Service was really great. The server neatly packs a generous serving of ice cream in your shot glasses. Also they provide tiny pieces of waffle cones as chips for dipping. The wait wasn't much of a wait at all, probably due to the fact that my friend and I came on a weeknight.

I got the flight with chocolate sorbet, french roast coffee, parfronte?, strawberry, & lemon poppy seed.

My favorite flavors were the lemon poppy seed and chocolate sorbet. The lemon poppy seed was a nicely sweet and refreshing taste. The chocolate sorbet was rich in heavy dark chocolate. What I liked to do was eat two flavors of ice cream at once to see how the combination would work well together. These two worked out really well, and just made me want more of it all.

Come here if you want to try unique and awesome tasting flavors of ice cream!
author: Kevin S.

description: Its pretty good! I got the strawberry nutella crepe ice cream. We thought it was a unique flavor so we decided to try it and it was actually very delicious and creamy! I also like the layout design of the interior. Will definitely come back to try other flavors!
author: Rafael A.

description: This place is great! It's really hard to find a mom & pop shop like this still around where they make everything fresh. The owner is really friendly & down to earth. The ice cream flavors change all the time depending on what's in season. The atmosphere is really nice & wholesome. If you want great ice cream with fresh ingredients this is the place to come.
author: Zaro A.

description:
Not many flavors on the menu, but all are rich and sweet. We ordered the flight, and tried the Fresh Mint Chip, Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge, Tiramisu, Sufganiyot and Asmera's Weekday Breakfast. 

Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge - the peanut butter is overpowering, couldn't taste the chocolate. 
Tiramisu - good, texture was fluffy, but had a strong rum aftertaste.
Sufganiyot - when I tried the sample I really liked it, but made the mistake of eating this flavor last, my tastebuds were clouded by all the other flavors so this one seemed bland in comparison.  
Asmera's Weekday Breakfast - interesting flavor and sweet, but has a weird texture, mostly oats and other crunchy bits. 

I was really excited to try out these ice creams but ended up slightly disappointed. Good thing I tried the flights, don't think I would have been able to eat a small scoop of any flavor.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Strolled over to this cute ice cream shop on a Friday evening. Upon entering, I was captured by the mural/wall paintings adorning the top section of the walls. They depicted the different neighbourhoods of San Francisco, from Fillmore to Financial District, from SOMA to Sunset. Amidst my ice cream munching, I neglected to take photos! Oh well, next time haha. Anyways, I was tempted to get the flight of (I think) 5 flavours, but I decided on my better judgement against it, since it would have been lil ol' me vs 5 scoops of ice cream haha.

- Salted caramel: this was ok. 
- Peanut butter chocolate fudge: this one was much better than the salted caramel. The texture was smooth, and I really liked the peanut butter flavour with the fudge swirl surprises!
- Waffle cone: this was the cutest waffle cone I've seen! It was cute, but also the smallest waffle cone I've ever had. Definitely a pricey add on for $1. I could have lived without, but it was decently good.

Though the salted caramel didn't live up to my expectations, the peanut butter chocolate fudge was great, and I'll be back to try some other flavours (and maybe drag a friend or two to help finish the flight hehe).
author: Joanna C.

description:
"Good" ice cream is so subjective. With that said I can't say theirs is within the scope of my favorite ice cream here in the city. I didn't find it smooth and creamy as far as texture goes and flavors weren't as rich for my liking. The coffee hardly tasted like coffee (I had to confirm it was the coffee one I was eating) and neither did the mint (no, I'm not expecting the bright green artificial flavored type). Maybe the flavors were a little too subtle for me. Don't get me wrong, it's not terrible by a long shot, it just didn't have what I personally seek in my personal evaluation of what "good" ice cream has. 

We went with the intent of ordering the flight but rather than have a medley of different flavors I may or may not have liked, I decided on a single scoop and sampled out the flavors of the three others I was with that day. Turns out, I did not care for all of them. 

Service was swift, the facilities were clean and I loved that it wasn't too crowded for a Saturday afternoon. 

I did think their product is natural tasting and not overtly sweet. If this works for you and prefer ice cream flavors that are on the subtle side, this place might be for you.
author: Esther A.

description: Wow!   The ice cream is incredible!  Not cheap but better than an after dinner drink!   We all had something different so we could sample!  I loved my jelly donut ice cream!   The best of both worlds!
author: Barb L.

description: Really good ice cream. Wish they had a bit more of a selection. Lots of chocolatey/ cream based flavors. Decent prices and great service. Very nice atmosphere.
author: Zoe R.

description:
once in a blue moon, i decide its ok to treat myself. What better way then to get some ice cream. I used to be a huge ice cream fan so naturally I had this place bookmarked. Who doesn't love fun flavors and freshly made. The hubs and I finally went last night after dinner at Ebisu. I looked at the menu prior too and saw that they had a tea flavor again. I'm kinda obssessed with tea flavors since its much more delicate and light tasting. I'm not a chocolate fan. When I was a kid, I loved Neoplitan but I always ate the strawberry first. 

So we go because they have the "Tea Times of the Thames" which is a mix of earl grey and lavender. It did not disappoint at all. it was so light and not overly sweet. I also actually got the Egg Nog too which was also very good. I'm not a Egg Nog drinker either. It apparently is quite popular as it was almost all gone and this was at 6:30sh PM. 

They have 4 different sizes raning from a smidge to a double scoop. I like that they have smidge when you literally just want a very small amount. It's also pretty reasonably priced too for the amount you get. 

will def be back for other tea flavors. SO GOOD.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Loved all the flavors!!! Great idea to get the flight as to try all the speciality flavors too. You can really tell it was made day of.

This place made my tummy feel right at home.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This is a really cute shop. They have tea and coffee, and of course ice cream. We ordered the flight of ice cream which came with five flavors. Each flavor was delicious and unique. It also came with broken waffle pieces. I was quite impress by the uniqueness of each flavor. I would definitely come back to try some more flavors. Cute store with cute settings for photo opportunities.
author: Kat T.

description:
Tried two flavors and both were honestly incredible. San Francisco's Hometown Creamery has flavors that are pretty unique. Many flavors have a spice or floral undertone, which is utterly delicious! I opted for a double scoop composed of Cardamom Honey Caramel and Tea Time on the Thames. It was a delicious combination! Neither flavor was too overwhelming and each complimented the other very well. 

My only complaint, if you will, is that the ice cream melted rather quickly. I decided to take my cone for a stroll in Golden Gate Park, literally a block away. But I found myself struggling to keep the ice cream contained at times.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Apple and Honey ice cream (it was a bit small) and Vanilla.  I liked how they went into the back to pull the ice cream for us since we have peanut allergies. 

A bit icy for ice cream.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Excellent made-onsite icecream. Changing Flavors, like Mayan chocolate and alfajore...the chocolate sorbet had a rich flavor and creamy texture.
author: James R.

description:
I'M SORRY. Am I the odd ball out on this hype?? :( I was looking forward to hop on the bandwagon with all the incredible reviews I saw on this place but I was left feeling quite different from everyone else. 
Maybe when I came, the flavors were not to my liking? I shall come back later on to try other flavors and re-rate if needed. 

SFHC claims to be the only one to make EVERYTHING from scratch on site. The place itself has the whole SF hipstery feel to it. Super cute. The employees, SUPER nice. 

::Ice Cream Scoop Prices:: 
Smidge 2.50
Single 3.95 
Double smidge 4.50
Double 5.95 
Triple 6.95 
Flight 11.95

::FLAVAHHHs::
You get to sample as many as you like. 
Tea Time on the Thames: earl grey and lavender. I LOVE tea flavor things. But somehow this was WAYYYYYYYYYY too much for me.... TOO overpowering...It was a bit off putting to me. Not for everyone I guess!
Kiwi Lime sorbet: exactly what it says, but its SUPER tart, like extremely sour where I made the sour face you would make after eating the extreme sour warhead. 
Sea Salted Caramel: what I ended up with, the best tasting one out of everything else to me. Good, but surprisingly not bold enough in what it states to be.
author: Chena N.

description: This is my favourite ice cream place in the city! The atmosphere is inviting, the staff is kind and knowledgeable, and the ice cream is absolutely amazing! They have so many awesome and unique flavors that it's hard to chose one every time I'm here. I highly recommend getting two scoops so you can have double the delicious! They also have waffle cones or bowls. Ugh just an amazing place.
author: Kamryn K.

description: I love that this creamery makes their own small batches of unique flavored ice cream and waffle cones. Like most ice cream places you can taste the flavors before deciding which one you want. I had the banana bread ice cream in a waffle cone. I loved it. The flavor reminds me of frozen bananas. My boyfriend had the peanut butter one. I'm not completely sure what the name of it was because I feel like there was another flavor component in it besides just PB. That one was pretty tasty as well. Sadly, the cone slipped out of his hand when he had about 1/3 or 1/2 left. He said it was still worth it even if some of it made it on the floor. I definitely want to come back to try their ice cream flights.
author: Nicole S.

description:
This place was started by a couple of local brothers, and it shows that they love the neighborhood in every flavor. They nail their twists in "classic" flavors, and almost always have some creative new flavor to try. The cinnamon flavored cones smell great from a mile away, and taste even better. 

Be forewarned, however.  This place gets busy on warm weekends. The line can get long and obnoxious. But the reward is worth it.
author: Jon L.

description:
This is how ice cream was intended to be. Hand made in small batches with a rotation of interesting flavors, that tastes as rich and creamy as you can imagine. Forget about all of this nitrogen crap or ice cream that's rolled up into a flower. 

At first glance, the smidge looks too small to be taken seriously, but it's actually the perfect size for a little taste. You can also get a flight of 5 different flavors. I got myself a taste of the peanut butter chocolate fudge and...it was glorious.
author: Jeong P.

description:
Ordered The Flight with my friend and you could choose 5 flavors to try! I really like this concept because it wasn't a huge scoop and you could try most of their flavors like this. 
Chocolate Sorbet was so rich.... Like extremely rich.. 
Mint Chip had this mint mojito taste to it... Instead of a regular mint ice cream flavor. 
Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough wasn't too sweet!
Forgot the blueberry flavor name.. But it had frozen blueberry and pancake bits! Very interesting. 
Also forgot the one with almonds and orange peel but it was still yummy. 
Overall if you've never been and you're there with a friend, definitely order the flight! The ice cream all taste very good, I tried flavors that I wouldn't normally try but they were all still delicious. 
Parking will be hard to find since it's in Sunset so you'll have to drive around for a bit!
author: Kristie L.

description: Tried the flight with 5 of their rotating flavors: eggnog, turrón, sufganiyot, ginger, and some sort of fruit sorbet. Although the texture is great, the flavors were not so much. Maybe it's in their efforts to try to keep the ice creams as natural as possible with minimal artificial flavorings, but the flavors were more more on the bland side and not true to taste.
author: Judy M.

description:
Went here for the first time last night and split an ice cream flight with my boyfriend. It was sooo good. Seemed like it might be too much ice cream but we finished it haha. 

Enjoyed all the flavors except for the mint chip. It tasted like real mint and it was a pretty strong flavor, should have asked to try it first. 

For sure coming back for more !
author: Hayley D.

description:
My foodie hunting grounds aren't predominantly Yelp reviews. Nowadays, I just squeal "ooh!" when I see a great looking dish on Instagram or Snapchat, and bother my friends until they tell me where they've gone now. Eating has always been a social event, which is why I love going off of the places that my friends recommend to me. I found San Francisco's Hometown Creamery via someone's beautiful Snapchat, and dragged a good friend from the Haight here.

The line moves fairly quickly, but they're generous with their samples and you don't feel rushed. Paying $12 for a flight is absolutely worth it for the diverse range of flavors you get. There were a lot of tempting ones the day I went, but I eventually settled on fresh mint chip, honey lemon rosemary, chocolate sorbet, Sephardic style haroset, and French press coffee. It came with a bowl of waffle cone crumbles, which I thought was a lovely touch. Note to other social media addicts: these flights are perfect for your next photo update on where you are now.

I highly recommend all five of these flavors. The honey lemon is very strongly lemon, with a rosemary aftertaste. Fresh mint chip tastes EXACTLY like fresh mint, which made me giddy, while the chocolate sorbet was incredibly creamy and flavorful for something that I normally expect to be icy and a little disappointing. I wasn't much of a coffee person when I tried this place out, but it had a strong kick to it that my friend loved. Lastly, I'd honestly never heard of haroset, but I fell in love with the taste. Small batch ice creams seem to provide some of the best flavor I've ever had. Bring a friend and watch them scoop these beautiful globes of ice cream into oversized shot glasses! You'll love it.
author: Gwen W.

description:
It was another beautiful cold, foggy summer Friday evening after dinner when we walked past SF's Hometown Creamery. I love ice cream (especially on cold nights - might just be nostalgia growing up in SF eating ice cream mostly in the fog).  I even make my own ice cream at home so when I pass an ice cream I haven't tried- I must go in! 

It's a relatively big shop - simple menu on the wall with cute little drawings, lots of seating. The best part of this menu is that there is a "flight" option so you can try multiple ice cream flavors. We had just eaten dinner so when I asked my husband if we should get the flight (by we - I meant me), he gave me a "we just ate- let's not overeat" look. It was true - I was stuffed so I took his look as sign to just try samples for now. 

They had a lot of the usual flavors : a chocolate, mint chip, peanut butter chocolate, coffee, coconut, cookies and cream. The unusual suspects were caipirinha, ginger, and black sesame. I tried the caipirinha sorbet - very light and refreshing but I was looking for something creamier. The coffee sample was good too but I ended up choosing the black sesame with miso caramel.  The single scoop came in what felt like a homemade waffle cone too. That cone really made it. I'd highly suggest cone over cup at this place. 

I'll definitely be coming back. Next time, ice cream flight first and dinner last.
author: Veronica L.

description:
I sampled the Khao Niáo Màmuáng and knew I had to get a scoop! It's a play on sweet sticky rice and mango and it's VEGAN :) 

Not only is their ice cream delicious, they make them on site! You can taste all the care and love they put into the ice cream. I'm still dreamin about the ice cream and will definitely return back to try some other vegan flavors and maybe a pint to go!

Side note: I love that they use compostable cups and spoons!
author: Jessica K.

description:
This cute little ice cream shop is a Sunset staple. I came here with a friend to settle my sweet tooth and boy, did it satisfy. 

I tried a few of their flavors hoping to find something special. They had Mint Chip, Cookies and Creme, and a few others but I ended up with the Strawberry Balsamic with cone crumbs on top that the woman behind the counter carefully placed by hand. DELICIOUS. Most of the flavors they had were lighter in flavor.

This place is small but decently sized with enough room to seat about 30 people. There wall even says that they are the only SF creamery that makes small batches fresh each day in-house.

My only complaint is that they don't have MORE flavors. They only had about 10 to choose from and had I not found the strawberry I might have been at a loss. 

Definitely a place to check out if you're feeling a little needy for sweets.
author: Anna P.

description:
Nice service, cute ice cream shop, some cool flavors

+ thumbs up for the cinnamon flavored cone that they serve
+ free water 
+ ice cream doesn't melt fast at all 
+ fairly average prices

Yay. I tried the sesame and it was flavorful and nice!!! Love it
author: Amy V.

description: I'm not exaggerating when I say that the ice cream here tastes phenomenally fresh. I had the mint chip ice cream. It was clear that the ice cream base was primarily made with fresh mint leaves, no fake flavors or additives. The cone they used was also really high quality. You could not only see (and smell) them making it fresh on site, but it tasted like a crunchy cinnamon waffle cookie that complimented the ice cream quite nicely. We saw people get the chocolate too and heard it was good. It looked very rich. Next on the list I guess!
author: Grace A.

description:
Repeat after me. "Best ice cream in SF"

Yup! I said it. And you repeated it. 

After trying a ton of different spots (I mean, tons because ice cream is practically its own food group in my life) SFHC hits the spot. 

I've been endlessly disappointed lick after lick, but after a friend introduced me to this place, I probably won't go anywhere else.

Let's not talk about the runner ups, but instead I'll tell you they have ice cream flights! FLIGHTS of ice cream. AND root beer floats! Ice cream sandwiches, milkshakes, and sundaes oh my. 

Can it get any better? All the flavors you ever want in a smidge, single, double, triple or flight. Two smidges (aka a single) is the perfect amount. What's not perfect is having to pick the flavors you want because everything is so damn delicious. Thus, flight tiiiiime!

Free cone crumble if you ask.

Defuckinglish!
author: Shereen A.

description: Some of the best ice cream in town and everyone there is incredibly friendly and helpful. I love the smidge size, perfect for 2 different flavors because you will want all the flavors.
author: Darren O.

description:
Freshly made waffle cones, curated flavor selection, happy faces.

Perfect spot if you're super indecisive and like ice cream.
author: Loli L.

description:
The ice cream is icy and the mint ice cream is minty.  I know this is what we probably expect when it comes to ice cream, but the whole mouth experience left me feeling more 'refreshed' than creamy-satisfied.  I like creamy ice cream.  

Their waffle cone is in a love triangle with tartine's and salt and straw
author: Choladeva C.

description:
You know when an ice cream place tries too hard with their flavors yet their flavors are funky and aren't very good? Where the concept is better than the conception? Well, that's what's going on here.

Walked in and we were ignored for the most part though no one else was in line.

My friend tried the pineapple champagne and I tried their chocolate and jelly doughnut ice cream and we were both dissatisfied.

First off the jelly doughnut didn't even taste like a jelly doughnut. It just tasted like thick goo. And the chocolate was full of overpowering  cinnamon and spices it made me want to cough.

My friend's pineapple champagne ice cream tasted like fizzy pineapples, she said.

Just plain sad ice cream experience for us.
author: Jack R.

description: This ice cream shop is a local treasure. Great unique and fresh flavors--always changing! This is a photo of the 5-flavor tester. Dank dank and dank, can't go wrong here.
author: Rose J.

description:
I think this might be my new favorite ice cream place ever!!!! I love peanut butter and their pb ice cream is divine :) 

The honey lemon Rosemary flavor is like drinking a fresh cup of lemonade. Get this on a hot day and you won't be disappointed! 

Mint chocolate chip. Get ready for that blast of fresh mint and my fave part about this flavor....it's the chocolate chips that are in little pieces throughout the entire ice cream. 

They had this ginger kumquat one too. Nom nomz!!!

I like how they have the "smidge" size because it gives you just enough to hit the spot.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
A little too hyped up in my opinion. Don't get me wrong, I love ice cream as much as the next person, but besides their homemade waffle cones, I wasn't blown away by anything else much. 

This ice cream place is located in a part of San Francisco where parking can be a total pain in the ass. There's a lot of restaurants and shops around the area so no wonder they decided to plant themselves here. It's fine, but as a driver who's not completely comfortable in San Francisco, this was a bit of a challenge. Eventually I found parking and my friends and I just had to walk a few blocks down to this place. 

They keep a menu outside on the sidewalk to let you know which flavors they will be serving and you'll probably see it as the place with a line out the door. The workers try to work as fast as possible, but they do offer free samples so that does slow it down a bit. To be honest, I'm not sure what flavors I ended up getting. They have a sampler you can do that allows you to order 5 different flavors to try and that was around $10-12 I believe? It's pricey here. 

There are tables and chairs to sit at and a bathroom as well. They keep water cups to the side, and it should be pretty noticeable.

Overall, come back? Uh... Maybe? Personally I prefer Humphry's ice cream over this place, but I'll come back if somebody else drives.
author: Venus L.

description: Get the flight of ice cream. 5 different ice cream flavors of your choice, served with a bowl of waffle cone pieces to cleanse the palate between bites. Ice cream is so fresh, it's made daily in the back of the store.
author: Ashley K.

description:
My sister introduced me to this ice cream joint not too long ago, and now this  place is now one of my favorite shops to get a quick slab of dessert in the city. It reminds me so much of Penny's back when I lived in Santa Cruz by how everything is made in house with fresh ingredients, how often the flavors change (not to mention how unique they are as well!), small cozy interior, price range, homemade waffle cones, and quality over quantity.

I am someone who likes to go weird (go weird or go home, right?!) ; first time around I tried their Lemon Speculoos flavor and second time around I got their Black Sesame with Miso dressing. Both were really good! I like how subtle the flavors are and how they aren't too overpowering in the taste buds. I've also had little licks of the Sufganiyot flavor (a Jewish jelly donut) which was actually pretty good! 

This is a good spot for someone who likes to venture out from ordinary, plain, boring ice cream flavors and a cute date spot! If you can't decide on just one flavor, get the ice cream flight!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
YAY another new & cute little ice cream shop in the inner Sunset :) I was pretty sad that the ramen place that used to be in this location closed, but am now happy that SFHC is in town. What's even better is that this ice cream shop is run by two brothers (even their mom helps create their unique flavors and tasty concoctions!) so everything tastes incredibly homemade (with love!) Too cheesy? But it's true! 

My friends know that I am not a huge ice-cream fan, I mean I enjoy it, but when it comes to experimenting new flavors, I usually stick to what I am comfortable with (aka chocolate, coffee, or green tea). However, SFHC has so many ethnic inspired flavors that it's hard to not to deviate and try something different... i.e. - their "Sufganiyot (Traditional Hanukkah Jelly Donut)" flavor was something I had to try and it was incredible! I've never tasted anything like it. I ended up with a lemon + something else (not the peach lemon thyme sorbet), I'm bummed I can't remember the name!! But it was so good and I was pleasantly surprised that the lemon flavor didn't overpower the taste. I'm in love!!

The best surprise was when we found out that you could still get the smidge sized scoop in a CONE for FREE! (and the fact that the cones are made right in front of you is a huge plus). Loved the interior space too. Must come back soon to try other flavors. Keep doing what you're doing SFHC :) I've told all of my friends to come visit!
author: Grace J.

description:
Went here on a busy Sunday afternoon

Firstly when I came here 3 people were in line in front of me. Took about 15 mins for me to get to the front. And finally when I was up next, this older lady and her daughter/niece goes in front of me "looking at flavors" and then somebody took her order first when obviously I was next in line and had been waiting there for a while. The servers saw me there waiting but they help her first which was rude. So when somebody finally helped me I was a bit pissed off so my face was rbf

Store's decor was pretty with the paintings of the different parts of san francisco.

Staff were not welcoming, except for one guy who was very nice who rung me up for my order.

I ordered the flight which was $13 with tax.

Ice cream quality was not as creamy as "ice cream" texture. It had more of the consistency of gelato. Flavors were very natural and rich. 

Overall would not visit again because better ice cream places in the city.
author: Michele G.

description:
We came here on a Thursday night around 6:30pm and didn't experience any wait! 

We did the ice cream flight (which was only around $12, great deal!) with 5 flavors. We got the chocolate sorbet, mint chip, khao niao mamuang, unity, and peanut butter chocolate fudge. 

Here's the breakdown of the flavors:
Chocolate sorbet: really rich chocolate taste, not much sweetness. Not quite what I am used to or what I like but still interesting to try.

Mint chip: really minty! Not as sweet or chocolatey as what you would expect. Just mostly mint flavor. 

Khan niao mamuang: coconut milk and mango flavor. Absolutely delicious! Couldn't believe that it's dairy-free. AMAZING MUST TRY IT. 

Unity: fun fruity cheesecake flavor, refreshing. 

Peanut butter chocolate fudge: THE ABSOLUTE WINNER OF THE FLIGHT. Tastes like an ice cream version of a Reece's cup. So basically, just absolutely delicious. 

The portions on the ice cream flight are perfect, the scoops are medium sized. We split it between two people and didn't feel too full after.
author: Olga M.

description:
To open an ice cream shop in the bay area is truly a daring feat considering the stiff competition one is up against (Bi-Rite, Mitchells, Humphry Slocombe) just to name a few. These places have truly redefined what ice cream is in their own way so I was curious to see what Hometown Creamery had in store. 

Needless to say, I wasn't disappointed. They had novel flavors coupled with a quaint vibe that made eating ice cream in Dec the best idea we had that night (outside of going to Nopalito). 

Overall Thoughts

In a sea of competition, Hometown stands out among the crowd with its unique flavors and superb execution
author: Eddie W.

description: Best ice cream place i have been to. You must try the fresh mint chip. Its amazing. I wish they were in LA too
author: Serkan K.

description:
Delicious flavors of ice cream, with homemade ice cream cones that are to die for. One of the people I went with got the homemade vanilla, and it was the best vanilla ice cream I had ever tasted. 

I also loved that they keep things pretty simple. They had (I believe) 8 different flavors, which made it so much simpler to pick what I wanted without feeling overwhelmed. I will absolutely be back for more soon!
author: Jordan F.

description:
Stopped by this place as a last spot after a whole day of touring around the city! My friend was
tired from driving and was in need of icecream. This place was the closest option so we decided to go check it out!

Thankfully there was no line when we went
and I got to take my time to try out their flavors. The front row has their seasonal flavors and the back row has their staple ones. I tried their seasonal ones but thought that there was
too many flavors in my mouth. Not my type of jam. However, I saw they had a black sesame with miso ice cream and I tried it out. 

THAT WAS BOMB. It was amazing. The best sesame ice cream I've ever had.  My friend got their mint choco chip flavor and he said it was amazing too. This place is a good small joint to stop by for some quality icecream!
author: Nancy G.

description:
This is becoming a regular stop after dinner when we're around the area.  I love the Mint Chip here, the taste of fresh mint is simply delicious.  While I tolerate artificial mint flavors, when places like Hometown Creamery uses fresh mint leaves, it's the best.  

I never order anything else, but I do try the other flavors with the sample spoons and they're just as good, especially the Malva Pudding with the apricot bits mixed in.
author: Karen L.

description: Ice Cream Flight is super cute and instagram worthy! I'm usually not a fan of black sesame but theirs is a must try! They mix in some condensed milk on top before serving it hehe. The flight also comes with a side of crushed waffle cone which is quite nice :) It doesn't seem to be a whole lot of ice cream but definitely enough for 2-3 people! Service is great but can be a little slow.
author: Mandy H.

description:
SF's Hometown Creamy seems like it should belong in Palo Alto rather than SF. My reasoning:

1) It's bouge. They one-up fancy-pants flavors with their sophisticated combinations and marketable flavor names, such as Earl Grey lavender (recommended, I got a scoop of this--creamy and good tea flavor) , cardamom with salted honey caramel (first time I've seen so many bouge flavors in combo!), and pumpkin spice (for basic PLS fans, of course). The ice cream flight is rather unique, but $11 is a hefty price, especially since the presentation isn't mind-blowing and won't guarantee huge numbers of Instagram likes.

2) There is so much space!!! Many well-known SF ice cream places look like hole-in-the-walls with minimal seating, while SF Hometown Creamery has the space of a restaurant. That being said, it is one of the few ice cream places in SF that's good for groups. (Fun fact: it took over the space for what used to be a ramen place, hence the space and all the Japanese decor with the wooden touches and oriental style awnings)

3) It's a tad bit pretentious. Prices are the standard SF $3.95/scoop, except that--to my discontent--you can only get one flavor for a single scoop :(( Also, the interior has a large display of text on the wall claiming to be "the only creamery in SF to make small batch ice cream completely from scratch". In my opinion, good ice cream places have ice cream speak for itself without the need for blasting bragging rights. And FYI, Shakedown in Tenderloin serves small batch artisanal ice cream made from the purest ingredients... so SF Hometown should erase the italicized "only"? I dislike pretentious advertising, and false advertising is an absolute contraindication!

The verdict: Not bad, but doesn't quite make the cut in the context of the fierce and icy SF ice cream competition. I prefer Holy Gelato in the area, Polly Ann's a little farther, or Easy Breezey when I pretend to be healthy in choosing froyo over ice cream.
author: Edna C.

description:
A lot of my friends have been posting pictures of this place on their Instagram and I've been meaning to come here. Problem is that parking is so hard around this place. So I don't come out of my way to make the trip out here. 

Luckily, I was eating across the street and noticed this place while I was walking back to my car. They're famous for their ice cream flight! You get six small scoops of ice cream in shot glasses! How cool is that?! I opted out because their flavors for that day were not the ones that I am used to. They have flavors like basil, lemon sorbet, banana sorbet and other unique flavors. 

I played it safe and got mint chip and coffee to share with the bf as those were the most "normal" flavors for the day. The mint chip was very refreshing as the mint flavor was really strong and they used dark chocolate chips. My favorite though was the coffee for sure. We also ordered a waffle cone and that was so yummy! We watched the guy make it fresh on the spot. 

They also make all of their ice cream from scratch on site! So maybe next time when I'm feeling more adventurous, I'll go for the ice cream flight.
author: Cynthia T.

description: Very fresh and delicious ice-cream, not too sweet. The best ice-cream I have ever eaten. You should try to fall in love with it!
author: Huong N.

description:
With the hipster ambiance and expensive price, I was expecting a better experience.  

The seating arrangements were pretty poor, as the seats got filled to capacity even though there weren't that many people in the actual place; I think the design and layout could've used some of the empty space better.  Instead, it's probably best if you took your ice cream to go and walked around Irving st/GG park rather than sitting down.

We ordered the 5 flavor ice cream combo.  Came in nice shot glasses and a display, so our cameras (and IG) ate first.  However, I guess my palate's not sophisticated enough to handle some of the more eccentric flavors.  I do admit they've got some bourgeois selections--spicy Mexican chocolate, cardamom, etc.  We went with cardamom (dates), kiwi, banana nut, mint, and vanilla.  Cardamom was...interesting; a sweet Middle-eastern flavor.  I love kiwi's but just couldn't take its almost bitter flavor.  Mint tasted EXACTLY like a mint leaf.  No, that's not a good thing, especially if you're expecting basic mint ice cream.  Banana nut was, well, nutty, and vanilla was vanilla (not a positive, since you're paying a premium for scoop of something you could get for a buck fifty anywhere else).

I think the flavors are seasonal, but unless you want to experiment or test out random ice cream flavors, I'd try one of SF's many other creameries.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Decent ice cream.  I had the earl grey, which was OK.  I still prefer bi rite for that one specific flavor.

I did enjoy their music playlist, while eating my ice cream in 85° heat
author: Angelica C.

description: Great ice cream place! Definitely a lot of people but line move fast. Many special flavors you don't usually see elsewhere, really liked their Bedouin welcome flavor! Full of coffee blast.
author: Grace L.

description: As soon as you walk in you know it's going to be a great experience. Out of the many samples I tried I went with the Creme, it was amazing!
author: Andrew R.

description:
As soon as I passed by this ice cream shop, I knew I had to come in. I came late on a Wednesday night so the place was pretty empty. Their selection isn't too exciting for the most part but they seem to have a few rotating flavors that are a bit more interesting. I tried all 3 of their less common flavors: the Tea Time (tea and lavender), their Dubliner, and their Pear Sorbet w/ Ginger and Sake.

The Tea Time was my favorite. The lavender and tea are both potent and really work together. It does have a slightly grittier texture like red bean ice cream. I didn't mind it too much but of course it'd be even better if it was silky and smooth. The Dubliner was also delicious like a rich chocolate ice cream with an extra kick but I wanted something lighter so I went with the Pear Sorbet. The Pear sorbet is delicious but it tastes like something I can make at home so I'm not sure if it's worth the price. However the sake and ginger did compliment the pear very well so I still enjoyed it.

Overall, this is a great little ice cream shop. If I pass by again, I'd definitely stop by for another scoop.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Love the chocolate sorbet!!! The best ever!!!!
We also tried the fig one (don't remember the name) which was good too. They have rotating flavors but we always bring home the pint size chocolate sorbet...simply love it!
author: Roxane V.

description: I got the flight icecream (5 flavors of your choosing). Great presentation, creative and unique flavors. It is fun for those who want to try different flavors with a friend. I got persimmons sorbet, ginger, egnog, and the others I forgot the name of. I wasn't a big fan of the ginger.. but none of them taste bad. The icecream tastes very home made . Service was great too!
author: Shirley G.

description: Quality ice cream and similar to Penny's in Santa Cruz, texture wise. They don't have a large amount of flavors, but the cool thing is that they make everything in house and rotate flavors. Baklava was my favorite that they had when I went.
author: Alyssa M.

description: First time visiting and definitely coming back! Saadi greeted everyone with warm, genuine smiles. It smells delicious as soon as you walk in. Everything is bright and clean and understated. I love the artwork showing parts of the city and also the map of CA and the world map where customers are from. It reminds me of why I love SF despite some of the recent negatives. The ice cream was so fresh, simple and delicious. The pecan bourbon brownie was amazing. Loved everything about our visit.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
Their ice cream is pretty incredible. I would have given it a 5 but it is a little pricey. I tried to stop by a few times before but was discouraged by the long lines. However it goes by fast and is worth the wait. There's a few counter seats and tables inside. The service is quick and let you try the flavors.

I got a double scoop ($6) of the fresh mint chip and peanut butter chocolate fudge. The mint was so light and refreshing.
