It didn't taste artificial at all compared to what you would get in a supermarket. The peanut butter chocolate fudge tasted like it had fresh peanut butter mixed inside. I was impressed! All the flavors they have here are so unique I can't wait to try more. They also serve ice cream flights which allow you to have a sampling of many different flavors.
author: Linda X.

description:
San Francisco's Hometown Creamery pride themselves in making small batch ice creams completely from scratch on-site.

Their ice cream flavors seem to rotate often and offer a few  innovative flavors along with the standard common flavors. I love that they have a tiny size called the "smidge", so cute! I had the Bourbon Brown Sugar which was sooo good! It tasted like caramelized brown sugar with a hint of Bourbon flavor, really delicious! I paired it with a scoop of Tiramisu on a homemade waffle cone. Creamy, sweet, and good quality. 

I wish they could dip the cone bottom in chocolate to seal the bottom because ice cream leaks out from the tip of the cone and can get messy. Looking forward to more innovation in their flavors. I want to be blown away and try something I've never tasted before!
author: Janny S.

description: It was late and cold, but I asked my friends to get ice cream, and being the best friends they are, they agreed! I saw the ice cream flights on my IG feed lately so I figured we check it out. We got a 5-scoop flight to share between the 3 of us. For the five flavors we chose: The Bubbly Texan (champagne grapefruit sorbet), Black Sesame, Turron, Madagascar Vanilla, and Fresh Mint Chip. My favorites were the Madagascar Vanilla and Black Sesame, the Vanilla won by a landslide. I love it when an ice cream shop has a bomb vanilla flavor, it's so basic, but amazing when made right. I'm not usually a black sesame fan, but this one was delicious. I think this place gets a thumbs up in my book because of the ice cream flight idea, it's so freaking smart, and perfect for ice cream lovers like me.
author: Elaine N.

description: WOW!  Amazing Flavors, we had to try them all!  Looking forward to next time, See you soon Hometown Creamery!
author: Kristy D.

description: 3 1/2 stars. Very good icecream here. The customer service was great and the prices  are good too. The few things that I will say is that they should have a few more flavors especially the basic flavors. Overall a cool place for icecream
author: Devaughn J.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the rest of the day off and finished a pretty gruesome final this morning, so we decided to celebrate by finally going to one of our "must try" bookmarks. Honestly, what better way to rid the nasty taste jamming a semesters worth of material in one night then taking a final than to drown it down with ice cream. 

I had such high hopes for this place and they definitely did not disappoint. The staff was so friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Out of all our "must try" ice cream places we chose this one simply because they have an ice cream flight which was great considering we are super indecisive. This ice cream flight gives you 5 small scoops of any ice cream you choose in the cutest rustic display. Oh and the best part was that it cost us only $12!! I've paid for one scoop of ice cream before and it came out to being $5. Anyway, I loved everything about this place. The ice cream was seriously nothing like any ice cream i've tried before. Their flavors are so unique and even their basic flavors taste entirely different. I highly suggest coming by here and getting a flight or a scoop of ice cream. It's so affordable, the employees are so sweet, the place is hip and cute. I'll definitely be back to try their new flavors!
author: Kayley C.

description: Bleh...flavorless and had an aftertaste to it.  I got the peanut butter chocolate ice cream and yea I've had better...oh and also I found a hair in my ice cream!!!
author: Me V.

description:
Found this place through a friend and decided to try it out. Glad I did! 

Small little shop that make their own ice cream are always worth a treat when trying. My boyfriend and I split a ice cream flight which came with five cups and you get a scoop of whatever flavors that you want. We got classic vanilla, earl grey tea, lemon poppyseed, chocolate peanut butter, and mint chip. My favorite was the lemon poppyseed. It was not what you imagine it to taste like in an ice cream flavor. It was like really rich in its flavor. You can really taste the lemon and the poppyseed. Likewise, with the mint chip, it was real mint flavor not the artificial mint - green - flavor. All the flavors were really rich in their flavor and was true to it. 

A flight came out to be about $11, and it comes with free waffle bits!
author: Stephy L.

description:
Their flavored are as true as they call it. I heard so many people raving about hometown creamery and had to come see for myself. They don't have TOO many flavor a but the ones they have is enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. It's definitely different compared to holy gelato or baskin Robbins.

I got the ice cream flight and it came with five flavors of my choosing. I got the fresh mint chip (you def taste the mint flavor, it's not a smidge of mint), chocolate sorbet (kinda grainy), peach lemon thyme (tangy), tiramisu (strong coffee taste) and vanilla (can't go to a ice cream shop without trying the most "basic" flavor). 

Side note: their smidge size is so adorable!
author: Eva O.

description: Super welcoming and friendly environment! I had the earl grey lavender flavor ice single scoop in a fresh cone and it was amazing. The strong tea flavors were so unique and delicious!
author: Dahna A.

description: As someone who cannot have milk, I always expect to order something overly sweet and fruity. Not here! I always get the chocolate sorbet. It is so full of flavor and tastes so fresh. It is also vegan! The people that work here are always very patient, despite it being busy and people doing a lot of taste sampling. I recommend it on your next visit around the park!
author: Melissa M.

description:
My ice cream fanatic co-worker took me here, one of his favorite ice cream parlors in San Francisco. Has very unique homemade flavors that are made in small batches. They have standard flavors that are regularly available but I would recommend trying the flavors that are in rotation. I've tried Tea Time flavored with earl grey and lavender, and Unity, a cheesecake flavored ice cream with bits of cornbread and berries. Both were delicious with the Tea Time being on the lighter side. I find that the Smidge is more than enough to satisfy any craving. It's deceptively larger than it seems on the display and is only $2.50. 

Great, small-town ambiance with plenty of seating and space for small and large groups. Will definitely be a returning customer!
author: Arielle I.

description:
We order the flight with 5 different favors of ice-cream. We have Strawberry Balsamic , Fresh Mint Chip ,, Khao Niáo Màmuáng , Chocolate, Madagascar Vanilla and horchata!
I love the mint chip favor and it is very refreshing. :-)

I am glad we are able to come by to have ice-cream here...
author: Isabelle L.

description: My cousin and I were in the city looking for some ice cream near us, and stopped here. I'm so glad we did, the ice cream was AMAZING! It's pretty cute inside too and smells yummy! If you love peanut butter, the peanut butter ice cream is awesome, I definitely recommend!
author: Kelsey G.

description:
This place is right in the Inner Sunset.

Ambiance//
This place has great music playing! There are seats inside and counter by the window. It can be a little chilly inside because the door is usually open. The inside of this shop is filled with the aroma of churros! It's great!

Service//
The people working are super young and nice. It can be a bit slow when it is crowded. 

FOOD (THE MOST IMPORTANT PART)//
These flavors are SPOT ON. 

Tea Time: Earl Grey Tea and Lavender. This combination was fabulous, the two flavors melded so well! 

Meyer Lemon is good, but I think lemon is an interesting flavor because I would think the cream would curdle but its so yummy! 

The peanut butter chocolate fudge was amazing. Tasted like a peanut butter cup.

The waffle cones have cinnamon in them and taste like crunchy churros! This is my favorite. You can get the cone crumble on top of your ice cream for FREE! This cone really sets this place above its competition.

My only struggle is that the ice cream is not creamy enough. It is not the decadent, rich, and thick creaminess that Hometown's big competition like Bi-Rite or Mitchell's or Humphry have down to a science. Hometown has great flavor, but the the texture was disappointingly subpar. It was not smooth, but actually icy. And that's why it is 3 stars instead of 4 or 5. It's hard to compete, if you are charging a similar price. 

ALWAYS GET THE CONE CRUMBLE.
author: Vivian C.

description: This ice cream is flavorless. Absolutely the worst ice cream I have eaten in San Francisco. I would rather eat store brand ice cream any day. I had the weekly flavor stout of the Union. It lacks the amount of cream a proper ice cream should have. It taste like it has been refrozen.
author: Daniel N.

description:
Small selection, but quality ice cream. They make the ice cream in store which explains why you get less flavors, but superior quality. I also really like that you can order smaller sizes (the smidge) because I can normally never finish a lot of ice cream. Service is great- they don't mind you trying as many flavors as you want (granted, there aren't that many, but you probably shouldn't try them all). Decent amount of seating in store. Expect a small line to pick up on the weekend afternoon.

But the quality can't be beat.
author: Arezou A.

description: This place snuck up on me a bit, even though it seems to have a nice location near the park, as well as a cheery and interesting interior. I liked the unique flavors and decent vegan options. The actual ice cream, though, was just ok. I thought the haroset was a really neat idea but the execution didn't quite come together.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I thought that the ice cream here wasn't really creamy enough and a little too sweet for my liking. 

Cute place, but not my favorite ice cream. They have some gourmet flavors though. I sampled the Thai mango sticky rice one, which was way too sweet. Chocolate sorbet had a rich dark chocolate flavor but that quickly became too sweet. Mint chocolate tasted like fresh mint but just wasn't creamy enough. I felt that their ice cream was almost icy.
author: Jen P.

description:
Came in after a helping of poke and had a pleasant experience. The atmosphere was rustic and quaint, with wood-paneled walls along with murals and art adorning them. Have to mention that my cashier was extremely friendly, as in, out-of-the-ordinary friendly, and that made my experience even better.

I had a smidge (in-house jargon for "single scoop") of peanut butter chocolate fudge in a waffle cone and it was absolutely delicious. I was craving peanut butter ice cream and this exceeded expectations and more than hit the spot. Relatively, the price for a small scoop was a tad expensive but such is the nature of ice cream made from scratch and I find it totally justified.

If you've got a sweet tooth and need some ice cream, stop in and get some of the peanut butter chocolate fudge!
author: George K.

description:
Over-priced and mediocre at best. Go to sanfranpsycho and get some 3 twins instead.

Texture sucks. Flavors are not very good. I can make better ice cream with the kitchenaid
author: Micky C.

description:
That sweet smell wafting out to the casual 9th street passerby is drool-worthy. This one-of-a-kind sunset local ice cream/sorbet shop is run and operated by two brothers. They make all their flavors and cones on site (hence the party in your nostrils). I treated myself with the coconut lime, lemon poppyseed, and peach flavors. Peach took the win. 

Justifiably, there is always a line, but it moves quickly and they offer you samples as you wait. Swing by this place with the family, after your dinner date, or just whenever you need a little something something.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Hmmmmmm.... this was okay. The flavors seem a bit imbalanced. The mint chip tasted like I was chewing on mint leaves. The special flavor (forgot the name) with amaretto ice cream was overly nutty. I think there were supposed to be anise and raisins but I didn't taste any. There was a special sorbet that was so tart, my cheeks inverted momentarily. Overall, the texture of the sorbet is better than the ice cream. The latter was quite grainy. Waffle cones were fresh and delicate, with not too much of an eggy taste.
author: Shannon L.

description:
What a cool (no pun intended) new ice cream spot to check out!

First off, I loved reading about the two brothers in Hoodline and how and why they started their business. Both of them are incredibly friendly and upbeat - you can tell they're passionate about their ice cream shop.

Ambiance: Fun paintings are hung up on the walls of different SF neighborhoods. The shop itself is decent size with few tables and stools for sitting. It gives off a local family vibe with some cool oldies music playing in the background.

Flavors: SUPER UNIQUE! I tried the Fresh Mint and the mint definitely tasted different and distinct from your usual mint ice cream. I was taken aback after I tried it for the first time. The ice cream was bursting with fresh mint leaf flavor - something that I haven't tasted from any mint ice cream I've had in the past. 

I love that everything (ice cream and waffle cones) is homemade. I read in the article from Hoodline that one of the brothers loves cooking and he constantly makes new ice cream flavors. He uses his traveling experience and what he's learned about different cultures to experiment and add a unique flavor to every ice cream he's created. 

Also, there are more sherbets than I expected. The line of people waiting for ice cream was coming out of the door, but it went by fairly quickly. Since it's still new, they only have about 9 flavors. I look forward to more of their unique flavors in the future! I will come back for sure.
author: Kristal D.

description:
Pains me to write a less than stellar review but I've tried pretty much every ice cream place in SF (artisanal and otherwise) and this place just didn't do it for me.

Decor: Fairly large space and lots of seating. Cool neighborhood-themed art though they don't have anything for the Tenderloin (my nabe!) 

Flavors: Good selection and some interesting flavors but nothing new/exciting when compared to the other ice cream shoppes in town (Shakedown, Humphrey, Mr and Mrs, etc.). 

I tried the vanilla (meh, no depth), caramelized banana (good, I ended up going with this one), and the honey lime rosemary. The tasting was really little...I mean a tiny tiny bit on the tip of the spoon. Other places are much more generous with their samples which makes it easier to commit to a $4 scoop of ice cream.

The texture of the ice cream here was also too frozen/hard/icy. It may be an issue with the freezer but the consistency was really off-not creamy enough given that they make it in house. Maybe it's an issue with their ice cream base? Since they are new, I think working out the kinks in their ice cream texture would make things a lot better.

I had the smidge size on their waffle cone. I thought the come was sort of bland and weirdly chewy. I probably will get a cup next time.

Glad there's an ice cream place on this block since Holy Gelato isn't that great but the clothing store on the same block as this place also sells ice cream (Humphrey's?) that rivals this place. Glad to see a local business give the ice cream scene a try in SF but you gotta come correct with the artisanal ice cream in this town and this place sadly is just OK at this point.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
I'm going to start off by saying that I love homemade ice cream. You can really taste the original ingredients in them. 

This new ice cream joint opened up where the Hotei restaurant once was. It's really open and spacious. It's also decorated with art of sites around the city. The workers were also really nice and engaging. 

I was able to sample a few flavors: strawberry balsamic, peach lemon-thyme sorbet, fresh mint chip, chocolate sorbet, and blackberry sorbet. I loved the fresh mint chip! It was like a mint mojito, VERY minty. I love minty,  menthol flavored things. I also enjoyed the peach, which is what I ordered . It had just the right amount of sweetness. 

When you order you have the option of ordering size: just a smidge for $2.50, single for $3.95, double for $5.95, triple for $6.95, and a flight for $11.95. The flight had a really cute presentation! I saw a couple that ordered it. It's a great way to show off the ice cream and share in a group. I ordered "just a smidge". It is the perfect size for me and I wish every ice cream place had it. I don't eat much. 

I had a great impression on my first visit. Good experience all in all. They also accept card. The only  con would be parking, you may have to park in the park on busy days.
author: Lyra C.

description:
Very chill & spacious ice cream shop! But expensive!!! 

FOOD: I got a small scoop of mocha with almond pieces in a cup. It was very creamy and I could definitely taste the coffee flavors and the almond pieces, but I finished it so quickly...The scoop was pretty puny. :/ I also tried their Sandia Alegria (watermelon raspberry sorbet). I liked the watermelon flavor but it tasted pretty watered down. Their waffles cones are cute though (although I didn't get it)! They only had 10 flavors, which is really not a lot for an ice cream shop.  

PRICE: A small scoop (the size of a golf ball) cost around $4, which is pretty expensive for ice cream. Double is $6 and they also sell smoothie and other sweets. 

SERVICE: There were 2 very cute, muscular guys at the counter helping us out. The shop was very busy but they were very kind and patient. Thanks buds! 

SETTING: The shop is located at a busy intersection in inner sunset, but the interior is very spacious and has 5-6 small tables and also window seats. The ice cream bar is located right in the center of the shop, which I don't think is a very strategic layout, since it can create traffic and block people.

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Great service and awesome shop set-up! However, ice cream is a bit over-priced and not a great selection.
author: Wendy F.

description: The ice cream flight here was pricey but super worth it. My friend and I asked for samples before we chose our flavors. I would highly recommend that you do the same before ordering anything because some of the flavors are really not what you'd except. Definitely one of the better ice cream places I've been to in the area.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Homemade ice cream, cones, and everything, run  by two brothers. I am impressed! 

I walked in yesterday with a friend and was surprised to hear that the place has only been open for a week. The decor and setup has an old fashioned vibe that makes it feel like an old establishment. There were plenty of seats and the counter had maybe 6-8 flavors to choose from. 

I sampled a few flavors but ended up getting the peanut butter chocolate flavor. It was rich and reminded me of Reese's cups. My friend's strawberry flavor was pretty good as well. I asked if they would have more flavors later on, specifically coffee, and he said yes! Coffee is coming up, and flavors will be rotated.

Overall, I would definitely come back. Quality ice cream and friendly service is all I need.
author: Corinna T.

description:
This is a pretty good ice cream spot. All of the flavors are very unique. They have a variety that they change out. 

My favorite was their dark chocolate. 

I will say that you should absolutely try this place, but they are not the best. I feel like none of their flavors are as sweet as ice cream should be. Their mint chocolate was far too minty with too little chocolate. The lavender was a bit strange. 

The flavors just kind of tasted "healthier" without as much sugar. That aside, the ice cream consistency is great and the cookies are pretty amazing
author: Carmen C.

description:
Emoji thumbs up! Emoji heart eyes! Emoji exclamation point!!

My server was super sweet and nice, helped me out with a few samples. I regret not being a pain and asking to try every flavor but it was love at first taste when it came to that cookies cream! I would recommend the Ice Cream flight to anyone who wants to have 5 mini scoops of ice cream on shot glasses! 

I went on a Monday and we found parking right across the street, nothing too complicated! 
Overall, a really nice and pleasant experience!
author: Mavy A.

description:
This was my first time to SF Hometown Creamery, on a rare sunny day in the city! So they make their own ice cream/sorbets. It looks like their menu changes pretty frequently, with some staples that stick around. They have an ice cream rack at the cash register for when you're paying, which holds your ice cream - more shops should have this, it's a great idea!

I ended up ordering the clementine sorbet. The texture was really interesting, it wasn't really smooth, it kind of reminded me of the texture of a snow cone. So, to me, it lacked the creaminess I've come to expect when eating ice cream. It's $3.95 for a single scoop, $5.95 for a double and $6.95 for a triple. I noticed they had flights, which is a cool idea for an ice cream spot, those go for $11.95. Also, they have floats, when I was there they had run out of Coke, but they were still able to make the float.

An aside.. so they sell postcards here. The postcards are of some of the different neighborhoods of San Francisco. They cost $2.75, or 3 for $35 with a frame.
author: Ashley G.

description: There isn't much selection in terms of flavors. I believe there were about 6 or 7 options available. Of the flavors I tried, I found that they were too strong. I ended up getting the mint chip ice cream and vanilla. The mint chip reminded of toothpaste while the vanilla was okay.  Would probably not come back here for ice cream.
author: Patrick L.

description:
I love that this place makes all of their ice cream on-site with fresh ingredients and they regularly conjure up new & interesting flavors.  Their mint chip is made with fresh mint leaves. They even make their own waffle cones & bowls, which I think has a little cinnamon in it that adds to their differentiation from other places. I especially like their "smidge" size cones/cups for when you want just a little bit to satisfy that sweet craving.  

My go to so far has been the Peanut Butter w/Chocolate Chips on a smidge size cone.  I also like their Chocolate Sherbet but it's no ordinary chocolate sherbet.  I would have never guessed that sherbet could be so creamy and rich in texture.  And their chocolate flavor isn't the typical milk chocolate sweetness, it's more like a dark chocolate level sweetness which I personally have grown to like. 

I've had good ice cream in other parts of the city but none which makes me intuitively think of them first whenever I am feeling for some ice cream.  I always think of SF Hometown Creamery ice cream whenever I'm in the area.
author: Jen C.

description:
New place in the inner sunset. They make waffle cones in house. They put a touch of cinnamon in it. 
I got the watermelon raspberry sorbet. It was good, except a bit watery.

They come in different sizes. They have a size smaller than single scoop called a smidge.
author: Karen Y.

description: With so many fancy new ice cream options in the city, this place still manages to stand out despite its small menu of flavor options.  The flavors they do have are executed well.  They also have lots of size options which I appreciated ("smidge", single, smidge-double, double, and triple).  My only complaint is their waffle cones are a bit small for a double scoop.  Mine crumbled quickly and it left the bottom scoop wide open on one side, so I had to scarf it down before it melted all over me.  Otherwise, it was delicious and I enjoyed my Madagascar vanilla and peach cobbler!
author: Annie R.

description: Nice ice cream spot close to Golden Gate Park. Their rotational flavors are great--try the Earl Grey and Lavender during the winter season if you like floral-flavors in your ice cream.
author: Johnny M.

description: This little ice cream place is so wonderful. The owners and the staff are so friendly. And the home made small batch ice cream is always so creative and fresh. My go to is the mint chip!  The ONLY thing I wish they had was a suggestion box, where we could put our ideas for flavors in there - I'm hoping for vanilla lavender one day :)
author: Sarah S.

description:
Great flavors, super nice staff, and they're generous with the samples - but, as others have noted, the texture is a bit weird. It's kinda crumbly, which is strange for an ice cream. Not very creamy... 

Still tasty, though. I had the Belgian beer/Stroopwaffel flavor, which was both unique and delicious! I paired that with the peanut butter chocolate fudge, which was also quite good. Got 'em in a bowl with crushed waffle cone (free!) on top, and a side of chocolate chip cookies (I'd skip the cookie next time; it wasn't great).

I also tasted the apple pie-flavored ice cream, which I was super excited for, but I found it pretty bland. 

Overall, I'd be happy to come back and try some of their new flavor creations. I also love the idea of an ice cream "flight", which was super cute... We'll see if I feel like sharing ;-)
author: Liz F.

description: Their Earl Grey Lavender flavor brings balance to the Force. I've been craving it for days! Smidge here and smidge there... I can't wait to try all of their other flavors. This is my new favorite place!
author: Yad L.

description:
I used to make my own ice cream,1 quart at a time at home. It has been awhile since I had time for that, so finding this shop was quite a treat!! It was refreshing to see the efforts, time and thought that goes into this ice cream.  
I have been there 2x now (only because it is a bit of a distance for me) and with quite a few people each time so I got to try many flavors. All of them have been excellent.
It is run by 2 local brothers who have poured their hearts and souls into this place and that shows up in the care taken to formulate and create beautiful and luscious toothsome treats. Everything is made seriously from scratch. I hadn't known this, but many ice cream places that boast "hand made" ice cream use a base starter, an unflavored cream, egg and sugar mixture that is bought from somewhere else. Having made my own ice cream for years, I can tell you it was really disappointing to learn some other shops "cheat" in the way. Not SF Hometown, they make their own each day, super fresh. It also lets them change ratios of cream, sugar and egg to allow for a larger variety of flavors and textures.

The shop is actually quite large for the area it is in. The decorations celebrate San Francisco in a really great way as well as allowing the out of town visitors a chance to place their mark on a wall map with a pin. It is super fun looking at how people from all over the world have been to the same place as me :)
Wait time was great, even on that terrible over-100 degree day last year (2017), the wait time was under 20 minutes with a line out the door. Not bad considering each person in front of me wanted to try most of the flavors, lol!  Other shops had run out of ice cream (had to use a pre-made base, haha!) 
The staff were friendly, helpful and considerate, even under pressure :)
author: Cris O.

description: Im not usually a big ice cream eater but was really excited by the idea of homemade ice cream with fresh and local ingredients. Since trying my first bites of the mint chip and then the hibiscus I was hooked! They are so delicious and they actually taste like the fresh ingredients they are made of, compared to the artificial stuff you find at the grocery store. I unfortunately don't live in SF, so when they come out with a new flavor I must try I have resulted to making my friend go pick some up for me and save it for my next visit. Yes it's that good!
author: Janae W.

description: Want to try ice cream you have never seen before? At least to me! I'm from the Central Valley there is nothing that compares to this ice cream anywhere from where I'm from. I got the lemon poppyseed ice cream and my goshhhh!!! So creamy and lemony and amazing!! The ginger chamomile was like a frozen tea! It was so refreshing with that hint of ginger. I also tried a chocolate chip cookie and it was so soft and chewy and amazing! Come to the Central Valley! We need unique ice cream!!
author: Jaisen A.

description:
YUMMM. I think I'm in love with this place. Freshly made ice cream heck yes. The waffles are just as fresh. The very first second you step inside you will smell the amazing aroma of fresh cinnamony waffles. Then you will receive perfect service. By perfect I mean that they will spend as much time as you need sampling flavors without getting impatient with you. I actually got to try almost all of today's flavors because the server was super accommodating. 

We ordered a Flight($11.95+tax) which includes five flavors of your choice and a cup of waffle pieces. After sampling most of the flavors, my friends and I came to a conclusion that we wanted more of the:

Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge- absolutely amazing, it's my favorite flavor of the night, there's the right amount of peanut butter and chocolate goodness all in one bite. GET THIS. 

Chocolate Sorbet- lol I thought this would be icy and kinda fruity flavored, I really didn't know what to expect but man this was pretty darn good, it's like sweet dark chocolate melted that is extremely chocolatey and creamy

French Roast- its like iced coffee but ice cream form, the coffee flavor is so powerful it's good 

Caipirinha Sorbet- oh this was so refreshing and the least sweet, it kinda tastes like tequila

Fresh Sesame- it's super creamy and had a subtle sesame taste, not as rich as the other flavors

Anyways, get the peanut butter chocolate fudge. But honestly you can't go wrong with any of their flavors. So, get the peanut butter chocolate fudge though, like really.
author: Wendy T.

description: I sampled the basil, black sesame, and honey lemon rosemary before choosing to order a smidge size of the basil. The basil ice cream was sooo savory.
author: Connie K.

description:
Yay, no line!! Lucky me. I didn't think the hardest decision I have to make here is not their flavor but if I should get their smidge cup size or a small. I like how they offer a tiny smidge cup for those who just wants a bit of dessert, but I opt for the small knowing my sweet tooth is going to regret getting anything smaller. I ordered the Purple Rain (vanilla base with blueberry sauce and pancake chunks). I thought the pancake chunks was a creative idea, but I did not care for it at all. It starts to taste like stale pancakes that accidentally fell into my ice cream. The ice cream itself was smooth and velvety, I can definitely go without the pancakes. It's slightly on the sweeter side but it's expected from an ice cream.

Would like to revisit to try some other flavors.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This is such a cute place. We tried the flight of ice cream. The lady helping us was very nice and polite. I forgot the flavors we tried but you cannot go wrong with any of them.
author: Karen G.

description:
I went in with high expectations and I was a little disappointed because there weren't as many flavors as I expected. And the flavors were pretty generic and bland.

It's not bad, but it's not as great as I thought. 

I got the Strawberry Balsamic in a single ($3.95) and it was a little too milky for me, but not bad. 

My friend got the Matcha Green Tea in a smidge ($2.50). It was super tiny and I hate green tea so can't say anything for that.

The scoops are pretty small and the waffle cone is really good! I believe it's homemade. 
You can also ask for little pieces of the waffle cone if you get your ice cream in a cup.

I think a lot of people come here and get the flight, and that's probably better because you get to try a couple of different flavors at once.
author: Esther Y.

description:
I'm feeling very conflicted. 

I love that SF Hometown came into the ice cream business with a new idea. No doubt they are unique, as they are the first place in the area that make their ice cream from scratch (no joke, they do it right there on site). I love the innovation they bring by introducing flavors you don't typically find. It's all great, but I'm worried that it's the reason that many people are having hit or miss experiences. You really have to knock the execution out of the water if you want to successfully make ice cream from scratch and offer flavors that most people aren't familiar with. 

I ordered a double scoop of the Tea Time and Banana flavors, and while I did enjoy the ice cream overall, don't think it lived up to the hype of being this revolutionary place. Now, the service here is fantastic, so let's get that out there. The guys who work here have a passion for ice cream and were absolutely pleasant to speak to. They made a place that has a fun vibe and sort of hipster feel to it. Fun music always playing, cool San Francisco decor. Overall, there's plenty of room for improvement.

Final verdict: SF Hometown is definitely a unique ice cream shop. The staff here are passionate and very personable, always making sure you walk out happy. The area in which they may falter is not the service, which is always great, but the execution of the ice cream itself. As a place that is known for making their stuff from scratch and offering innovative flavors, it could mean a hit or miss experience depending on your own taste. For me, a bit too soft. For others? It could very well be your new favorite spot.
author: Alex B.

description: I was so excited about this place cuz it is the only one that serves flights of ice cream that I am aware of. I just like the insta photo. It comes with 5 flavors and they literally put it in shot glasses so you can reference the size of the scoop. Unfortunately I didn't get the flight because the flavors were not that appealing. I tried the mint, tea, and peanut butter and all had very strong tastes. Peanut butter fudge was the best but the flavors didn't thrill me.
author: Amy H.

description:
I LOVE SF HOMETOWN CREAMERY. I've been meaning to write a review for this place especially since I've been here a thousand times.

So one day I was having dinner with a friend and we stumbled upon this ice cream shop on 9th & Irving and ever since that day, I've been hooked! It's owned by these two brothers who are always super cool and friendly when they talk to you. I haven't been seeing them much now that business is booming and they can afford to have more employees, but everyone there is super nice!

I remember reading an article about how they're one of the first ice cream places to be specially licensed pasteurizers which means they can make fresh ice cream in-house. So cool!! This allows them to experiment and make as many ice cream flavors they want! Each time I go there, they always have something different to try. From Alfajores cookie ice cream to a grapefruit mimosa sorbet. Even their vanilla is amazing! Especially with their hot fudge...ugh schmackalackinnn. Even their chocolate chip cookies are to die for. Sometimes they have the chocolate chip cookie with not that many chocolate chips which is a rare treasure to me hahah. You can even buy a flight of ice cream if one flavor isn't enough for you. AND they make your waffle cone fresh off the iron! 

Man, just everything about this place is so great. I love it. Definitely come here as much as you can. It's the freakin greatesttttttt.
author: Melissa M.

description: One may debate about true happiness. Today, it was your chocolate ice cream. Thank you for attentive service!
author: Ally M.

description:
Inised to live around the corner from here. I was a big fan of Hotei, the noodle shop that was based in this space, so i was sorry to see it go. But i'm glad that a quality establishment like this has taken its place. 

It's a responsible business and by report they source locally and make everything on premise without any artificial flavors. They even have a waffle iron where they make the cones, rolling them up on site!  That is important but would not count for much if the product were not high quality...but it definitely is great ice cream!

They Make a few classic basic flavors...i had the coconut and peanut butter/chocolate. The coconut was not to sweet but had chunks of real coconut so that was good. The peanut butter abs chocolate was different from what you might expect at Baskin and Robbins, the peanut taste was blended...rich but not overwhelming.

My wife did very well with the carrot cake (amazingly close to the real thing) and the baklava, which was hands down the best offering.

Definitely a place to visit!
author: Alan S.

description: Yum!! I got the fresh mint chip and was really impressed with the flavor! It is not just mint chip.. It lives up to its FRESHness. Super yummy, friendly staff and good amount of indoor seating. Their size smidge was perfect for a post dinner dessert.
author: Meagan C.

description: Super cute, clean place with incredible ice cream!! The mint chocolate chip is to DIE FOR!! They use quality ingredients and real mint. They also have lactose free options. I can't wait to go back!!
author: Rach M.

description:
I was walking around the sunset district after a great meal at Art's Cafe and found this cute ice cream spot. First, the interior of the business is very unique. A great mix of simplicity with cozy atmosphere. The smell of fresh brewed coffee and waffle cones entices anyone that walks by. There are plenty of seats and customer service was friendly.

Now to the ice cream! I hate to be a critical reviewer here but SF has some amazing creameries and Hometown has some tough competition. Hometown's ice cream had some great flavors that were very strong. This was a big positive! But the one area that I cannot forgive was the iciness of the ice cream. The consistency of my scoop tasted like a milky gelato. It may have been a bad batch or just their style but my experience did not move me to rate Hometown with a 4 or 5 star which should be reserved for the top creameries in the city.

I will give it another shot and hopefully update my review!
author: Eric K.

description:
Ice cream is my absolute favorite dessert! Even when I roll out of a restaurant completely full from dinner, if I spot an ice cream parlor, I HAVE to have it. A second stomach somehow emerges as I rummage for a lactaid pill in my purse.

Hometown Creamery is known for their ice cream flight - 5 flavors of your choice in cute little shot glasses for $12. I was tempted to get this, but I didn't find enough flavors that tickled my tastebuds. They also have smidge sizes, which are perfect for kids or if you're not that hungry. 

I must have gone on an off night the other day because most of the flavors were unoriginal and mildly flavored. They had your run-of-the-mill chocolate, vanilla, mint, and coffee flavors, but even the more "inventive" ones were peanut butter fudge, rocky road, and a kiwi sorbet. I settled on peanut butter fudge and coffee and while they were good, the ice cream lacked a creamy dense texture and the cones leaked really easily. Service was average - the type where you have to say hi first and samples seem like a burden. 

I loved the ambiance though. Glass windows adorned with icicle lights and artwork on the back wall featuring multiple San Francisco neighborhoods. Good amounts of bar stool and table seating. Any ice cream shop is a welcomed addition to the neighborhood, but I didn't have the wow factor that I was hoping for. Hometown doesn't claim to be like a Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe, but even against Mitchell's, Fenton's, and Swensen's, it was just okay.  I'd be willing to come back if I'm in the neighborhood, but definitely not a destination spot.
author: Deanna Y.

description:
I tried this after a long hike through Kirby Cove to see the Golden Gate Bridge, and it hit the spot. I had the Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge ice cream in a waffle cone. It was fantastic. According to their menu, they keep this item on due popularity in the town. I also sampled the Peach Cobbler ice cream while I was there. It was good, but probably only if you REALLY love peach cobbler.

I went around 4:30-5:00pm on a weekday and it was not crowded at all. Ordered and served right when we walked in.
author: Hayley C.

description: Meh ... the flavors didn't do it for me. The only one remotely interesting was the black forest cake flavor, which promised drunken cherries - but I didn't bite into any, and it was a tad too chocolatey for me. My friend got chocolate sorbet, which again was too intense for me (bitter), and fresh mint chip, which some people enjoy.
author: Mallika B.

description: Definitely a wonderful surprise! This ice cream "float" allowed us to sample their wonderful ice cream! Thai coconut, peanut butter, mint chocolate chip, horchata, and their coffee one (I forgot the name). All tasty and distinct. I will be back soon!
author: Felicia M.

description:
We were faced with the ultimate decision while standing on the corner of 9th and Irving- do we go for our usual froyo at Easy Breezy or do we give Hometown Creamery a try? We decided to go with something new that night, but I can't help but feel like we chose poorly. 

Starting with the service. I mean how much service do you really get when buying a scoop of ice cream? In this case, it was enough to make me feel like I didn't need to go back. The workers came off as unhappy and unfriendly-- which is so weird because it's the opposite of how ice cream usually makes me feel!

Anyway, the teeny tiny scoops of ice cream didn't really help things either. I was expecting extra creamy melt-in-your mouth ice cream, but what we got was just plain 'ol ice cream. Which, to be fair, still melted in my mouth, but missing the extra creamy part.
author: Tiffany U.

description:
A cute ice cream stop with great, bold flavors. My favorite: mint chip - refreshing and packed with the taste of fresh mint! Other well done flavors: tea time (earl grey & lavender) and peanut butter. Definitely get your ice cream on one of their delicious waffles cones made on site.

I appreciate the different size options here ("smidge" is the perfect size for when you just need a little something to satisfy that sweet tooth craving). Service is consistent & friendly and you can tell the owner, who I always see on site, really cares about the quality of the final product.

Would give it five stars if the ice cream was a bit creamier, but that is just my personal preference!
author: J C.

description: Cool flavors, gives you that "homey" smell as you walk in. Friendly staff, needs more seating.
author: Ryzzy O.

description: Went here for the first time last night with my family after having dinner in the area. Never even heard of this place before, and my father who loves ice cream wanted to try it. We got different flavors, but the popular one was the Salted Caramel. As for me, I got a double scoop of Peanut Butter Chocolate and Cookies and Cream. We all enjoyed our ice cream on a rainy night in the Inner Sunset.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
*This is a 'first impressions' review*

SERVICE: The lady that was helping us did not seem too enthusiastic about helping us. She did not have a lot to say about their unique flavors or the fact that they offer an ice cream flight. That's right, a flight, as in 6-7 different flavors in one order. Nonetheless she was helpful so I can't complain. There was a gentleman who thanked us for our business on our way out which was nice. It made the visit seem less 'cold'. See what I did there? Because ice ..cream is...col.....nevermind. Moving on! 

FOOD: I ordered the Dixie..Stick? I forget the name but basically it was a cinnamon ice cream with peach chunks in it. The ice cream was very creamy and semi-sweet. I also sampled their strawberry balsamic and some other one with raisins, almonds and biscotti. Fantastic. My sweet tooth was singing!

ATMOSPHERE: Probably my favorite part of this place. When you walk inside, it feels like you're walking into a cabin high in the mountains. The interior and furniture is all wood. There are beautiful pictures of San Francisco's landmarks mounted on their left wall and in the center of the place is where you'll find all the ice cream. In the back, by the self-serve water, you'll find a world map where you're welcome to place a pin into your home country. Again I'll mention their ice cream flight, which I consider a part of their 'atmosphere'. I think it's real special for people like me who just want to taste every flavor and each flavor's cousins and uncles and moms and...and.... I LOVE ICE CREAM! :P
author: Greg Y.

description: Smidge of khao niao mamuang (Thai coconut milk with fresh mango purée and sticky rice). A M A Z I N G. I was thoroughly shocked how much I enjoyed the flavor. I'm not a mango person but boy it was amazing. The service was great, happy people, decent sized scoop, and just really friendly. Talked with the waffle making cashier about their process of making their ice cream by scratch. He was awesome and added a more welcoming feel.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Came here with two friends on a Sunday night and ordered a scoop of the French Roast ice cream on a waffle cone. I must say that that was the most amazing scoop of coffee ice cream that I have ever tasted. It truly had a strong taste of a dark roast coffee within the scoop of creamy sweetness. I got to try other flavors such as the black sesame which is also a wonderful delight. The fresh ginger flavor is amazing as well, reminding me of warm ginger milk that a friend of mine would conjure in college. The waffle cones have a distinct and sweet taste that can only come from a unique homemade recipe. Another thing to note is that all their ice cream and waffle cones are made on site which is super neat! 

Looking forward to coming back here as the flavors are constantly exchanged for brand new mouthwatering experiences! That popular ice cream flight is looking mighty good. :P
author: Joshua M.

description: SF Hometown Creamery offers some excellent homemade ice cream and some very unique flavors! I sampled quite a few but settled on the black sesame, which was probably one of the best black sesame ice creams I've had. The other thing that I really like about this place is that they offer a mini size called a "smidge" for a very reasonable price of $2.50, for those without a huge appetite for dessert. It even comes on a mini homemade waffle cone! So cute!
author: David K.

description: The place has interesting flavors but is overhyped. The interior is quite nice. Still has a Japanese feel. Black Sesame is a must but i think marco polo is better. The waffles are cute but a bit too sweet.
author: Brian C.

description:
Super tasty flavors and a really good idea to offer a flight so you can have larger tastes of all of them. The venue is really great as well. We liked all the flavors, but my favorites in order were:
Carrot cake - sweeter but had everything from the cream cheese icing to carrots and nuts
Strawberry balsamic - classic and really strong flavor
Banana sorbet - tastes really strong like bananas, would go great with the peanut butter fudge
Matcha green tea - less sweet and really good flavor
Baklava - like carrot cake it had all the parts including pistachios, phylo dough, nuts and was questions sweet

Definitely a place to check out!
author: Phil D.

description: Great flavors, wish the texture was a little more creamy (think BiRite or Smitten).  SF Hometown is a little more wattery and runny.  The flights are a great idea that let you sample an assortment without having to order a bunch of singles, but it does cost you at ~$12 a flight.
author: David C.

description:
WOW! 

I'm very picky with my ice cream especially since I'm lactose sensitive. As soon as I walked in the place had a "warm family vibe." Keep in mind I just came back from visiting California Academy of Science on FREE day with a few friends and we were all tired and exhausted. And of course we were freezing our butts off. 

While in line it was very easy to scope the prices and flavors to see what we were going to order. I personally tried the lemon with rosemary, and BASIL. BASIL RIGHT? Isn't that and ODD flavor to taste? But guess what, it was DELICIOUS. 

That being said, I ordered a 2 "smidge" serving of cookies and cream and lemon rosemary. 

The gentleman was very kind and transparent. He told me straight up that the lemon they MADE on that DAY was not put together really well so he suggested putting in a cup over a cone. I said yea sure no problem! 

Because of that gesture of transparency, they definitely get one more star. 

Great vibe, GREAT MUSIC, I'm an advocate for music at places to eat. The ice cream was delicious.End of story. 

If you're not feeling consuming a full single scoop serving, a smidge is pretty appropriate.

Great for dates
author: Huy H.

description:
I love the ice cream here - it is unusual but yet authentic and real.  The fresh mint chip is to die for. Very refreshing and full of spearmint flavour. The peanut butter chocolate tastes literally like you're eating a Reese pieces.  The strawberry balsamic was probably my least favourite although it's still very good. I just wished it included some strawberry chunks.

The cone is freshly made!
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Meh. Once again, another ice cream place disappoints. I was raring to try this and finally got to it. The flavors are inventive, but the execution is not there. I tried the peanut butter chocolate chip, earl gray/lavendar, and fresh mint chip. The place touts the fact that they are the only creamery to do EVERYTHING FROM SCRATCH, but whoopdeedoo, it isn't really that tasty. The texture was pretty light and the flavors were not concentrated enough for my palate. Granted, I make my own ice cream, which many have asked me to start selling, so yes, I am a bit of an ice cream snob.

I didn't love the peanut butter chocolate chip and the earl gray/lavendar was light on the earl gray and heavier on the lavendar, but not intense enough for my tastes at all. I usually know I don't like "fresh mint chip" ice creams because often people use spearmint, which makes the ice cream taste like toothpaste. There is a HUGE difference between spearmint and peppermint - peppermint is your candy cane and your "normal" mint flavor. Spearmint is toothpaste and gum. Gross. I am a peppermint mint fan all the way and mint ice cream should never be anything else. So, I was curious to see whether they could make a good fresh mint chip and my curiosity has been sated - the answer is NO.

The worst part of this was that I definitely felt obliged to buy and didn't want to hold up tasting more flavors and finding more flavors I was disappointed in, so I went ahead and got the smallest option there was, a "smidge" that cost $2.50. In a way it worked out, since I didn't want that much, but it also made me think that this was so typically SF. A smidge is literally maybe 2 tablespoons of ice cream...I brought my smidge back and my friend said, "Is that a sample?" And I said, "LOLOLOLOLOLO NO. I paid $2.50 for this".

The bright side is that unlike other gourmet ice creameries in the city, this place actually has seating. It is spacious, a nice place to hang out, aesthetically pleasing, and has tea and other things for the non-ice cream crowd.
author: Christina K.

description:
It's just okay. A little disappointed after my visit. Maybe it was just what they had on their menu. But I did talk to the staff and he mentioned to me which flavors are on the regular menu and those flavors wasn't great, except for their Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge. It's not creamy enough and some lacked in flavor, like their **Salted Caramel. Couldn't even tell. Didn't have much caramel to it as well. 

My friend and I got the flight. Thought it would have been cool to experience that. It was actually hard for us to choose 5 flavors. None of the flavors on Saturday night stand out. I would assume, they should have their best flavors on weekend because they would get most traffic. We got **Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge, Sea Salted Caramel, Crème Fraîche with Candied Ginger and Kumquats, Cookies and Cream and Madagascar Vanilla. My favorite that night was the peanut butter but its really rich, I wont be able to do a cup full. The flight size was enough and I shared it with my friend. Creme Fraiche was refreshing. Very light and I did like the ginger and kumquat to it. Cookie and cream was cookies and cream. Nothing special. And their Vanilla, and vanilla is my favorite flavor if I had to choose a ice cream. But this one just did not make it. Not creamy enough and I think it lack some flavor. My flight of ice cream was $11.95. I think its expensive for a little ice cream but I got the full experience. But I am going to come back and try the other special flavors, like early grey and sesame. Really wanted to like this place. The staff was super friendly tho. Nice open space for a creamery.
author: Sandy B.

description: 1 Star for the chocolate chip cookie. Negative stars for the ice cream. First and last time there. Over churned ice cream, vanilla bean ice cream had crystallized and started turning into butter. Afterwards mouth felt like I had eaten a raw butter. Couldn't finish one scoop.
author: Ruben E.

description:
This place has the greatest mint chip ice cream I've ever had in my life. EVER. LITERALLY. EVER. I love Hometown Creamery for this reason. I've been here a couple of times and their fresh mint chip never fails to disappoint. If you're a fan of mint chip ice cream, try Hometown's asap. It tastes like fresh mint. Like actual mint, not artificial mint flavored but actual mint leafy taste. With chunks of chocolate chips in it. If you're as obsessed with mint as I am, you will die from happiness. They have a small selection of flavors, but everything is made with fresh ingredients in the store. Even the cookies and the waffle cones! I've tried their other flavors, but I'm not a huge fan of fruity ice cream flavors so I always go back to the fresh mint chip. Their peanut butter fudge is also really good -- super creamy, chocolate-y and VERY peanut buttery. Their waffle cones are also incredible. I'll admit, I'm usually the type of person that usually gets ice cream, devours the ice cream and tosses the cone. I'm just not really into cones because they're usually too crunchy and hurts my mouth. But wow, these cones. They're amazing, freshly made and doesn't hurt my mouth so I actually eat the cone here LOL. They are better than your average cone. Not too crunchy, but definitely not soft, you just gotta try one to get what I mean. They're addicting. 

The shop itself is very cute. It's pretty large for an ice cream shop. There's plenty of seating and interesting artwork along the walls to look at. They have paintings of different districts in the city. You can also see the room with the giant ice cream maker in the back, which is pretty cool. Service is always very friendly. They have ice cream flights for ~$12, which I have yet to try. But they come in these little glass jars in a wooden box thing which is so freaking adorable. Ugh, I love this place. GET THE FRESH MINT CHIP IN A WAFFLE CONE. YOU WON'T REGRET IT!
author: Amy T.

description: Really enjoyed the mocha almond fudge. The Aztec chocolate was interesting, but I think the spices would be a bit much after a while
author: Bob F.

description: Amazing ice cream and sorbet + amazing service = five stars. They told me how they made their chocolate sorbet.
author: Ofir H.

description: I can't believe this place doesn't have a higher rating! Came here on a Thursday evening after dinner in the Sunset and there wasn't a line. The girl who helped me was super nice and happy to let you try different flavors. I love the sizing options they offer since they accommodate people who want A LOT of ice cream, down to just a smidge or double smidge if you want a little taste of two flavors. They even have smidge-sized cones! Tea Time on the Thames (Early Grey & lavender) was delicious as was the Khao Niáo Màmuáng (mango sticky rice with coconut milk) flavors. Definitely recommend stopping by to check out their unique offerings and four staples as well.
author: Teresa L.

description:
Eh. I wanted to like this place but it just didn't make the mark for me. The actual ice cream is not as creamy as I would have expected and service was kind of slow. Granted we ordered the flight. 

I found it a little annoying that my friend ordered her flight and the guy was in the middle of helping her and when another worker was available, she tried to help someone else. When I said I was next the guy helping my friend said he "got me".... I told him I was ordering a separate flight from my friend and he said he still got me. It didn't make sense bc we were ordering separately and paying separately so I should have been helped first. 

Anyways my favorite was the ginger and least favorite was the chocolate sorbet (too rich for me).
Cute presentation with the flight boxes (although it got a little messy). 

I personally wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if you do come, get the ginger!
author: Elaine L.

description:
Kind of pricey, though flavors are fun and refreshing - $4 for a single scoop and $2.50 for a kid's scoop. 

I tried a few flavors and settled on the fresh mint, which had a good kick to it, but halfway through my scoop I realized that it was missing some amount of depth to it - tasted a tiny bit watery and could be creamier. AKA scoop disappeared in 6 minutes instead of the usual 2 minutes. Might come back for dessert if I were in the area, but with SF having so many new places to try, will probably not.
author: Jenn W.

description:
I haven't been WOW'd by ice cream since like 4-5 years ago when I first tried Bi-Rite. This place tops it! Why is this the first time I stumbled across this little gem?! I ordered Tea Time which was a mixture of early grey and lavender and my boyfriend ordered the peanut butter chocolate and we both got waffle cones. What our total was less than $10?! Is that even possible in SF anymore? Haha, now I love this place even more. They make their waffle cones fresh in store- we were watching the guy make it in front of us too.  

Back to the ice cream. Mine was super light and after devouring it like a 10 year old I didn't feel bloated like it was loaded with tons of cream and sugar. I even ate some of my boyfriend's ice cream and I don't even like peanut butter. This is our new ice cream spot! And the shop itself is super cute. I think I'm going to have to come back tonight after dinner.
author: Dara S.

description:
I read about these guys online and they had great reviews.  So, I was so excited to stop by with my family.  During my first visit, I bought the flight.  Although it's a bit pricey it's a great way to check out their flavors and share them with your loved ones.  The ice cream flavors are all unique and made in house. The brothers are extremely friendly and helpful.  I asked to sample a lot of the flavors during my first visit so I'm glad they didn't get annoyed of me.  

I've been here several times since and one of my faves is there mint chocolate chip ice cream.  It's seriously the best mint chocolate chip ice cream I've had.  I love their unique flavors and they seem to change every so often which is great!  They also sell cookies, shakes and other goodies.  My little boy isn't as adventurous as I am with ice cream flavors so he tends to stick to his regular fave ice cream flavor - coffee, which we haven't seen here yet but I'm sure we will sometime and would love to try it.  You definitely know they're using the best ingredients in their products.  I'm a fan!  The service is great and space is welcoming and spacious.  It's a great place to go to after you've had lunch or dinner at one of the many restaurants in the hood.  Will definitely return again and again!  Try the mint chocolate chip when you go.
author: Christine P.

description: Black sesame was packed with flavor and perfectly creamy and dense. The homemade cone was also amazing.
author: Erin C.

description:
Been here twice. Never had a bad experience here. 

I came here after eating San Tung down the street. Not sure if being in a primarily Asian food neighborhood or just me coming in during a strange time (a little past noon) but both times had no lines to wait in. Not a bad thing, just something I noted. 

The ice cream flavors change quite often. Which meant I got a whole new selection of ice cream to choose from each time. Although the strange flavors combinations might put you off, don't be fooled! Try every single one of them. The chocolate sorbet is quite possibly the best one of them all. They have no issues in you trying every single flavor. Prices are on par for what to expect from a higher end ice cream place, not too far out from SF averages. But the quality of their ice cream certainly shows. 

Their customer service is top notch. They're helpful and very accommodating. No complaints there. Decor is nice if you're into that sort of thing. 

Would come back again. Can't wait to see what new flavors they have to offer next time.
author: Elliot W.

description: I had something like the lemon poppy seed ice cream.  I love lemon ice cream.  The more tart the better.  But this one was just sweet and bland.  There was barely any flavor of lemon.  So disappointing.  I really hope this is a one off.
author: Animal K.

description:
I love their "smidge" size. It's like half a scoop - you know for those days you're not really feeling a whole ice cream scoop. A smidge is perfect! It's $2.50 

House made waffle cones, smaller than your traditional waffle cone, but larger than a sugar cone. Perfect medium for a waffle cone. 

So my smidge got even smaller - I shared it with my mom! :) We had the purple one...forgot what it's called. I'm not very helpful here. 

Ice cream - the flavors aren't very traditional other than Chocolate Fudge the Saturday afternoon I got suckered in by the alluring smell of waffle cones. So don't come here if your mind is set on vanilla. 

I also had a chocolate chip cookie ($1.50) - it does not your traditional classic chocolate chip cookie even despite the appearance. First bite, the texture of crispy outside and chewy center was on point. First taste, the "classic" chocolate chip flavor just wasn't there! There was something extra that was giving it a hint of a bitter taste. I can't really describe it, I can only say it wasn't very appealing half way through the cookie. My mom felt the same way.
author: Jess W.

description:
Cute family friendly creamery on 9th St. My BFF and I couldn't resist getting the 5 scoop ice cream flight! Their flavors are variable... From traditional tastes to unique. The ice cream is super creamy!
The only thing that made me frustrated was with the parking, but who doesn't have a tough time around the City??? :)
author: Aaron Josh B.

description: Their mint chocolate chip ice cream is some of the best I've ever had. You can taste that they use natural mint instead of the processed stuff in other ice cream places. The vanilla was pretty vanilla. All their ice cream is made in house in small batches from scratch and you can taste it.
author: Michael P.

description: Seriously could not believe how delicious this small ice cream place's flavors were. And so cheap compared to other ice cream places! We stumbled here while waiting for the muni and it was awesome. Very nice girls working too. We had peanut butter fudge!
author: Alyssa H.

description: I came here right after having to eat at Nopalito up the street because there is always room for ice cream. The selections are limited but the wow factor is definitely there. There isn't much seating inside. There are a few tables to the right once you walk right in and there is a long low-bar seating at the window.
author: Gary L.

description: Came here on a Sunday night after eating at Pacific Catch. The lines weren't too bad and the service was friendly and attentive. The ice cream was a slight disappointment. We ordered a double scoop with Fresh Mint Chip and Chocolate Sorbet. The Fresh Mint Chip had a nice flavor to it. It was clean and fresh with a good amount of broken chocolate chips. The consistency of it wasn't as smooth and creamy as other places like Mrs. & Mrs. Miscellaneous and Bi-Rite Creamery. The Chocolate Sorbet was rich, but it was a bit bitter and chalky. Don't get me wrong, I absolutely love dark chocolate.. even 85%, but this one tasted much more bitter on the palate. As far as the consistency, I'm not sure if it was from bittersweet or semisweet cocoa powder or if it was from the sorbet base. Overall, I'd give it another shot if I was in the area, but I most certainly wouldn't drive over from Potrero for it.
author: Aimee I.

description:
Amazing, amazing ice cream!! Be sure to ask for the free waffle cone pieces at the end. It's hidden on the chalkboard in the back, but it's essentially free toppings!

I love the peanut butter and fresh mint chip! The mint chip isn't artificially colored and it tastes actually like fresh mint leaves! Super refreshing :) I also like how the scoopers ask which flavor you want on top.

Surprisingly, you'll feel satisfied after two small scoops. I'm the type of gal who can get a pint of ice cream, but I think because the ice cream is super flavorful and rich, I felt satisfied afterwards!
author: Janet H.

description:
Cute little ice cream shop and very interesting flavors. I don't think you'll find the majority of these flavors anywhere else. 

I tried the tirron(?) & the Hawaiian new year sorbet. The tirron(?) was very creamy texture that I've never tried in ice cream before. Life changing tbh & it was sweet but not overly sweet. An interesting taste. The sorbet was definitely very sweet due to the pineapple but still yummy. 

Only gave it 4 stars bc of the choice of flavors. If it had more flavors that were common, it would have 5 stars. Personal opinion
author: Vernice T.

description:
Accidentally stumbled upon this place. We were going to go to Holly Gelato but surprisingly we found parking right across the street from here and thought we'd try it out. From the outside I honestly thought it was going to be some type of Japanese dessert place given the outside architecture but it's a little ice cream shot that likely used to be a Japanese restaurant. I think they just decided to roll with the interior and made it work instead of remodeling and it works well!! Along with the neighborhood art on the walls. But anyways they let you order a FLIGHT of ice cream which is great because then you get to try all their great flavor!! Great to share between two people. 

E for Exceeds Expectations 

We got going from the left
1) Caffe Mocha - this was really strong. Like a straight up espresso with all the strong caffeine taste. They also balance that out with a drizzle of chocolate syrup. Recommended for coffee lovers
2) Tea time on the Thames - this was super interesting. Blend of lavender and earl grey which go together very well. When you first taste it, you get a blast of lavender, like sticking your face in a lavender field blast and once that sits in and the ice cream begins to settle in your mouth BOOM in comes the Earl Grey. Surprising blend of tastes.
3) Rocky road to happiness - I'm not a big fan of rocky road but my friend got this and she liked it. Mainly chocolate though, not much marshmellow but definitely some addition of almonds
4) fresh mint chip - wow!!! Just wow!!!! Usually when I get mint chocolate ice cream, I enjoy that menthol taste you get with things like Andes chocolate and spearmint gum, but THIS. This was a refreshing taste of mint leaves in you mouth!!! It's like they actually took mint leaves and ground it into the ice cream. Still, only my second favorite in the 5
5) peanut butter chocolate fudge - I love peanut butter and therefore this is my favorite. This tasted like a Reese's pieces except with more peanut butter!!! I was a very happy child at the end.

Can't wait to come back here and try new flavors!!!!
author: Tatiana T.

description: I love the concept of the flight! 5 small scoops was perfect to share with my 2 friends. Flavors are pretty great. I really liked their black sesame. The ginger one is nice and really gingery.
author: Elsie M.

description:
Came here for dessert on a Thursday rainy night. There were two customers ahead of me and after I ordered, a lot of large groups came flowing in. What a popular place! They had like a maximum of 6-8 flavors when I went and I got to sample all of it. The guy who helped me gave me very little ice cream on the spoon and I barely tasted anything, but I didn't want to be a nuisance. I decided to get two scoops with the price of $4.50, one flavor was peanut butter chocolate fudge and the other was sea salted caramel. I think it's expensive here. Apparently they make the ice cream from scratch on the same day so maybe that's why? 

I actually really enjoyed the ice cream from here. Very creamy and smooth! The caramel didn't have too much of a strong caramel taste, kind of tasted like a twix. The pb chocolate fudge tasted like reese's and had a more powerful peanut butter flavor. 

You can't buy happiness but you can buy ice cream, which is almost the same thing. Next time I will come back to try their ice cream flight.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Adorable creamery shop with super friendly staff willing to explain what goes into each flavor and give you samples before you commit for a scoop or two. What I like about this place is the super small scoop (smidge!) you can get for a reasonable price of a few bucks, so tiny that it fits in the very center of the palm of your hand! It won't ruin your dinner or make you feel like you just committed to a large serving of something you find out you're not really into. Sure, it's SF city-priced indie ice cream, but worth going in for the exotic flavors (bourbon brown sugar, sake ginger pear, rosemary) and great service. Other option: you can do a flight of ice cream too.
author: Alison A.

description: Cosy place and good home made hot chocolate. It's a place not to stay a long time, only to take a drink. They have also a good ice-creams.
author: Sara R.

description:
Cute little, it's actually not that little, there's plenty of room inside, store in the Inner Sunset, walked by it after eating at San Tung (typical)
They list their flavors outside, and some of them definitely caught my eye so walked in and took a look! Decided to get a flight because a scoop of ice cream was already $4 I believe, and the flight was $11 and you get 5 flavors - expensive, I know. The scoops are smaller than the picture depicts, but it's still a good amount of ice cream. You also get waffle cone pieces to go with the flight, and the ones we got we a bit stale, but still yummy nonetheless. The flavors are definitely unique, you'll get some you really like, and you'll get some you never want to have again. You can obviously try the ice cream before you choose which ones go in the flight, but I always feel bad for trying too many flavors. I'm assuming they rotate their flavors often because I haven't even heard of some of the flavors listed in the other reviews. My boyfriend got a pecan bar there and said it was absolutely divine, so check that out! I don't think I'll be back unfortunately because I can't justify the amount I'm paying for the amount of ice cream I'm getting, even if it is home made. Definitely worth a try though if you're in the area!
author: Alesia C.

description:
I loveeeeeee ice cream...so when I found out about this place, I HAD TO TRY IT! Came here with some friends awhile ago on a Sunday night. There was a line out the door, but the wait wasn't too bad. The workers seem to work pretty fast to keep the line moving. I was overwhelmed with what to get because I can never just choose ONE flavor....like do I pick a basic one or should I go with a more unique one that other places wouldn't have?? I ended up picking the mint chocolate chip. Not too basic and I had read raving reviews about it too. I also got the waffle cone, because why not!! 
It's interesting that they have different sizes for the ice cream...like the smidge and so on vs. how other places only have one scoop, two scoop and so on. I just chose one scoop and I believe it was a little under $5. Not too bad, pretty average pricing. I would have to say the mint chocolate chip was really good! The mint was so fresh and you can just taste it in every lick. I loved it!! They also make their own waffle cones as well, and it was cool that it was still warm when it was served to me.
All in all, I definitely will be back if I'm ever in the area!
author: Coco L.

description:
San Francisco Hometown Creamery makes their own ice cream/sorbets. different offerings every day. seems pricey @4.95 first scoop, 2 scoops (5.95) 3 scoops (6.95)

the more u buy, the cheaper it is.

eats: madagascar vaniilla, apple cider sorbet, (5.95)
-vanilla fine, sorbet has icee feel. apple tastes of apple sauce, also a little sourness.
-waffle cone a nice touc

drips:
-samples given.
-have doubts about sorbet, ice cream is fine..except it melts fast.....
-some seating....
-ice cream ok, not great. lacks premium creaminess like others
3.5 stars
author: Victor G.

description:
When this place first opened, I had already moved from the neighborhood. That was a pity since I love my ice creams. Since I convinced a friend for us to grab dinner at a restaurant nearby, he couldn't deny my ice cream obsession. They have DIY flights and I knew I had to get one to try as many flavors as I could. 

The line was a decent length so it gave us enough time to decide on the flavors. We decided on 5 different ones but I wanted to try another. The carrot cake was the one I decided on trying without getting a large serving of it. 

We instead got: 
Cookies and cream - kind of a disappointment. This is my absolute favorite flavor in the world (or at least right now).  It just didn't have enough different sizes pieces of cookies and the ice cream flavor, just not the best. 
Pluot sorbet - this is one of the best flavors from what we got. It was definitely softer than the other ones but that's a sorbet. Great pluot flavor. In case of those you who don't know what a pluot is, it's like a mix between plum and apricot. 
Baklava - also good. I loved the small pieces of pastry running through the ice cream and honey like taste throughout. Yum! 
Matcha - this was good but not amazing. Tasted like any other matcha flavor. Good and creamy which I definitely look for in an ice cream. 
Peanut butter chocolate fudge - probably our favorite flavor of the night because it was just so good. The chocolate was really pronounced but always the peanut butter. It was like Reese's peanut butter cup in ice cream form. So good. 

My friend is obsessed with waffle cones so we also got some waffle cone pieces to go with our ice cream flight. Which was a definitely YAS. 

Pro tip: a flight of ice creams. Just do it and share with your friends.
author: Nina Y.

description: I believe this is the best mint chocolate chip ice cream I have ever had!  A definite must try if mint is your thing.  I sampled a lot of the other flavors on rotation and they were good as well, but the mint was a definite winner.
author: Kim C.

description: This is an awesome ice cream shop! Sure, there may sometimes be a line but the entire experience is so genuine to SF Bay Area hospitality. The employees are extremely friendly and willing to help you find the perfect ice cream(s) that can suit your preferences and palate. When they run out of one of the ice cream flavors of the day, they bring out another and always keep things fun and interesting. This happened a few days ago when they ran out of one of their flavors, but replaced it with a new S'mores flavor that wasn't listed on their menu. The creaminess and flavors were great and nothing was too rich nor too bland. Their waffle cones are also crunchy and perfect. I love that they use metal spoon testers in order to stay eco friendly, and just how clean they keep their entire place. They also have a really cozy yet open floor space and I love their paintings/decorations that depict all the major iconic neighborhoods in San Francisco. Overall, this is definitely a great addition to the SF dessert dining experience and I recommend everyone to stop by!
author: Nikki T.

description: So sorry about no photos but I was able to taste my peanut butter fudge and just couldn't wait to eat it! OMG so yummy!!
author: Dina F.

description:
While this place excited me with their interesting and unique flavors, I felt everything overall fell short. Texture lacked creaminess and cohesiveness. Flavor lacked depth and.. well, flavor. (The apple cider whatever literally tastes and felt like apple sauce)! Service was great, as most new up-and-coming businesses are. 

Eeek.. In a city full of an array of ice-cream places to choose from, I won't be back.
author: Kris C.

description: I want to love SF Hometown Creamery, but their flavors aren't bold and creamy enough for me. After finishing up dinner at Ebisu (across the street), my friend and I came and ordered their ice cream flight ($13). I always have a difficult time picking just one flavor so the flight was perfect for my friend and I to share. Of the five flavors we got, my favorite was Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge because it was the only one that was rich and creamy, but not too rich where you're feeling sick at the end.
author: Cindy A.

description: Best Ice Cream in San Francisco Hand's down! They were the FIRST in SF to make homemade ice cream. You have to get your scoop with the waffle cone; it's homemade and amazing!
author: Ahmed H.

description: Stopped by here for some ice cream because it's close to my friend's house. Highly recommend the carrot cake ice cream.
author: Tu Anh T.

description:
I absolutely adore this ice cream shop. Everything (all the ice cream and cones) is handmade on-site! I opted to try the Mint Chip. I'm not usually a fan of chocolate and mint but I couldn't get enough of this refreshing flavor. I could tell that it was made with fresh mint leaves--none of that fake flavoring you get at other stores or supermarkets, and the dark chocolate chunks did not detract but rather enhanced the overall taste. The texture of the ice cream itself is a nice blend of light and creamy. The cones come at no extra charge, have excellent structural integrity and add the perfect crunch to your ice cream.

Tip: I was walking around on a sunny day after buying my ice cream so it started to melt pretty quickly. Gobble it down at a decent rate to make sure you don't end up with ice cream all over your hands!
