I was perfectly satisfied with a "smidge" --just the right size when you're full from a previous meal but need to satisfy a sweet craving. 

Service is fast and friendly! I loved the artwork hanging around the store depicting each of the city's districts. 

This creamery is truly a quintessential San Francisco gem.
author: Naveena S.

description:
This is always and forever my favorite local ice cream place. Always creative flavors with high quality ingredients. The flavors are never too extra, like some of the "artisan" places around the city. No eggplant peanut butter corn chip flavors, Yes mango sticky rice ice cream. 

Ps the owner is a lovely person and all of the employees are a delight.
author: Stefanie G.

description:
I DONT CARE WHAT THEY SAY, IM IN LOVEEE WITH YOUU. THEY TRY TO PULL ME AWAY, BUT THEY DONT KNOW THE TRUTH. That's my inner Leona Lewis happening whenever the doctor is like stop eating so much ice cream you'll get diabetes, but then I find a place like hometown creamery and I'm like but how can I stop eating ice cream when this place exists????

The place is rather small (and new), so sometimes the line goes out the door and looks intimidating. With the line backed up to the door, it took about 10 mins to finally get to the front. One of the things that stands out about this place is that they have an ice cream flight ($11.95)! I think this is great to order because you don't have to commit to just one flavor...YOU CAN CHOOSE 5. It's enough for 2-3 or so people depending on how much ice cream you can eat. We tried the caramelized roasted banana, Madagascar vanilla, fresh mint chip, strawberry balsamic, and matcha green tea! Everything from cones to ice cream is made from scratch in store and you can taste the freshness. Especially the fresh mint chip, it's NOT your average mint chocolate chip. It tastes like you're actually chewing on fresh mint leaves. Surprisingly this was my favorite, tied with the caramelized roasted banana. I feel like normally with banana flavored anything, the banana flavor gets lost, but it was really strong here! Next best would be the strawberry balsamic, which was more icey than creamy, but still definitely didn't disappoint. All together, this place is something I wish was closer to San Jose, but will visit when I'm in the city!
author: Maleah M.

description: Went there on 1/2/18 with a large group after dinner, there was about 9 adults and a couple of kids.  Both workers were helping us at the beginning but after 5 of us got our ice cream, I gave my card to the male worker and asked him to pay for everyone's order, including the 3 remaining in line.  Apparently, he then told his female coworker to take care of the rest of my party and he'll take the other customers waiting in line.  He should have told my siblings waiting in line that his coworker was going to finish our orders (the female worker was making my nephew's milkshake and took several minutes to do so).   Instead, he let them stand there confused and ignored.  One of my sisters ended up having to ask them to finish taking care of our party so we can leave.  Both workers were so unfriendly and unapologetic.  It also made me annoyed that the guy worker who wasn't very nice to us was all smiles and friendly to the customers after us, knowing we were growing impatient and annoyed due to lack of service.  Also, I LOVE vanilla ice cream and found theirs lacking in flavor and texture.
author: Yien S.

description: We first came to this place when it FIRST opened. Not many people, short lines, the best. The owners were so sweet and telling us the inspiration for the flavors they made. You could definitely tell the ice cream was well loved when made. Absolutely loved my experience here.
author: Charissa T.

description: You have to try the flight! Mint made with real mint like it should be made everywhere! All flavors are fantastic. You can't go wrong! The brothers who own the place are absolutely fantastic guys! The best ice cream in San Fran!
author: Anthony M.

description: seemed promising but didn't like any of the flavors--too much toppings and too many ingredient combos.  overall not a large selection
author: Rob C.

description: I liked the old times feel and how they make their own ice cream...but honestly, I've had better. I had the mint chocolate chip and I loved how they used actual mint. You could really tell it was a fresh ingredient, but it was a bit overbearing. There might have just been an it too much in their mixture as the taste was so strong that I might as well have been chewing on a handful of mint leaves. I'd like to try some of their other flavored though
author: Jamie F.

description: How anyone gives this place less than five stars is beyond me. Reasonable cost for really well crafted ice cream in the vein of birite or salt and straw and you can tell it's a labor of love from these brothers. I had a Jewish doughnut jelly flavor that was one of the best I've ever had. You can really rare the quality of ingredients used here. Absolutely in love.
author: shar d.

description: The very best ice cream in The City. Plus they make this nutty cake or crumble. I don't know what's it's called but it's delicious. Plus great staff, very friendly and good looking too. Second favorite to Arizmende when I'm on 9th avenue.
author: Yaneke B.

description: We absolutely love this neighborhood favorite. Our kids won't let us walk by without stopping in for a treat! Flavors are so unique, so delicious, and love that it's a family run biz.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Flavors either felt too light or too heavy. The peanut butter was great on first bite but quickly felt too heavy after. The coffee felt the opposite. The mint was the best and felt really refreshing. Texture was a little powdery, would've preferred creamier ice cream.
author: Theodora C.

description: Sweet treat after a picnic lunch in the park. Tried the peanut butter chocolate fudge... YUM! Love heir philosophy.
author: Lemae H.

description: Such a homey feel and great quality ice cream!!!! I tried the jelly donut one during Hanukkah and it was yummy. I also tried the Aztec chocolate one and it had spice to it that I enjoyed. You either love it or hate it. So cute that you can get a flight of ice cream....
author: Daisy S.

description: So unassuming but such a cute little authentic place with delicious small batch ice cream. Flavors like thyme and lavender, sweet corn, strawberry balsamic. You can get a flight and sample a handful. We just happened upon it and hit the jackpot.
author: Emily G.

description: Really good but really pricy ice cream. All of their ice creams, sorbets, and cones are homemade and delicious! I sampled their fresh mint chip and lemon poppy seed. Hands down the best mint ice cream ive ever had. It tasted just like fresh mint leaves and not that artificial green stuff. Really good. The lemon poppy seed was really unique and tasted like a pound cake. It even had lemon peels shaven in as well as a whole lot of poppy seeds. So light and refreshing! I had a single of the lemon on a homemade cone ($4). Will definitely be back to try more of their unique flavors!
author: Linz C.

description: Fresh, homemade ice cream with fun rotating flavors! They let me taste them all, and had I been with someone, I would have ordered the flight tasting.  Yummy!  Will go there again- maybe tomorrow.
author: Keeley M.

description: Damn this place is good! Whole family really enjoyed their ice cream. Husband couldn't believe that their peanut butter chocolate was better than Baskin Robbins which has been his all time favorite since childhood. We are new converts to this place!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Unique flavors...nothing artificial..good ice cream. Super rich so smudge scoops sufficed on this visit.

Tried the Green banana sorbet...fresh chocolate chip and mint...

Friend ordered Peanut Butter double fudge and creme fraiche with apricot...

My favorite of the four was the peanut butter
author: Dee R.

description: This ice cream is beyond belief, no one has ever made ice cream this good. The flavor is so authentic, you can taste the difference. Simply the best I have ever had!!!
author: Max H.

description: This place may be on the expensive side, but it has amazing flavors and quality you won't get anywhere else. Besides the wonderful flavors you also are greeted with a cozy ambiance and wonderful service. I usually order the smidgen of mint chip and it tastes so fresh it's crazy. I recommend this place.
author: Sophia H.

description: This is a fun and funky little ice cream shop. It has the intense, slightly weird and fancy flavors of a Slocombe but with the hipster turned down several notches.  My understanding is that they hire local and the chocolate sorbet is great.
author: saru k.

description: It was a nice little neighbourhood ice cream place with nice decoration. My strawberry balsamic ice cream was ok, my sister had mint chocolate, nothing spectacular though...
author: Michelle C.

description:
Stopped in after shopping at Cary Lane. Wasn't expecting to eat ice cream before my early dinner, but let's not kid anyone here. It's always worth it! 

I had the cookies and cream. The flavor I use to judge my ice cream experiences at any ice cream spot. I'm a fan! But I'm a bigger fan of those fresh handmade cones. They tasted like a snickerdoodle cookie - maybe it's just the cinnamon. Either way, count me in for another 57318947135897139. I'll be back for some more on a cheat day.

Pro tip:
Take a walk to the park and catch some pokemon!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Another great obscure ice cream place! Located on 9th avenue just past the N-Judah stop, this Creamery is hard to miss with its vintage looking sign and inviting outside board listing all their daily flavors!

Inside it is clean and large with plenty of seating and lots of decor. The wooden interior with the friendly servers and close seating makes it just the more warm, inviting, and homey! There is also a large board next to their super clean restrooms that display very clearly the prices, sizes and flavors.

Besides the atmosphere, what's also great about this store is that they offer "smidgen" sizes and a flight of different flavors in that size if you can't decide and just want a few bites of some for cheap! I ended up getting a small scoop of their aztec chocolate with a hint of smoky cayenne in the aftertaste, which was divine! 

Overall, I loved the decor, the service, price, and most of all, the unique and not overly sweet flavors! :)
author: Kyrie S.

description:
Best. Ice cream. Ever.

And I do not write those words lightly. I am aware of the weight and seriousness of this assertion. This a matter that means a very great deal to many people. Ice cream matters. 

And yet, I repeat: Best. Ice cream. Ever.
author: Michael B.

description:
Best Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge Ice cream everrrr.

Friendly handsome staff too LOL
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Pros: Chocolate peanut butter, good service, hipster vibe
Cons: Honey Lemon Rosemary had a grainy texture.  Fresh Mint Chip tasted like toothpaste.
author: Derrick C.

description: Love their strawberry balsamic and peach cobbler flavors. When in season, their lemon poppyseed is just as amazing. Their traditional flavors are all great too. What makes them stand out from the rest are their waffle cones - they're freshly made and light and crispy with a hint of...cinnamon?  we live in the Outer Richmond, but this is our go to ice cream spot and the owner is always there w/ a smile on his face.
author: Jenny L.

description: The ice cream here is pretty good! I got a triple or fresh mint chip, strawberry balsamic, and peanut butter chocolate fudge. I originally planned to get a flight but these three were the best of the ones I sampled. There was no one waiting behind me when I went to try so the staff was nice enough to let me sample all the flavors but chocolate sorbet because I'm not a fan of chocolate ice cream or sorbet. The flavors I got were tasty! My favorite was the peanut butter :) the other flavors I tried were okay, and the texture was a little icier than most places. The texture of the ice cream threw me off a little. The flavors in general tasted a little watered down and not as rich and creamy as I was hoping, but I'm giving this place 4 stars for the friendly staff, clean restroom (!!!) and cute interior :)
author: Victoria C.

description:
Ice cream shop took over what previously was Hotei, a Japanese noodle house.  Owned by 2 brothers, they used parts of the existing decor, split it up, and painted 10 murals of 10 SF districts (kinda sucks that they missed the Richmond dist.).  They have ice cream and sorbet, perfect even for those lactose-intolerant folks.  After sampling their various flavors, I decided on the honey lemon rosemary & sandia alegria (watermelon-raspberry) sorbets.  I like the light, fruity flavors that paired well with each other.  Everything there, even the cone, is made from scratch.  

They have been opened for roughly 2 weeks,  so when they are more established and kinks are worked out, I will give them another try.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Read about this ice cream shop in hoodline! You can tell which brother was the personal trainer at sunset gym and which just finished law school :) the cones are delicious and made in the store- you can see them do so. I got a smidge size cone. It was generous for the price. I wonder if it was just me or if the ice cream was a bit icy instead of as creamy as i would expect. Fresh mint had amazing mint scent but i would choose a chocolate that holds up better frozen so it is less chalky.  Strawberry balsamic was good flavor too. 
I want them to stay open so I hope they are able to charge more if they need to. Rent cant be cheap and you need to sell a lot of ice cream. I can see this store also host birthday parties in one half of the store and do other like ice cream story times. Good luck and hopefully a new neighborhood institution has been born this week!

Maybe Katy tang the local supervisor could host an ice cream social here!
author: Regina C.

description: We always stop bye if we are eating on Irving.  The owner is friendly and goes out of his way to be patient and kind when our toddler is choosing and ordering.  Love this business which is committed to locally and ethically sourced items!!!
author: Emily H.

description: Have been here a few times and each time there is a new flavor to enjoy. I love the rotating selection and unique flavors that you will not find at every other Ice cream shop. The chocolate chip cookies are delicious!! Excellent customer service. Our go to spot for a sugar rush!
author: Rebekah S.

description:
All the flavors were all overwhelmingly unique! I came in with my three other friends and had no idea what to get because all the flavor choices were all good! They have this deal that you can get 5 flavors in shot like glasses for $13 w/tax. 

We ended up getting chocolate sorbet, Madagascar vanilla, pineapple Champagne sherbert, peanut butter chocolate swirl and mint chip and ALL those flavors were super flavorful. With each bite you could really taste their designated flavors. The pineapple champagne really was sweet and felt like we were in Hawaii and the mint chip tasted like the actual leaf and the peanut butter chocolate really tasted like peanut butter. Vanilla Madagascar was pretty okay. It was overshadowed by all the other flavors though. 

The two Guys working were very friendly. Always asked where we were from and where we had just come from and really made conversation. They make the icecream on site as well. The inside of the store was really well furnished and decorated. 

What makes them different from other icecream spots is that they use small silver reusable spoons instead of plastic and they make their waffle cones in the store as well.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The flavors here are amaaaaazing. Both unique and well done. If you can't decide on one or two, or even three flavors for a cup or cone, you can sample 5 in the ice cream flight. 5 small scoops in little cups in a wooden box makes for a perfectly instagram-worthy photo. But seriously, all looks aside, you have to try the ice cream here. Personally love the "Tea time on the Thames" (earl Grey and lavendar).
author: Emily C.

description:
I never let the foggy San Francisco weather stop me from getting some Ice Cream! Especially when you have a taste of San Francisco's Hometown Creamery!

Now how is Hometown Creamery up to par when San Francisco already has our local favorites- Bi-Rite, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, Humphry Slocombe, Smitten's, Marco Polo, and Mitchell's? Well there's no doubt they have delicious homemade ice cream. Strawberry Balsamic was a definite stand out as it went perfectly with our so-called summer season as it was fresh. The balsamic vinegar gave it a balanced flavor without overpowering the strawberry. Another personal favorite was the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough but purely for their delicious cookie dough. Other flavors I tried were the French Roast Coffee Ice Cream (which my friend thought was a little strong and somewhat comparable to Humphry's Blue Bottle flavor), the Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge (another personal favorite since I'm obsessed with peanut butter), Meyer Lemon Poppy Seed (which took me by surprised to not be so sour), and Fresh Mint Chip (which was Hometown's personal favorite). 

Now you might think "how can I simply just settle for just 1,2 or even 3 flavors of ice cream without any judgement!" Luckily for you, they have their Ice Cream Flight which allows you to try up to 5 flavors of ice cream for only $12! Definitely worth it!
author: Denzell S.

description:
Popped in here for a quick treat. I had a single of the seasonal Turron flavor and my fiancé had the mint chocolate flavor on a cone.

The Turron was described as a Spanish Christmas flavor loaded with candied oranges and nuts. The ice cream was quite unique, but felt a bit overloaded. I felt the same way about the cone with its herbal undertones.

The mint chocolate followed the trend. The mint is drawn directly from the herb. The addition of the herbal mint was refreshing and a departure from the run of the mill mint chocolate chip flavor.
author: Justyna N.

description:
Ordered the flight ($13) for two people which consisted of madagascar vanilla, tiramisu, peanut butter fudge, fresh mint chip, and the orange blossom sorbet. My favorites were the tiramisu and the vanilla. We did not like the mint chip, which tasted too much like eating a mint leaf. The sorbet was good. I would get that next time. The texture was too soft and ice cream melted fast for a cold night. 

+1 star because it's a cute little place and friendly staff.
author: Christina G.

description:
Three-star ice cream, five-star experience: these people are not messing around. They are SERIOUS about ice cream, and I can't wait until I'm next in San Francisco so I have a chance to try more flavors and see how their ice cream evolves.

What really impressed me is that they're actually making their ice cream on-site, from scratch. Apparently nobody else in San Francisco can make that claim -- not even my beloved Bi-Rite! I came in during their second week in business, and I was hugely impressed by Saadi's passion for ice cream, and his belief in making his own base -- which allows him to actually create different levels of creaminess and richness for different flavors. That's what every ice cream store SHOULD do, but hardly anyone does it!

That said, the flavor I had -- mocha almond chip -- was just ok. Good flavor intensity but not creamy enough, and a little icy. The vanilla and mint chip I tried weren't any better.

But I have faith! These folks are committed. They just need to up their butterfat content, and include a few more "traditional" (read: chocolate) flavors on their regular menu. I'll definitely give them another shot when I'm back in town.
author: Alexandra S.

description: SO GOOD WERE OBSESSED. they have a little cup they call a smidge and it's just the perfect amount to get your ice cream fix without going over board!!! every flavor is unique and delicious. i would eat it even on a chilly day.
author: Abby E.

description:
Diamond in the rough! 
Well not really, the outside of the building is unassuming but the ice cream is on point!
I still can't stop thinking about the chocolate.
author: Nicholas E.

description: BEST ICE CREAM I HAVE EVER HAD!!! They are a must go to. They have great flavors, I had mint chocolate chip and it tasted like real mint. They also have great pour over coffee with delicious real creamer.
author: Lola P.

description:
Taste: Interesting/Hipster
Texture: Could have been creamier and more consistent -- a weird thickness at certain parts
Cones: Fresh and delicious smelling but not engineered well. 

A cute ice cream shop not too far from Golden Gate Park, SF's Hometown Creamery looks like a Chinese restaurant from the outside. Inside, it's fairly spacious. There's limited seating (maybe about six 2-tops). They had about 7 flavors to choose from. I went with the brown sugar bourbon flavor. Taste was great--the sugar balanced the bourbon and you didn't feel like you were sipping on a shot all night. Texture was initially creamy but had a weird 
thick texture in certain spots. Overall, it was something that I got sick of over time. Also, despite the fact that the cones were fresh made, I didn't like that they left the bottoms un-sealed (other shops usually put a bit of chocolate to cap it off). Eventually my ice cream was leaking and it left me an unhappy camper.
author: Tammy T.

description:
Tonight we had a flight of ice cream at San Francisco's Hometown Creamery!  We found out this ice cream establishment located in the upper sunset opened up last July!  We were so excited to try this homemade icecream place and it was DELISH. 

We devoured:  peanut butter, strawberry balsamic, banana, mint chocolate chip, and carrot cake.  

All tasted so refreshing with a burst of fresh flavor, it didn't taste artificial or syrupy.  The mint was one of our favorites, definitely unique and one of a kind -  it reminded us of mint mojitos!!  Our second fav was peanut butter, and third was strawberry.  

They make their own ice cream in house - so go check it out!!!  Would definitely come back again!
author: Michelle N.

description: Get the Madagascar Vanilla. If they have their double chocolate with Guittard, you MUST get that also. Waffle cone, no other options.
author: Eric A.

description:
Here's THE REAL SCOOP!

Love, love, love--their devine homemade ice cream and sorbet all made completely from scratch; the upbeat old school music; the creative original decor; the great vibes; extreme cleanliness; joyful customers; and the adorable, talented brothers that have clearly poured their hearts and souls into this place. You can see their special touches in the outside-the-box flavor combinations, original artwork, custom flight boxes, hand-picked music selection, genuine enthusiasm and commitment to quality and freshness across the board. 

If grandma made ice cream, this would be it! I highly recommend ordering a flight to experience 5 mind-blowing flavors. My husband and I ordered a flight to share including 2 ice creams and 3 sorbets. All were exceptionally high quality, super fresh, with a delectable burst of authentic flavor in each. I can't even choose a favorite; they were all superb! You will not find a richer tasting chocolate sorbet anywhere. The fresh mint chip was out of this world. You'd be hard pressed to find mint that fresh anywhere except perhaps a top drawer mojito for top dollar. The peanut butter chocolate was to die for. I could go on...

There's something for everyone from rich ice cream to equally rich, non-dairy sorbet, and just a "smidge," single, double, triple cones or flights of 5 flavors. We even watched them make their waffle cones from scratch, one at a time, behind the counter. You can't get anything fresher or tastier than that. Period. These conscientious, hard-working guys have totally raised the bar.

The main point: This charming Creamery offers the freshest, highest quality, creative-genius flavor combinations anywhere--e.g., peach-lemon-thyme, strawberry-balsamic, and honey-lemon-rosemary (yummy!), and traditional flavors that are in a class of their own too. Seriously! I can hardly wait to try their new flavors as they're rolled out over time. Hoodline recently reported that these ice cream wizards have dreamed up 100 or so mouthwatering ice cream flavors to come. Yowza! They ought to take this show on the road and open more Creameries around town and beyond. 

This little gem is a delightful addition (addiction!) to the neighborhood, and a San Francisco highlight. Actually, it's American artistry and entrepreneurship at its finest. Bravo!
author: Robin B.

description: Pretty good and they have so many interesting flavors! I got the flight which offers a variety of flavors and it looks so cute too. If you're there with 2-3 people just share the flight that way you get to try all the flavors. I really enjoyed the basil flavor.
author: Christine T.

description:
This place is so cute and awesome!! I am such a huge fan of places, like Hometown Creamery, that are small batch, handmade and local! I work in a similar industry and love supporting other companies that share the same vision.

The workers were very nice and took their time scooping the ice cream into shot glasses for our flight. Oh yeah, they have ice-cream flights! I'm not a huge fan of ice cream, so it may be prevalent, but this was definitely the first time I'd seen an ice cream flight. It was mighty cute.

We got the Rhubarb Orange Blossom Sorbet, Chocolate Bourbon, Cantuccini, Madagascar Vanilla and Autumn Chai (listed from favorite to least favorite). OH MY GOODNESS the Rhubarb Orange Sorbet was amazing?! It was so fresh and clean, nothing too overwhelming. It was just the perfect thing to have because, like I said, I'm not the biggest fan of ice cream and I'd much rather prefer fruit sorbets. 

I like the wooden interior, which, for some odd reason, makes me think of the establishment as an old-timey, nonchalant, minimalist facility and that fascinates me! Definitely worth checking out!
author: Hannah K.

description: Stumbled into this gem on a weekend trip to the city, great vibe, friendly staff & even better ice cream! The peanut butter chocolate is certified crack, especially for peanut butter heads like myself. The prices are very reasonable as well, I definitely recommend squeezing in a scoop or 2 next time you're in the area!
author: Anthony A.

description: Really great ice-cream, and the house-made waffle cones just put it over the top. Creamy, small batch ice cream that's almost as good as homemade. Don't expect a wall of flavors, there's only around 8 to choose from but they are all worth it.
author: Madyson D.

description: Service is super nice. Gave samples and really nice about it. Awesome waffle cone. Love the smidge because it's so cute. And it's such a nice little snack after lots of Chinese food!!! Anyways, got the baklava and it was perfectly balanced with sweetness and wonderful-tummy goodness. Hahahaha. Please check this place out. I mean, it's an ice cream place, but it tastes good!!
author: Janan D.

description: I love that I can take years of stuff and they shred it right in front of you. It didn't take long and the owner is supper cool.
author: Dee Dee R.

description:
Intrigued by the advertising that SF Hometown Creamery is the "only creamery in San Francisco to make small batch ice cream completely from scratch on-site," I came here and sampled all the flavors they had on rotation at the time - strawberry balsamic, dixie delight (cinnamon base with ginger, brandy, brown sugar, and peaches swirled in), Aztec chocolate (creamy chocolate with a kick of cinnamon and chili), cantuccini (biscotti with amaretto). While all of these were delicious, what blew me away was the chocolate sorbet. 

Now you may be thinking.... sorbet? The one that doesn't even have milk in it? Yes. I was trying to put my thoughts into words about this rich chocolatey delight, but SF Hometown Creamery's description of the flavor just summarized it all too perfectly: 

"Dark, decadent and silky smooth, you won't believe its a sorbet. it's essentially a Luther Vandross song in ice cream form."

Yes.

The sizing of scoops is also great - you can get tiny scoops called "smidges"; there's also a choice of getting an ice cream flight, which is a smidge of five different flavors in shot glasses. In other words, the only type of shot worth having. 

Just yes.
author: Crystal J.

description:
Another SF based ice cream joint is always a welcome addition to the city. The interior is cute, a wooden cabin theme with limited seating.
The flavors sounded imaginative and promising but fell flat. They were sweet to the point of overpowering the nuances in the flavor. Since they do rotate their flavors, I hope the next time I check them out I can give better reviews since I love to support local cones.
author: Tina K.

description: Great costumer service, the ice cream is delicious, and the space is very large and comfortable.
author: Argishti P.

description: Delicious and creative ice cream, cozy place. Had an ice cream earlier today and am still thinking about how tasty it was
author: Danielle P.

description:
Stopped by after spending the afternoon in the Botanical Gardens because let's be honest I can't go a weekend in summer without going out for ice cream. 

Our group of 3 went with the ice cream flight of 5 flavors. The staff was very patient in letting us try a bunch of flavors first and explaining them (e.g. balsamic bringing out the strawberry flavor, slight spice of Aztec Chocolate). It took another 5-10 min for it to be ready, but our friend said the employee took a lot of care in getting the ice cream in the cups and making it look nice (#aesthetic). 

We got the Peanut Butter Choco Chip, Strawberry Balsamic, Aztec Chocolate, Mint Chip, and Dixie Delight. They were all really good, especially the Peanut Butter and Strawberry Balsamic. Would definitely recommend getting the flight. It was the perfect amount and variety for 3 people!
author: Connie C.

description:
I'm not usually a huge fan of ice cream, but hometown creamery has me hooked!

We got the flight with eggnog, alfejores, sufganiya, fresh mint chip, and peanut butter chocolate. They were all incredible, but the fresh mint is out of this world. 

The flavors are unique, and delicious and the ambiance is homey and fun! 

If you're looking for a true Ice cream experience - check this place out.
author: Anna W.

description: Amazing. That's all you need to know. Got the black sesame, mango sticky rice, and espresso. I'll be back. And the gentleman at the counter was so charismatic and enthusiastic - his energy was intoxicating :) now that I've had their ice cream, I can't go anywhere else. This is REAL ice cream, you'll know what I mean after one taste ;) glad I walked in today. I'll be set for summer. Thank you for existing!!
author: Emmeline L.

description:
I was skeptical when this place opened, as we are not lacking in frozen dessert options in the Inner Sunset. I finally tried it in the spring, wooed by the promise of "Sephardic-style charoset" ice cream for passover. It did not disappoint.

They have a nice range of rotating flavors, from the traditional (cookies 'n cream) to the unusual (the aforementioned charoset, or the spectacular roasted black sesame I had today). Try the house-made waffle cone for an extra treat.
author: Amy G.

description: Delish! BF said his was a little icy, and I thought mine (peanut butter chocolate fudge) was just a touch too creamy for my taste, but I'd definitely go back and try other flavors. The space is kind of weird (converted sushi place)/sparse, but I guess that's okay? I appreciate the effort they made with art of various SF neighborhoods on the upper wall areas. :p
author: Shendi X.

description:
Location: Inner Sunset, metered parking.

Atmosphere: Cute place with prideful paintings and a map where you can pin your hometown. Plenty of small tables.

Service: Great service. The man who scooped our ice cream was genuinely passionate about ice cream - he took the time to show us the pasteurization process and explained how he has a license in pasteurization. 

Ice Cream: The Madagascar vanilla was amazing - the texture was light and you can taste the freshness. The mint chip was good but wasn't my favorite. Flavors are rotated and you can purchase certain flavors by the pint. Plenty of toppings, waffle cones, etc.
author: Ruby K.

description: I've come here on multiple occasions and there are multiple instagram shots of their wonderful flights of ice cream. The ice cream definitely does not disappoint. The flavors are different daily but I'd say the best deal is to get a flight of five flavors so you get to sample a good variety of what they have to offer. There are options for sorbet for those who opt for dairy free options. All ice cream is made from scratch and the quality is superb. Can't go wrong with anything on their menu really.
author: Serena C.

description:
We have been here twice in one week..... 

The store is filled with the warm, sweet smell of waffle cones. 

The flavors are eclectic but yet familiar. 

Their sizes are well thought out to help our ever expanding waist. 

They try to keep the flavors rotating, but still go with the availability of the season, so you know its real. 

I've tried:
Ginger Peach Sorbet : soft and slushy like texture, ginger taste is not too strong. It literally tastes like bitting into a sweet, tender pear. 

Matcha Green Tea: is creamy but the flavor is still strong. 

Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge : not overly rich or sweet. Perfect balance of peanut butter and chocolate. 

Expresso Grenata: is UH-MAZING. Grenata is italian ice. the texture, the perfect amount of espresso. My favorite of all the flavors I've tried so far. 

The only critique I have is the set up of the store. The island is in the middle with usually one person assisting curious customers who want to try all their flavors ( I don't blame them). There is no order for the line, so people just cluster into one general area in front of the ice cream fridge. Perhaps some Disneyland snake ropes to keep order and to facilitate the line.
author: Virginia Q.

description:
Food (5/5): I got 2 smidges (smallest size), one each of the coffee and lemon poppy seed flavors, and my bf got the coffee and cookies & cream. My bf and I sampled a bunch of flavors, but ended up going with the coffee, lemon poppy seed, and cookies and cream. Each flavor was so creamy and packed with flavor - no regrets on any of our choices, but ugh all so good.

Service (5/5): Everyone who works there is super nice, and they're generous with samples!

Value(4/5): It's expensive for ice cream, but that's kind of the norm in the city.
author: Abby S.

description: Caipirinha sorbet was delicious. Very icy and refreshing. It's reminiscent of a frozen limeade, but better haha the strawberry balsamic was whatever, I've had better elsewhere. Their smidge size was perfect though, and wish more places served smaller serving sizes as well. Overall, they have some interesting flavors and will be coming back to check them out!
author: Sandy K.

description: I love the fact that SF Hometown Creamery is open late on Sundays!  I came in around 8:30 and there was barely a line.  I ordered a single scoop of the peanut butter chocolate flavor.  Tasted just like a reece's cup!  The cone also taste a bit like a snickerdoodle, maybe a hint of cinnamon in it.  Super tasty.  I think I might have hyped this place up too much prior with reading Yelp reviews, but I still enjoyed it!
author: Gina B.

description:
Decided to try this place out after dinner.  There are enough flavor options to keep things interesting.  I tried the cinnamon and if I was in the mood for it I would have gotten it.  Pretty good.  What won me over was the fantastic mint chip.  The flavor is like biting into mint leaves.  Not overwhelming but very fresh.  I was thinking about getting a cone because they smell great but ultimately I gave in to the temptation of the chocolate cookie.  Cookie is slightly fudgy.  Has a rough texture I think.  Quite chocolaty and satisfied my craving alright.  

The line is almost out the door for this place but it moves at a decent speed.  Prices are ok, starting at $2.50 for a "smidge" or little scoop.  I like the ice cream flavors but the texture is pretty standard.  I wish they had a few more creamy flavors to choose from but they have a lot of sorbet to choose from, including chocolate, so if you are avoiding dairy this is a good place.
author: Audrey D.

description:
Wow!! Very very nice atmosphere :)

Their ice is made in house and you can totally appreciate the quality taste. 

If you go on hot sunny day in San Francisco expect to wait a bit. But the wait is worth it once it's your turn to get ice they actually ask if you want to sample before you order so in others words they want to make your leaving happy with your choice of ice cream :). That to me is worth the wait!

The entire staff seemed happy and helpful!! Love their decor.

Would definitely visit on another occasion I'm in San Francisco. 

Thanks for the experience
author: Carol M.

description: I've always seen this place but never got a chance to go in and finally last night I was able to try it for the first time and I'm so glad we did. They have some many cool and unique flavors and the staff was so nice that they lets us try as many flavors that we wanted before we made our final choice. I got the peanut butter chocolate fudge! I had it in a waffle cone which the make there right in front of you. It was probably one of the best ice creams I've had in a while and the waffle was a great add on to it just out of the waffle maker. Can't wait to come back and try more flavors.
author: J V.

description:
Really unique and great tasting ice cream flavors.

The mint in particular really stood out, I don't know how they made it taste so fresh.

Definitely go for the flight so you can try a bunch of different flavors.
author: Jason K.

description:
I live around the corner from Humphrey Sloughcombe and not too far from BiRite so have high standards for ice cream.

I've walked past Hometown Creamery a few times and that intitial whiff is amazing in all of its sugary glory.

While the smell is delightful, the ice cream itself misses the mark. I tried the ginger, vanilla, tea thyme and some sort of kiwi flavor. The sugar in all of these overpowered the flavors they were trying to get at. And the flavors themselves were not pleasing to the palate--I felt like someone punched my tongue with a nasty blend off too much sugar and zing. Sometimes, sugar is added and not blended well...and here, it tastes like that for all of the ice cream. Probably the downside of being the only place to make small batches on the premises.

The cones that the cute guy behind the counter handled so cafefully though (like they were precious gems)...they are absolutely amazing. I would buy a ten pack of these cones if they offered them. 

Come for the cone!!!! The price isn't awful either so get a cone, taste the ice cream, and then scoop the ice cream out to really get at the cone.
author: Michelle N.

description: Such a cute lil ice cream shop. We had spent the day in Golden Gate Park, and the creamery was a  less than 5 min walk from the edge of the park. The indoor decor was so cute - little murals of all the different SF neighborhoods. There were so many good flavors that we decided to get the flight - it was so worth it! We got to try 5 different flavors, and it was a full single scoop of each basically. Really loved the Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip, as well as the Strawberry Balsamic. We also got the Aztec Chocolate, which had a little kick in it, Mint Chip, which tasted just like real mint, and the Dixie Delight, which has pieces of peach. Definitely enjoyed the ice cream on a warm afternoon, and would go back!
author: Puja S.

description: This place is awesome!!!  The flavors are mind blowing and extremely creative!  It's a lovely spot and the staff is very friendly and efficient!  I think it is AWESOME that they feature flavors that are reminiscent of Jewish holidays- for example right now they have a Haroset flavor!  Wow!  Love, love this place and can't wait to go back!!!!
author: Samantha B.

description:
SF character and integrity of product.
They offer a tiny quantity called a "smidge" for an affordable price, I used to avoid ice cream places because you have to fill up with custard, gross. But this place is amazing, has a unique vibe in a town gone corporate. The fresh mint chip is an honest mint flavor, like from your herb garden, the salted caramel flavor is fantastic.... They can explain why it's natural or not chemical tasting but it's a quality product for sure! The owner/artist behind the product is also the person who designed and painted the murals of SF neighborhoods around the ceiling/walls. That alone is worth the stop. This is what the neighborhood needs, small businesses with local talent. Also a "flight" of tastes is a fun idea I haven't done it yet but it's offered here I saw.
author: Matt Y.

description: There is different flavors every week. I come here for the Cardamon twice. I believe this is the best ice cream shop in the sunset district.
author: Jess T.

description: The Peanut butter chocolate was one of the best I have had in a long time. Great business stratagey to charge $2.50 for a smaller than kids size mini scoop.  They know their market.  If you are looking for a bang for your buck go to Baskin Robbins, but if you are looking for a lil creamy quality a smidge will do!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Customer service was friendly and helpful.  The environment was comfortable.

I could care less about hip and trendy ideas.  All that matters to me is if the product is delicious and doesn't cause me take a pause and rethink my decision.  I tried the flight and had to start it off with the go-to flavor for every ice cream shop I try which was cookies and cream.  Choosing the next 4 flavors was like a roulette.  Fresh mint chip
I immediately devoured the cookies and cream.  It was okay.  The four other flavors were either okay or questionable.  In the end, my taste buds weren't impressed.  Definitely a great idea, but it just didn't live up to the hype.
author: j f.

description:
There are a handful of "artisan" ice cream places in SF. I think this place is the least well known, for some reason. Maybe they don't post enough on Twitter and don't get as many SF eater articles. But, they're legit.

Their ice cream isn't as heavy on the cream as most of the others, but they're mostly pretty flavorful. Some might be too strong for some tastes, but I liked most of the ones I tasted. Of the local creameries, this place is the only one that makes their one base, and, as such, they taste distinctively different. It's definitely good, and it's up to you if you like it better, but at least, it's different from the others.
author: masa s.

description: Overall a solid ice cream experimental. They have some traditional flavors and some rotating more experimental flavors (such as sesame). The prices are a tad steep for ice cream, however the in-house ice cream was pretty bomb.
author: Andrew N.

description:
Let's see. Crazy good ice cream + the friendliest staff on the planet + delicious favors. That's the recipe for the best ice cream joint around and it is this place. 

I love it. My son (who they know by name, please don't judge his toddler diet) loves his smidge size cones for only $2.50! -- that makes me love it more. 

And do delicious. Probably you should go there right now.
author: ash E.

description: Best ice cream I've had in the city! I got a double smidge mint chocolate chip and chocolate sorbet. I'm usually hesitant with sorbets especially chocolate becasue they can be watered down and bland but this one was so rich with flavor it was an obvious and delicious choice. The mint chip was so fresh it tasted like the mint had been picked just a minute before making its way into my ice cream cup!
author: Jaedra D.

description:
Rather excellent on every level.
Unique homemade ice cream,great owners,staff and the flavors are off the hook.
Don't wait for a hot day (especially in the IS summer) to get a scoop or four.
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
Ever heard of a Smidge-sized order of ice cream? Well, you will if you're getting it here! Smaller than a small or kids size, but more like a 10-bite sample. It's pretty pricey for what you get, but it's creative if you want more than just a taste and less than a full scoop. And an amazing thing is that it can also come in cone! I had this before and it was just enough to satisfy my snack craving before a huge meal.

They're flavors are pretty unique and very good. They change their flavors everytime a visit, so don't expect to see the same flavors each time. I've tried the Backlava, which had chunks of filo dough and that was awesome! Their tiramisu was also amazing. Much of their lemon-flavored ice cream was pretty tart when I remembered, but seems delicious when I'm in an extra-tart mood. :).

Great ice cream shop in Sunset close to UCSF Parnassus. Get your fill or smidge here!
author: Michelle S.

description:
I've been here many times now, mainly for their fresh mint chip. The first time I came here, I got the cinnamon ice cream, which was just amazing. Sadly, they discontinued it... The fresh mint chip is awesome though. I don't think I can go back to the artificial mint chip.

I've sampled many flavors every time I visit, but nothing else is really as special as their mint chip. Though during my last visit, they had rocky road, which was very good. 

Their ice cream cones are why I keep coming back. The cones are homemade with some cinnamon in them, which make them very delicious. I love the texture of their ice cream too. It's not super creamy, and just a little icy which I like.

I'll keep coming back for more of their mint chip, and I'm excited to see what new flavors they come up with!
author: Derek T.

description: The ice cream here is really good, with a solid assortment of flavors. The environment is also really nice, with most of the scenery made of wood.
author: Jason L.

description: This place is so cute and tasty! I like that they have fun, offbeat flavors and offer a variety of sizes, including the adorable "smidge" or "double smidge". The people who work there are very friendly and nice. And of course the ice cream was delicious! I had haroset and cookies n cream on their  homemade waffle cone. I'm so glad my friends took me here and I plan to go back next time I'm in town.
author: Rachel P.

description: Very clean and polite staff. The Hibiscus Lime Sorbet is the best! I will be back!
author: Dale C.

description: Cute place! Stopped by one my way home from class. Just felt like I needed a pick-me-up and a ice cream cone sounded perfect. They don't have many flavors, there are about 6. I tasted the cafe mocha which was very good, but a little too chocolatey for me. I ended up ordering the vanilla and it was just what I needed. I usually can't eat too much of something sweet so I really appreciated there "smidge" scoop. It was just perfect in a cone for the rest of the walk home. The waffle cone was really yummy too. Everything just tasted very fresh and homemade! The prices were a little expensive but it's ice cream, the feeling you get after the first bite is all worth it lol
author: Jessica B.

description:
I am so glad I found this place. The fact that this place is only 4-5 minute walk from San Tung is clutch - especially for those who needs something sweet after a meal. 

The place was cute, homey, and employees were very helpful and welcoming. 

Since it was me and my friend's first time, we decided to get the flight. 5 flavors for $12 and it comes w/ a small cup of waffle cone pieces.

The flavors we tried were:
- peanut butter chocolate fudge ( you peanut butter/ chocolate lovers will enjoy )
- honey lemon rosemary ( so refreshing )
- fresh mint chip ( legit taste the mint, I love that )
- french roast coffee ( i'm a coffee lover -- you can definitely taste the coffee )
- sephardic style charoset ( a flavor you seriously have to try out yourself, so good )

I will definitely come back.
author: Rachel A.

description: Wonderful small-batch ice-cream spot.  Approximately 10-15 flavors available- most are their takes on the 'classics', with some other more 'exotic' flavors as well.  Very reasonable prices and quick and friendly service + plenty of seats available.  I'll be back for sure.
author: Andy S.

description: Nice flavors.  Coffee was bold and Meyer lemon tasted so fresh.  Not as creamy as some other places but still yummy.  Everything is made from scratch here.  Friendly and personal service.   Generous with samples.
author: Zoe B.

description: Loved this place! There was a line out the door but worth the wait. Daily flavors rotate -- my mint chocolate chip tasted very fresh, you can tell it's been made from scratch. Also. GET THE CONE. There's a peanut butter and cinnamon hint to the waffle that adds perfect sweetness to the ice cream.
author: Chrissy B.

description:
It's a cute shop - has a very local intimate vibe with paintings on the walls of the different SF neighborhoods. I had a small scoop of the cinnamon maple pecan. I liked the flavors but the consistency was more gelato versus creamy ice cream.

My favorite part of the visit was how friendly and welcoming the service was!
author: Jenny K.

description: Cream rises to the top. That's where this place is going. I'm all about their fascinating flavors and small batch pride. Peanut butter chocolate is my thing and they do it right. After a big meal the smidgen is the perfect size. Go shawty!!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Alright, so I after reading the Hoodline article, I respect these brothers and they seem like good guys, but I really have to call them out for the size of the milkshake. 

In this cruel, cold world, there's just a few things that can make life a little brighter, and for me, milkshakes are one of them. I've traveled the world over for milkshakes. I've sipped milkshakes with tribesmen in the Sahara, royalty in England, and everywhere in between. But what I have not seen in all my years of creamy indulgence, is a shake as pricey AND small as the one here. 

A message to the Brothers:
Adar, Sadi... You seem like good dudes, but if you want to earn my weekly Sunday night milkshake business, you've gotta up the size.
author: Sam K.

description: The tea flavors and mint chocolate chip are very plain. This is a small shop that serves handmade ice cream but the flavors like Earl grey are very plain tasting and the mint chocolate chip needs more mint and chip. It tastes like every ice cream started out with a vanilla base and they need to add more flavor. Also, the ice cream scoops are small for the price so I don't think it's worth it. Service is slow and all they tell you is that their ice cream is made in house.
author: Jackie H.

description: I loooooove ice cream, I'm a bit of an ice cream snob though, so I'm particular about my ice cream.  We came here last night for my birthday, boy was I glad we stopped in!!  I sampled a couple ice creams--both beyond delicious!!  I like their sizing, and the prices were good. Very friendly people behind the counter, clean, nice atmosphere.  I'll be back for sure!!  {The Aztec Chocolate is out of this world!!}
author: Suki J.

description: Excellent ice cream! We had the Madagascar vanilla, mint chocolate chip, and persimmon sorbet.... cones are delicious...with a hint of maybe cinnamon? The have small cones for smaller scoops. Will definitely be back!
author: Kay L.

description:
I've had this bookmarked, but forgot about it until my best friend brought it up.

Came here after visiting the de Young. We are ice cream fanatics and we always look for and try new ice cream spots. What intrigued me was the ice cream flight. First time I've heard of it. We had to get it. When we were ordering I was like, I don't think it would be smart to get a flight to myself so I told my BFF let's share one.

We got rocky road, ginger, vanilla, peanut butter, and I think the chocolate sorbet.

The one I liked the most was the rocky road and vanilla. 
The one I liked the least was the ginger. We got it to give it a try. 

The outer decor caught us off guard because obviously it used to be a Japanese restaurant. But the decor inside is super cute, paying homage to most of the SF neighborhoods. 

Would I come back? Yes.
author: Jenna R.

description: I got the Sephardic Style Haroset! It was amazing! I love how they make all their ice cream from scratch and how they decorate their place with different portraits of districts in SF
author: Eileen Joy P.

description: Holy crud, Sufganiyot, where have you been all my life? More importantly, Hometown Creamery, where have you been all my life? The only downside you'll find here is the price point; otherwise, this place is aces. From the hipster mason jars full of ingredients to the giant world map of push pins with peoples' homelands, Hometown Creamery now has a place in my heart. But really, this review is about the Sufganiyot. When you blend donuts into a smooth and creamy ice cream with raspberry bits, it's like the world around you becomes a richer and fuller place. Birds chirp louder, coffee tastes richer, and parking is simpler. Yes, you're paying quite a bit (not quite as expensive as Smitten) for a small scoop of ice cream, and yes, you're going to be hard-pressed to find decent parking on 9th and Irving, no matter what time of day, but man, are you going to enjoy that delicious dairy treat for the next five minutes. You'll thank me later.
author: Danny C.

description: Loved my s'mores ice cream today, especially because it hit 100 degrees in SF today!
author: A W.

description:
We were desperate for a quick fix for children who walked about 5 miles. We were by the park and they really wanted to go to the Ferry Building. That wound be another five miles :/. We saw some people with ice cream and were told to go around the corner to 9th Avenue and Irving. 

We entered into a cute little spot that smelled like heaven. Waffle cones being made...a small selection of deliciousness...

We didn't want our kids to have too much sugar so we always ask for a small size less a few spoonfuls. They had a solution for us! A smidge! The size they created. The perfect amount for about fifteen licks!

The cones were so delicious; so as the chocolate peanut butter and chocolate chip mint. The homemade chocolate chip cookie was so yummy. A home run!
author: Jen L.

description: Great ice cream place with freshly made waffle cones.  The mint chocolate chip had a natural mint leaf flavour, and is not overly sweet.
author: Michelle C.

description: It was a sweltering hot little shop with the sun beating in and a long line for decent ice cream.  Maybe it was just a bad day for them but I wish I went down the street to the other ice cream shop. The dirty bathroom overflowing with paper towels and no trash can (compost only?) wasn't helping.  Understandable not to have AC in the city, but at least get a fan and some curtains to block the light if you're going to have people waiting around.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Cute little hole in the wall ice cream spot. A friend and I spotted this place on our way to dinner and decided to go here for dessert afterwards. They have interesting flavors for ice cream and they're all super good as well as fresh! Made on site! The art work inside the shop is unique since it represents each areas in SF. Also, their customer service is terrific! The cashier was super friendly!
author: Danika P.

description: Perhaps my most frequented ice cream shop at the moment, thanks to my husband who is enamored by their sorbets. Started by two brothers, one who worked across the street and loved the location in the Inner Sunset, the two set out to do ice cream right. Everything is made from scratch on site in a Japanese-restaurant-turned-ice cream shop. Their menu is a good sized, but not overwhelming, and they also have seasonal flavors. When Prince passed, they created the Purple Rain as a tribute -- a blueberry cheesecake style ice cream. If you're a chocolate fan, you have to try their chocolate sorbet, which is essentially how a frozen dark chocolate bar would taste. One of the best parts of SFHC -- the handmade cones are free!
author: Taya V.

description:
Perfect sweet dessert spot in the middle of so many savory food options. We sampled the aztec chocolate with cayenne and it was so good. The texture was creamy and very smooth and the flavors were memorable. The cold contrast with the hot cayenne pepper was an experience that we all enjoyed. We also love to support local business.

STOP FOP!
author: Stop Fo P.

description: Try the flight...5 flavors of your choice in a shot glass. All of the ice creams are amazing.
author: De B.

description:
Came here this past weekend after eating lunch near the area and wanted to check it out since it was new. It was a cute and simple ice cream shop with both basic and exotic flavors that gives people a chance to try something classic but also try something they can only get here. My boyfriend and I ended up tasting some of the flavors: sake pear sorbet, honey lemon rosemary, and the green apple cider. The pear sorbet was light with a kick of sake flavor that gives it a balance to sweet and tartness of the pear. I loved the honey lemon rosemary! It was a nice tart flavor and the addition of rosemary was delicious, definitely something I have not tried before and would come back for. The apple cider tasted just like what I expected so was not necessarily wowed by it.

What I also liked about this place is they give you an option of getting a "smidge" as your scoop which is basically a very small cup of ice cream if you did not want too much and was craving ice cream (especially for those guilty pleasure people who may be trying to have a "cheat diet", and it is only $2.50!) Definitely a must try for their distinct flavors :)
author: Wendy Z.

description: Our favorite ice cream in SF! Tastes like homemade and the homemade waffle cones are heavenly! Chocolate sorbet is the perfect thing if you want rich dark chocolate. My kids love horchata with caramel sauce and the mint taste likes fresh mint from the garden.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Friendly service and the unique flavors make this worth a try. The interior is spacious and the counter facing the street is great.

Ice Cream making is an art, so you'll just have to decide for yourself how this place stacks up with the competition.  The unique flavors make it distinctive but I found the texture was grainy and the ice cream too soft for my liking. The sweetener is also a little strong for my tastes. The reviewers are spot on that it's not as creamy as most would like.

Note: if you get a pint to go, it's going to melt within 15min.

As a new spot, I'm sure it can only get better as they perfect their formulation.

But it's a high end price point, that doesn't quite fulfill.

I would rather drive to get Smitten, Bi-rite, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous, Humphrey Slocombe, Mitchell's or Swich (which is the closest.)

There aren't any alternatives close by unless you are willing to have  froyo around the corner or get three twins ice cream from Mollie Stone's.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
I love the Rocky Road (Chunky just how you like it)! I like the Fresh Mint Chip (can be a bit watery at times)! I wish they had Rocky Road option all the time, but seems to be very seasonal.

The atmosphere is very cute, cozy, and artsy/hip at the same time. Ice cream + a wall with a lot of personality = great pick-me-up.
author: Shelley C.

description: Despite the higher price (well, I compared this store with my love for Bi-Rite), the ice cream that I try today : Roasted Black Sesame with White Miso Caramel is delicious, it's not overly sweet, less creamier than Bi-Rite ( in a good way ), unique taste and has a pleasant aftertaste. I def recommended this place if you are strolling around this area!
author: Gabriella S.

description:
I used to work next door to this place and never even noticed it sold ice cream! A full 2 years later, I finally decided to read the sign and go in (it's really easy to miss). 
They don't have much of a line system, everyone just kind of has to get a scoopers attention and YOU have to initiate the conversation with them.. don't just stand there waiting (as if there were some system to ordering) because they'll never say a word to you. 
It's also disgustingly hot in there, every time I've been. Maybe to keep people out? As well as the unfriendly interior? 
The only reason I gave it more than one star was the ice cream itself. SO GOOD. they're in small batch pans and everything tastes really fresh. My favorites are STRAWBERRY BALSAMIC and BANANA SORBET. banana sorbet you say?!? Yes there's such a thing - and it's friggin delicious.
author: Emma G.

description: Try the peanut butter ice cream very good. Hot chocolate was very rich. Milkshakes were not too thick less creamery than fast-food chains I believe. Excellent atmosphere!!
author: Jee P.

description:
I've been here twice so far. Overall I thought the ice cream was good. They have classic flavors and a few more interesting flavors that get rotated in and out. The ice cream is made on-site which is supposed to be a rare thing these days but I don't really care where the ice cream is made as long as it's good right?

My biggest complaint about Hometown Creamery are the prices (and consequently the serving size). They are trying to compete with Bi-Rite, Smitten, and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous but the truth is they are not on that level yet. The quality of the ice cream is good but I don't think it's as good as Bi-Rite, etc.

Their decor, ambiance, and overall brand/experience need time to grow and improve. The inner sunset crowd is not the same crowd you will find in Dolores Park, Hayes Valley, Fillmore, etc. Inner Sunset folks are quieter, more reserved, and more family oriented. They will balk at a $6.50 root beer float. Six dollars and fifty cents?! Are you kidding me? Are they grinding organic sassafras in the back room and using San Pellegrino?

Overall this place is solid but there's a Three Twins Ice Cream place just 25ft down the street that has really good ice cream as well.
author: Kevin W.

description: This place rocks! We had the flight of five flavors, all of them were delicious. Love that it's a small family run business, A welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Enzo R.

description:
3.5 stars but will round up to support local business. 

This will be short since so many have already sounded off.   We came on a Friday and waited about 10-15 min, tried the mint but went for the tiramisu on a cone instead.  Friendly service and like other yelpers mentioned scooper and cashier did switch jobs frequently.  No gloves on the ice cream scooper and hand washing I was not able to see (but it could have been done not sure).  Small work station for them and they have to turn around constantly to get the ice cream scoop in water.  

Price and size a little steep but I'm okay with that for now since I don't want to hike across town for other ice cream.  Hopefully in time they'll expand the counter area and improve the sink area/work station/ service issues.  I did really enjoy the ice cream and cone! I did see leakage issues from the melting ice cream dripping - they can fix this - add a mini marshmallow to block the bottom.  :) 

Glad to have this business in the Sunset!
author: Julie F.

description:
Amazing flavors!  Rhubarb Orange Gimlet,
Tea Time on the Temps, Lemon Rosemary, Cinnamon Maple Pecan, Madagascar Vanilla!  All great!  Order a flight, (looked like fun).  I talked to Saadi who works there.  Nicest guy in the world!  I'll be back for sure.
author: Jan E.

description: I tried the peanut butter fudge ice cream on their homemade cones and it was DELISH! Very reasonably priced as well, $3.95 for a small!
author: Shahryar R.

description: Darling tiny ice cream shop! Small batch is the way to go, gaurentees quality control and freshness. We loved the different size options and some perfect for little ones and flights to share. Ice cream quality was rich and dense so small portions were ideal. Best customer service. Saaid answered questions taught the little ones about the flavour s and patiently and happily offered samples. Not a huge variety but it was an enjoyable experience.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Pleasant staff, good and unique ice cream. Only thing I would skip is the sundae which seems light on substance for the $6+ cost. 

I'd recommend the chocolate sorbet, and I don't like sorbet.
author: J. M.

description:
This place is a gem in the neighborhood.  The owner was so friendly and really proud of his homemade ice cream and waffle cones.

We had to sample a few flavors before we decided on the peanut butter chocolate fudge and fresh mint chip.  Will defined come back to try the other flavors
author: Jennifer T.

description: Delicious, will be back!! Love the jelly donut and alfajores flavors! Great atmosphere and like the smidge option for ice cream too. Yum!
author: Lisette P.

description: Tried this place for the first time tonight & loved it.  My favourite was the chocolate sorbet, my husband loved his "Madagascar Vanilla".  The other flavours we sampled all tasted so fresh! I also enjoyed the ambiance - tables as well as seating "bar style" by the large front windows.  It feels very "homey" and in fact everything seems to be homemade.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  I hope to return.
author: Julie G.

description:
Appearance:
Such a cute shop! It's very artsy and tumblr looking.

Food:
The ice cream was great! If you like mint ice cream then try their mint! It actually tastes like real mint! Not artificial! Their tea time ice cream has a lighter flavor but is great! The chocolate sorbet is so rich it's like fudge!

Service:
The worker was great. He helped us choose and encouraged us try the flavors. 

Other:
Clean. Love the eco friendliness of the metal sample spoons!
author: Harmony N.

description:
I have visited this place twice. The staff greeted us immediately and were very helpful. I love that the menu flavors change. They have incredible flavors like peach & thyme sorbet, baklava, earl grey, and many more. We were encouraged to sample their flavors before ordering. I ordered "smidge" sized scoops. I absolutely adored the tiny house made waffle cones to fit my order. 
I'm so glad to have found another ice cream gem in San Francisco. I look forward to visiting and trying out new flavors.
author: Pamela D.

description: Came here after a warm B2B, and having failed to find Twirl and Dip (soft serve) in Golden Gate Park. The line was pretty moderate for such a warm day. I ended up ordering the khao niao mamuang (sweet rice and mango) ice cream, and it was super refreshing! It was non-dairy, so it had an "icier" texture that was really refreshing. Not too sweet, with a subtle mango-flavor, and a nice sweet rice base. I'd come back to try the other flavors!
author: B Y.

description:
First time visiting San Fran and was excited to try out what seemed to be a pretty loved place by locals from what I had read. Was quickly disappointed. Waited in line with my boyfriend for a few minutes behind a couple ordering in front of us-not a big deal, not an impatient person. But when I did eventually get up to the ice cream display, the girl standing there was so incredibly awkward. After waiting a bit, the least I could've expected was a simple "hi how are you?", as this is a common thing to ask to your paying customers. Instead, she barely made eye contact with me and mumbled a "hi". Didn't ask if I wanted to try anything or if I knew what I wanted. There was also another guy working there but he was all over the place, on his phone and showing some customers something on his phone, never paying attention to any of the other guests in there.
Anyway, I got two scoops (fresh mint chip and the 210) in a waffle cone. The scoops were pretty big for the large price I was paying so that was sweet. Once I tasted the ice cream though, it wasn't as sweet. The top scoop of my cone was mint chip and while it was indeed fresh tasting, it was grainy and icy and not smooth at all. Same thing for the 210. I was super disappointed. Had the ice cream actually had the consistency of ice cream, it would've been pretty tasty. Overall a disappointing experience, definitely didn't get the hype over this place :/
author: Kaeli A.

description:
My FAVORITE San Francisco ice creamery! Below is a rundown of how Hometown Creamery compares to other SF ice creameries, ranked in order of my preference (accompanied by a half-serious, slightly comical, stereotyped personification of each store)

***Hometown Creamery***
"The old-fashioned, pure and true family man"
As true to flavor as one can be! It's as if they distilled the flavors down into their essences. Mint ice cream is minty-er than a mint leaf (trust me I've eaten these) and I don't think I will ever find an equal. Chocolate sorbet is far from your typical sorbet - extremely rich and decadent with almost a hint of soy. Salted caramel is delicious. Creamy and oily, but not overly so like Humphry Slocombe. Not nearly as sweet as Bi-Rite and Humphry but equally delicious due to the strong flavors (thus avoiding the brainfog that follows sugar overload). Stays cold and solid much longer than Bi-Rite but not as long as Smitten. Waffle cones are also delicious and smell great as you walk past. Lots of seating, but can still get crowded on weeknights/ends. Protip: their maple pecan bars, though not the main attraction, are actually quite delicious too!

Smitten
"The engineer with a fancy pipe-dream turned reality"
Expensive but great quality. A small is two scoops with a baby spoon which gives the illusion of generous quantity. Just the right combination of creaminess (creamy without being oily like Humphry Slocombe or overly filling like Bi-Rite) and sweetness (sweeter than Hometown but not as sweet as Bi-Rite). Doesn't melt too fast. Chunks are larger than Hometown (Hometown doesn't really have any chunks to be honest) but smaller than Bi-Rite's. They are very generous with their toppings, so get them if you are in the mood - it's worth it! Note that there is no option to sample flavors because they make to order, but you really can't go wrong. Cute, clean and brightly lit locations with some sitting and lots of standing room. A great way to try it for free is to download the Thanx app - you'll get a free small ice cream! https://signup.thanx.com/smittenicecream/Ellen-71691555

Twirl n'Dip
"The happy-go-lucky toddler"
Definitely overpriced given that it is simply soft-serve dipped in chocolate and served out of a food truck, and yet still somehow worth it... because how else in the world is one supposed to obtain chocolate shell-coated soft serve?! Not to mention it is right next to Cal Academy of Sciences & DeYoung Museums too with a nice outdoors patch of grass to eat it on. Adding sprinkles is pricey but worth it if you are trying to make your ice cream look photogenic. Strangely enough, would come here again despite the high price. But not too often.

Bi-Rite
"The popular teenage girl who makes fashion look fashionable"
Slightly overhyped: the flavors are solid but nothing special to warrant such long lines, and the ice cream melts fast which is disappointing for such a well-known creamery. Bi-Rite does get to claim a good location, though, as it is near Dolores Park. Minimal seating in store. Their ice cream is very sweet, creamy, dense and filling (a bit too much for me). Flavor options include the reliable classics, with generous chunks in many of the options (carrot cake had entire cubes of cake!). Love the fact that you can get a cone for no extra charge and the same amount of ice cream.

Holy Gelato! (right down the street from Hometown Creamery)
"The pretend-foreign cousin who is actually American"
Good flavor selection, but does not meet my high standards for gelato (nothing really beats the real deal in Italy). Friendly service, but unimpressive ambiance.

Humphry Slocombe
"The adventurous chemist"
Have tried their ice cream, but not in-store. Creative flavors but way too sweet and creamy for me - even richer than Bi-Rite. My lips and fingers were coated in oil afterwards... Good for the novelty but would not try again.

Still need to try: Mitchell's, Salt&Straw, Souvla (they serve greek yogurt, not ice cream, but that sort of counts right?)
author: Ellen T.

description: This place is awesome! The ice cream tastes amazing, and I love that they offer really unique flavors alongside the old standbys. Yesterday I tried their "Unity" ice cream that includes a cheesecake base (NY), berry swirl (CA), and cornbread (the South). Tasted fantastic! Of their classic flavors, my favorites are the chocolate peanut butter and the mint chip, but really they're all great.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Finally!!!! Mini servings for $2.50. And mini waffle cones! Tried all the flavors and went with good ol' mint chip. But it was all great. Made in small batches on site, in the neighborhood and delicious
author: Steph M.

description: Kinda surprised at the low review score. Maybe it's just the flavors I got? I'm currently on a Humphry Slocombe peanut butter fudge swirl addiction, so when I saw Hometown's peanut fudge flavor I just had to get it. Their peanut butter fudge is heavier on the fudge aspect. It reminds me of having a peanut butter cup. The fudge is really sharp, almost to the point of being too much yet the peanut butter balances it out. I still prefer Humphry Slocombe's peanut butter flavor. I also tried the baklava flavor. I'm a huge baklava fan and was surprised that I've never seen baklava ice cream. There is a fair amount of nuts, filo, and cinnamon. The only thing missing for me was a stronger flavor of honey. Maybe they could swirl in some actual honey to add a more prominent flavor? It'd look pretty too.
author: Michael H.

description: My sister and I went here a few days ago in the late afternoon and had a great experience. When we walked in the shop wasn't too busy, but there were a few people sitting down enjoying their ice cream. My sister ordered one scoop of cookies and cream in a cone and I got a hot chocolate. Both items cost $2.50, which is fantastic considering both the quality and quantity we received. The man who served us (who I later found out was a co-owner) was super friendly and nice. Great service and great food. The hot chocolate was AMAZING- like seriously the best I've ever had. My sister also raved about her ice cream. She said you could really taste the cookies and that the texture of the ice cream was great. She also noted that the cone had a slightly cinnamon-y flavor, which she liked. Overall, this place is super great and we look forward to coming back!
author: Anabelle W.

description: Absolutely amazing service with even more amazing ice cream. Got to speak with the owners and was given a tour of the facility and some back story of the building and how they came to be. This is an absolute gem in San Francisco. This will be a must go for every future trip. You have to stop and see the world map with pins to see where customers from around the world have come from. I can not express how much we enjoyed our trip here.
author: Chris D.

description: The aroma of ice cream lured me and my friends in here after dinner one night and it did not disappoint! I believe the flavors change daily and there were so many great flavors I'd suggest getting the ice cream flight (4 flavors for $11.95) to try more flavors! All their ice cream is made from scratch and you can really taste the quality! Really loved the chocolate sorbet, thai tea, orange blossom sorbet, balsamic strawberry, and honey lemon rosemary. Their sorbets tasted so light and refreshing while their ice creams were really creamy so they definitely paired well together
author: Jingxi Z.

description: I wish the ice cream in general was a little creamier, but for any mint fans, mint chip is absolutely a MUST GET. It's busting with fresh and REAL mint flavor! I love it. Get it in a waffle cone and enjoy! (: I'm also a fan of their smidge size, since it's perfect for when you're still full from dinner but still want some ice cream without feeling sick or getting a food coma after!
author: Stephany L.

description:
Intro to my visit/experience: My friend and I come here all the time for dessert when we meet up in the 9th and Irving area for dinner. A refreshing family business and ice cream shop that makes their ice cream from scratch onsite.  

What I order: Flavors vary every day, with some seasonal or new unique flavors each day, along with some constants and fan favorites.  I've tried their earl grey lavender, alfajores flavor, mint chip, chocolate sorbet, and Madagascar vanilla with hot fudge. They have shaved ice too such as their espresso granita (can't recall the exact name) from time to time or some sort of vegan or dairy-free options.  Their chocolate chip cookies are also freshly-baked and amazing!

What I enjoy: 
-The unique and innovative flavors every time I visit.  Earl grey lavender is one of my favorites.
-Although the flavors are more of a mature taste, still tasty for all ages
-I usually get a chocolate chip cookies to accompany my ice cream
-The location is prime for dessert, within proximity of many restaurant options
-Friendly service
-Small business, family-owned 
-Seating space is very cozy and casual
-Cute wall art of SF landmarks 

What could be better: 
No complaints here.

End Note: 
I love this place! If you're into ice cream places like Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe, you will definitely enjoy the refreshing and innovative flavors this place has to offer!
author: Jasmine T.

description:
THE best ice cream I have had!  Fresh, high quality ingredients really come through in their irresistible ice cream; made from scratch!  It was hard deciding, since I loved the Strawberry Balsamic, Ginger, (Oh so!) Fresh Mint Chip and Aztec Chocolate; the first three my favorites.  Oh My!  The Fresh Mint Chip tasted like eating mint from the garden, other mint ice creams can't compare.... at all.  The Ginger was also fresh and sweet, a new favorite!  Balsamic Strawberry takes fresh strawberry and kicks it up a notch..or two!  The Aztec Chocolate was rich, spicy and had a bit of cinnamon.  Two scoops for me and two for my mom, on their amazing homemade cinnamon waffle cones..mmmm.  Luckily, we got all of the above between the two of us! We shared!   Sharing is caring.  This creamery also makes their own base, not the case with other S.F. creameries.
