The owner/people who work there could not have been nicer or more patient as I sampled almost all their flavors.  They are as sweet as their ice cream.  I can't wait to take all my friends here!

Side note:  Their bathroom is spacious and super clean. :)
author: Delicious B.

description: Having trouble picking one flavor? No need to pick just one, there is an option to choose the flight deck which is where you get to choose 5 different flavors of ice cream that they make freshly each and every day! Flight deck is around 11.95 as of 08/9/2016. We got the coconut, espresso, lemon lime sorbet, chocolate peanut butter, And roasted sesame. We also samples their ginger which was pretty good too. All of these ice cream flavors kept the integrity of each ingredient as well elevating the flavor. The roasted sesame ice cream was rich, creamy, and the sesame flavor wasn't hidden. Now if your a peanut butter lover like me, then you HAVE TO TRY THEIR PEANUT BUTTER CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM! It's basically the equivalent to Reese cup ice cream but it's creamy, smooth, and it's not overly sweet. Visually it's really nice looking too! Instagram and snapchat worthy! I would go back to try their other flavors. Be weary of parking, it's a bit difficult but it's SF, so just be mindful when coming here. Surrounding area is filled with other restaurants so this place is great for dessert or just to catch up with an old friend/classmates. Overall an excellent place to get a cup or sample cups of ice cream!
author: Roseanne V.

description: This is the best ice cream in the whole world ;-) But seriously, the texture is off the hook, the flavors are rotating and small batch, the cones are made fresh and taste like heaven, and the staff is knowledgeable. Can't decide? They off ice cream flights!! Aaaand you can ask for a side of come crumbles if you get your scoop in a bowl. I take all my visitors to this place. It's fantastic!
author: Kayleen R.

description: To me, this place is 3.5, but I'll round up. The ice cream is really good, but it's a little pricey. I tried the tiramisu and sandia alegria, and they were delicious. The tiramisu was really creamy, and the sandia alegria was very refreshing. You can definitely tell what the flavors are if you closed your eyes.
author: Rachel H.

description: Such a cute ice cream shop. They've been open for 9months and don't have  so much indoor seating, but all their ice cream flavors are so delicious and creamy. I definitely recommend the Meyer lemon  poppy seed and the fresh mint chip ( tastes like a mojito) !
author: Dianna C.

description: Great little hipster ice cream place.  This was my first time here.  Mint ice cream is made with real mint.  Dont expect traditional flavors here.  I had the mint ice cream and it was divine.  I never tastes real mint until here.  Staff is nice and looking forward to try more flavors.
author: Sonny G.

description: The name is a pretty perfect reflection of this place- it's hometown and for sure homemade. Awesome ice cream- rich and creamy while still being light and fluffy. We did the peanut butter, tiramisu and the mint chip. All were phenomenal!!!
author: Sashy M.

description: Great ice cream! Nice music and atmosphere! Loved the peanut butter and chocolate fudge flavor ice cream!
author: Inbal R.

description:
I love ice cream spots with heart. San Francisco's Hometown Creamery has a lot of heart. And great ice cream I might add! Let's start with the ice cream.

I ordered a scoop of Meyer Lemon Poppyseed in one of their homemade cones. It was fantastic. The ice cream and the cone perfectly complimented each other. My girlfriend had a root beer float with a scoop of Vanilla Bean that she was also raving about. Great ice cream: check!

Now let's talk about the ambiance. The shop has a bunch of hand-painted posters of the different districts in San Francisco. You get a really good fee of San Francisco here. There are plenty of tables and the workers are extremely friendly and down to earth.

The last thing I will add is that they offer flights of a variety of different flavors of ice cream. Basically, you can sample a good amount of five different flavors presented on a beautiful platter. I definitely intend on trying this some time. Their smidge size is also very cute.
author: Mickey C.

description: Not a fan. Came here after a long day at Golden Gate Park. Got a small size cone and scoop with some Apple Cidar. All of it was subpar. Was really hyped to get good ice cream but it wasn't good at all.
author: Rahim N.

description:
Awesome to see another business open up in the Inner Sunset with owners passionate about their trade. Been here twice and tried "Tea Time on the Thames" (Earl Grey Tea and Lavender) and "Fresh Mint". The flavors were amazing and you can taste the quality. Can't wait to try their other flavors, which get put in rotation. 

I totally recommend trying this place out! And they close at 10pm, perfect for a late night sweets craving. :)
author: Sheiva Y.

description: Came here for the first time with my boyfriend we just were looking around for some ice cream to snack on and came across here and I needed to use the bathroom lol. There bathroom is really nice and clean by the way lol. The inside of the store is really cute. I love that all their ice cream are handmade with their own flavors. I got the peanut butter fudge and it was really good! Will come here again.
author: Carmen G.

description: Yeah I get that it's homemade in small batches like it says on the wall but for me the flavors were a little too weird. I mean I like weird flavors too but please give me a few regular ones too. I did like how they have the "flights" kinda like a beer tasting! Probably not gonna come back though, lots of good dessert in the city.
author: Blaine S.

description: This new ice cream creamery can possibly be my new favorite ice cream spot, I'm just waiting for them to make earl grey ice cream confirm my final choice. What I like about them is that they are willing to test out new flavors. I have the honey lemon Rosemary and it was yummy.
author: Angela T.

description:
I was drawn in by the interesting (and tasty) flavors. Upon entering I was promptly helped. The staff was helpful, warm, and alluring. 

I was helped by the ice creamer maker himself, a kind and attractive man with piercing blue eyes and an (British?) accent. He let me try three flavors, baklava, tea time on the thames (earl grey with lavender), and Meyer lemon with poppy seeds. The winner was the earl grey. 

My recommendations for this business are that they allow more than one flavor per cup, slightly bigger scoops (it's almost as pricey as Smitten), and they should have a rewards card/stamp card (eg free ice cream after tenth scoop). 

I love the vibe and wish the best of luck to this nice discovery.
author: Amadeia R.

description: I'm not an ice cream fan in general. I usually prefer savory dishes and the occasional baked pastry. But Hometown Creamery's ice cream is exceptional. Popped in with my little ones and with very slight reluctance had a sample. (We all know I don't NEED ice cream.) But it was exquisite! Saadi, one of the owners, graciously served us and answered all our questions about process and ingredients and honored my children's requests for additional tastes even though they were sold at first bite. The fresh mint chip was divine: simultaneously simple and sophisticated. Especially appreciate the smaller portions and appropriately sized waffle cones! Perfect for kids (and indulging adults). Who could say no to a Hometown Creamery smidge cone?! Treat yourself! It's worth it!
author: Vanessa L.

description: Best chocolate ANYTHING I've ever had... and I've had a lot of chocolate. The chocolate sorbet is out of this world delicious. Unbelievable. Your life isn't complete until you try this thing. Nothing touches it. Oh my god, so good.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Instant regular! We tried it for the first time today and couldn't be more impressed. When you walk in the door, you get the aroma of fresh waffle cones. I ordered a double of Chocolate Sorbet and Honey Lemon Rosemary, which was a great combo, on the waffle cone. I'll definitely get that again, though I can't wait to try some of the other flavors. As you've probably already read, EVERYTHING on the menu is made from scratch on location, which means major points for me. 

I like the decor. Great vibe. Waaaayyy better use of space than the stuffy restaurant that was there before. 

I read some reviews citing few flavors and high prices. Totally inaccurate. If you're used to Baskin-Robbins or something, sure, but if you have an appreciation for rich intensity of flavor an quality ingredients, you'd never balk at their moderate pricing or lack of excessive variety. It's a perfectly balanced array of flavors and dynamics. 

As a neighborhood local, I'm particularly excited that I don't have to go all the way to Humphry Slocombe in the Mission to get my gourmet ice cream fix! 

The only suggestion I have is to eventually add a great soft serve option. Even just a flavor or two like Strauss at Gott's (Ferry Building). 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Justin H.

description: Pricey for ice cream. Small location with not much sit down room for a group. Dropped by on a whim with friends and didn't realize they do ICE CREAM FLIGHTS. WUT. Wish I had done that but I stuck with coffee (which was ok). Nothing too amazing.
author: Stefanie S.

description: Seriously this place was such a let down. I've been wanting to try this place for a long time cause it seems like a cool ice cream shop. Ice cream here is nothing special. Sure... they have different flavors and all but the ice cream taste more like ice than cream. I should have known when I saw a Flight left on a table and the person only took like one scoop from each of the five different flavors. Guess they weren't impressed either.
author: Gir G.

description: Hometown Creamery had opened recently, and my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try. Everything is made on site, from their refreshing ice cream to their crunchy waffle cones! They offer free samples so I decided to try the tiramisu. It tasted good, but my final decision was to go with the Fresh Mint and Chip -- it did not disappoint! I thoroughly enjoyed how refreshing it was, and the waffle cone was the cherry on top for me. My boyfriend had gotten the Cafe Mocha, and he was delighted as well. Granted, it's a tad bit pricey (around $8 for two single scoop cones), but the taste was well worth it! We will definitely be coming back!
author: Jessica V.

description:
Bright, intense flavors - especially love the Aztec chocolate!  Stands up well to BiRite, etc.  

Refreshingly different texture than the usual suspects in SF.  I was on the fence about the texture the first visit since I'm usually a fan of really dense ice creams, but it's really grown on me.  And the freshly made waffle cones included in the price of a scoop hit the spot.

Owners are really friendly and the space is great for kids.  It still has the bones of the Hotei space, so perhaps they should embrace it and offer Asian flavors and toppings as well.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Love that Adar and Saadi have this ice cream shop!

Pluses:

- Homemade art work! Saadi did it himself.

- Lovely ice cream, delicious treats.

- You can order the 'smidge' size if you're watching your weight and still get a taste without feeling guilty. (And on a side note, Adar also just happens to be a personal trainer, so if you order the big one, he can show you how to keep the pounds off. I can really appreciate a trainer with realistic life balance...)

- These brothers are always smiling - I predict that they will win every heart in the neighborhood with their winning combination of delicious desserts and family-style love.

Minuses: 

Can't think of anything I didn't like. 

I'm really happy for them. This is the kind of neighborhood business I can definitely get behind. They handle the crowds efficiently and never stop smiling. Even when I'm just walking past, I enjoy seeing people through the window who have ordered the trough-sized dish with many scoops to share. It's like a fantasy dessert - how fun!
author: Heidi-Jane S.

description:
Hometown Creamery feels less like an ice cream store, and more like a trip to the family's living room. The two charming brothers who own the store welcome you in and chat you up, demonstrating their obvious passion for flavor creation and community alike. 
The ice cream flavors are exquisitely crafted. I've brought many friends to the Creamery, and the most common comment is "whoa, that really *tastes* like what it's supposed to taste like." The brothers experiment with some delicate flavors, and they always come through as clear as if you were eating the original food. Some of my favorites have been Lemon Speculoos, and their...maybe it was Honey with Bourbon.
The space is a lot of fun: great decour, spacious, clean seating, paintings of the SF neighborhoods, and a map with pins that you can add to if your own hometown isn't represented yet. In the back is a wall of spices in Mason jars that the brothers will occasionally grab to show when describing a flavor, and a window to where the ice cream is made.
The cones are thick and crunchy, made right there in front of you-- you can smell them all the way down the street. Cones are free in both the regular size and the "smidge" size, as are extra cone pieces on top of your ice cream.
One of the best desserts I've ever had was when they brought out a freshly baked tray of cookies and created an ice cream sandwich for my friend and me -- they even split it meticulously down the center for us.
Additional mentions: home-spiced cider, water station, and restroom.
This place deserves five stars for making me feel welcome, delighting me repeatedly with new and inventive flavors, and keeping it personal.
I originally wrote in this review about a month ago that my two points of criticism were that the line was confusing and the texture of the sorbets was a little off, but since then they have revisited the sorbet technique and are now creating an exquisite, creamy texture with even more flavor than the ice creams. Tonight a friend and I enjoyed Blood Orange sorbet paired with their rich chocolate sorbet. 
 I love being a regular there--they certainly keep me coming back.
author: Allxie C.

description: Walked into this place by accident and was pleasantly surprised at the decor and environment. The French roast ice cream was to die for.
author: Peter D.

description: I was in the city for a long morning hike with friends and they suggested to get some ice cream here after our delicious meal at San Tung. Right before we approached the shop, I instantly smelled the warm fragrance of cinnamon spice that reminded me of autumn. I decided to get a single scoop of carrot cake ice cream in a cone. I loved how the ice cream had actual baby carrots, almonds, and pecans in it. It was extremely flavorful and exactly what I imagined it to taste like. I appreciate how they make fresh cones right off their waffle maker. It had the perfect thickness and sweetness!! I would definitely come back to try their other flavors :)
author: Michelle T.

description: I had a scoop of the lemon poppy seed ice cream - loved the flavor. My friend had peanut butter fudge in a cone & also liked it. The decor is cute (murals) & they have some seats that look out on the street so you can people watch.
author: Laura N.

description:
You have to try this. This is some of the best and most unique ice cream I've ever had. I spoke to the co-owner, and he told me it is because they are the only ice creamerie in the city that makes their own base creams for each flavor.

It'll be tough to go back to regular ice cream! Pro tip: get a homemade waffle cone. The chocolate chip cookie was fantastic (also made in-house.) Treat yourself!
author: Will K.

description: Loved the flight of ice creams. Get to try different fresh and creative flavors. My favorite was Myers lemon Rosemary. I was excited about basil but it was ok. Totally recommend it.People who served the ice cream had a great attitude.
author: Roopali R.

description: flavors were unique and whimsical. while things like cucumber or basil made things interesting, i just didnt find them very satisfying to eat. mint was very strong to the point i couldnt taste the cream.  also the cone was a tad thick and it was hard in a not so crispy way.  service was excellent tho.
author: Jason C.

description: Oh my goodness. The ice cream is absolutely divine! Fantastic customer service and a seasonal selection. I love this place! You have to try a smidge!
author: Issy G.

description: A hip, trendy little place. The ice cream flavors are limited, but each vary widely. I can guarantee you won't like all of them, but each one is its own experience. You can taste the love and care put into each flavorful experiment. The flight of samples is a bit expensive, but it's a great non-committal way to try almost all of the unusual varieties.
author: Corey S.

description: This is the BEST ice cream shop in the city. The chocolate gelato is delicious. The brothers who own the place are so friendly. And my favorite part -- you can get a smidge, which is a smaller than a single. So you can try multiple flavors at once. Forget Birite, go here NOW.
author: Egon S.

description: Fresh made, small batch ice cream and waffle cones. The waffle cone was delish. The ice cream flavors were pretty good but the ice cream was a little icy. Wish it was creamier.
author: Wanchee P.

description: This place is amazing! The brothers who own it are very friendly as well. They pasteurize their own dairy on site (got licensed to do so) and come up with amazing flavors. They also use 'real' ingredients (like real mint steeped in the milk for mint flavor...etc). Best ice cream!
author: Cody H.

description: Love it!  I ordered the ice cream flight and loved every bite!  Great flavors and fun vibe!
author: Deborah F.

description: With all the ice cream shops in the city, this one does not stand out.  I liked the idea of the ice cream flight and their creative flavors, but definitely not my favorite ice cream.  Their cones are good, but no sprinkles :(
author: Jessica K.

description:
Real flavors, creamy ice cream, friendly folks. I have to be careful to not amble on down here every day!  Tried the cinnamon and the mint flavors - wow. They obviously put a lot of thought and care into their products. So delicious!  I settled on vanilla in a tasty home-made cone and smiled the whole way home. 
Can't wait to visit those brothers again!
author: Jodi O.

description: Pretty cool place to come with some friends to grab some ice cream. Little mom and pop's shop was very friendly. Weren't that busy, so we were approached right away. They have this cool thing where they have shot glasses with different ice cream flavors, i suggest on doing that, rather than buying just a single flavor. Majority of their ice cream is made in the back, or some of the ingredients is imported to San Francisco to make. Only thing is that its difficult to park, but hey its San Francisco, so what did you expect. Thank you!
author: Kristoffer C.

description: The ice cream was amazing. SO GOOD! The place itself was clean and comfortable. I wish we had a location near our home back east.
author: B W.

description: I had the cookies 'n cream ice cream which was very good-I could really taste the cookies and the consistency was good and my sister got hot chocolate which she said was one of the best she's ever had. The server we had was very nice and the parlor is very welcoming and pleasant.
author: Isabelle W.

description: The flavors were unique and full of flavors. The server was energetic and knowledgeable. The waffle cone as directed was awesome with a hint of cinnamon. I had the earl grey and lavender. What can I say I love earl grey and lavender so I thought it tasted fantastic. Also had the lemon rosemary flavor which was very good too. My boyfriend had the mint chip which was full of flavor and so refreshing. He said it reminded him of the mint mojito from Philz haha. But I agree with the other reviewers, they missed that perfect score from me because the ice cream lacked in the creamy texture and was a little icy more like a sorbet. But they do get the extra star for their creativity and unique flavors. Really good combinations! Worth a try!
author: Wendy L.

description: I tried almost all of their offerings - love this place! The ice cream flavors were pretty unique and well crafted. Both the ice cream and waffle cones are made in house and you can taste the freshness. I absolutely love the spiced hot cider - perfect for winter strolls. The hot chocolate reminds me of the ones I had in NYC - rich, not overly sweet, and yum!   Milkshakes are delicious - and the serving size is smaller than the usual to my delight. A definite recommend, this!
author: Pallavi S.

description: The ice cream was perfection!  I ordered a "double smidge" of Lemon Poppyseed and Peanut Butter and Chocolate on a waffle cone.  Although the cone looked small, I was happily overwhelmed with the rich creamy flavors.  (even the cone was the best I've ever tasted.)  The people working there were so genuinely nice and we even met the artist (owner?) who painted the charming panel scenes of San Francisco decorating the walls.  This place is phenomenal.
author: Julia S.

description: Maybe we got lucky, but the flavors were AMAZING! I had the honey lemon rosemary, and my friend had one scoop each of the mint and basil. Definitely recommend!
author: Jacquelyn G.

description: Imaginative flavors, sweet staff. The patient folks behind the counter let me and my friend taste every single flavor before deciding. I also appreciate the option of a smaller scoop size--it gave me an excuse to get two flavors!
author: Vieve R.

description: Great, friendly service! Had the most delicious sundae and everything they serve dessert on and with can be composted. Neat to see a small business lowering its carbon footprint.
author: Leslie G.

description: Good even on a cold day! Love their Meyer Lemon Poppy Seed flavor! Friendly staff to customers and the earth! #ecofriendly. Coming back soon! 10/10
author: Tatiana D.

description: Love how they make their own ice cream. All flavors taste exactly what it stated. Order their mint chip and it just woah me. The moment I tried it, it felt like I went into my backyard and picked up a mint leave to eat. FRESH! It didn't taste artificial. The ice cream is not as creamy as the store bought containers and they do melt a lot faster. It seems like a mix of ice cream and sorbet. Taste unique. Their house made waffle cone was extremely tasty as well. Sweet, and crispy.
author: Sury C.

description: Always room for ice cream after lunch and this place doesn't disappoint with its creative flavors and friendly staff.
author: Charlie M.

description: This area has a lot of ice cream stores, and I'm sure they all have their merits. This particular ice cream establishment stands above the rest. The flavors are complex. The service is immaculate. I will never go to another ice cream store again. Mitchell's??? Mitchell who? I had the La Vie en Rose ice cream and was transported to another dimension of ice cream goodness. Cheers! Go eat and enjoy!
author: Feed Her O.

description: So this ice cream place gives me mixed feelings. I don't love it, but I don't hate it. Personally, I'm the kind of person who craves rocky road ice cream and this is the kind of place that definitely won't satisfy that craving. However they do offer really interesting signature flavors. Most of their flavors are a little too unique for my "basic-thrifty ice cream-craving self" so this isn't my go to shop. But i am giving them 4 stars for their delicious waffle cones! To be honest, the smell of the waffle cones got me to come in! I'll probably just order cones to go next time and fill them with rocky road at home.
author: Reina C.

description: A must.... So amazing.... Owners are really friendly and ice cream is so fresh. Try the cone. I usually don't like cones but these homemade cones, which I've seen made, are out of this world. Enjoy!
author: KandK B.

description: I love this place! The ice creams are all killer, and the staff is very helpful. They never seem irritated when you ask to try multiple flavors and help direct you to picking a good choice. Afterwords, the guy who helped us showed us how to make a waffle cone and then let us snack on the waffle cone duds-which was pretty cool! To me the ice cream is just as good as the Bi-Rites and Humphrey Slocombes of SF, but without any lines and a much more relaxed vibe!
author: Marilyn M.

description: I wish I could give this place a higher review. The enthusiasm and hospitality of the owners is amazing. They have a big heart for the neighborhood and I appreciate how they welcome everyone in with a huge smile and great service. I like how they are trying to offer a unique selection if ice creams. Whenever I walk in, I am excited to see what flavors they have posted. Ultimately, the reason I don't love this place is due to the execution of the flavors. There's always something a little off in terms of expectations vs reality. With multiple ingredients going into these interesting flavors, there's often one flavor that is too pronounced and throws the taste off. Also, the texture is extremely icy and I prefer ice cream to be on the creamier side. The desire and willingness to make a great product is here so I think they have a lot of potential. I'm looking forward to the growth and development of the flavors and consistency. I will say they make great waffle cones.
author: Alice H.

description: I love coming here for dessert after a good meal in the inner sunset. The service is always great - they are so friendly and welcoming, and the ice cream never disappoints. Bonus points for their handmade waffle cones! Although the flavors dont seem to change very often, (it would be nice to have some more variety) I like their fresh mint (very minty!) and their honey lemon rosemary. I read the story of the two brothers who started this business, and its great. It makes me feel good knowing that everything is handmade and local.
author: Annie L.

description: I'm generally not a huge fan of ice cream, but this place had the best ice cream I've tasted in my life and I have frequented popular ice cream shops in the city. Owner is super nice, really cool local feel inside with mini murals of San Francisco's different districts. I did a double smidge (smidge is a great option if you don't want to do large amounts of ice cream in one sitting) of basil and purple rain - amazing combination and phenomenal flavors! Open for a little less then a year now, and will now be my go to place for dessert/treats. Sorbet and dairy free options avail for those who cannot do dairy. Glad I found it!
author: Janelle H.

description:
What caught me the most are the flavors.  Strawberry Balsamic, Honey Lemon Rosemary, Tiramisu...  The list goes on.  The ingredients are responsibly sourced, everything served is made in house (including the caramel sauce and cookies!), and the brothers who run the place are characters.  

I couldn't be happier this place is open.  Go there or enjoy a life without flavor.
author: Craig F.

description: the bourbon maple pecan bar was delicious!!!! the flight was a must try as a first timer. i suggest sharing the flight because it may look small but its really a lot of ice cream. there was two of us and we couldnt even finish the flight. plus if you cant decide on a flavor, you might as well try more than one!
author: Sarina A.

description: Hands down some of the best ice cream I've had in a long time. I personally love early grey and lavender which is why the Tea Time with Thames is so perfect. And their hand made waffle cones are amazing! Next time I'm in SF this will definitely be my first stop! :)
author: Niki W.

description: I was so excited to have a creamery in the Inner Sunset, but unfortunately for me, this one just doesn't quite compare to the likes of Bi-Rite or Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  It is, as other reviewers have complained, icy.  I hate to write a bad review for these guys because they are so nice, but I just don't think the 4 star Yelp rating is justified.  The flavors are interesting and unique.  On the upside, the service was fantastic, and the homemade waffle cone was amazing.
author: Diana C.

description: I really like the hipster feel the place offers.  You can ask for samples to try their flavors.  The day I went I got the fresh mint chip and coffee in their homemade ice cream cone.  I just felt that the ice cream was a little bit icy.  The flavors were spot on but the texture was not the best.  The workers were really friendly and welcoming.
author: Sam L.

description: Ordered the hot chocolate .... way too sweet! Tasted like 100% sugar syrup. I drank about 1/10th and threw the rest out.  My friend who ordered it as well there threw her's out also because it was too sweet.
author: Laurence S.

description: Bright, clean flavors! Nice textural balance (although I tend to like my ice creams with a little thicker mouth feel). I really liked it as did the big group of ice cream snobs I was with. The only downside is it's expensive.
author: Michael S.

description: This place is great. My favorite flavor is the Rocky Road to Happiness, but Vanilla is also pretty awesome. I also tried the Earl Gray Lavender, the Peanut Butter one and the Chocolate Sorbet. The latter was really good but I am not a big fan of dark chocolate. Definitely one of the best ice cream spots I've tried, and I've tried many. Love that they offer very small sizes or the flight to share!
author: Dodi G.

description: I love the energy and friendliness of the owners! I love that the waffle cone is included in the ice cream price! However, I did not like the taste of the ice cream. The mint was an herb taste like chewing on mint leaves (similar to but not as bad as Smitten) and the chocolate was not rich or creamy, just kind of bland and meh. Since those are the only two flavors that interested me, I probably won't be back unless they change things up.
author: Laura W.

description: Some of the best ice-cream and service around. Great flavors and awesome staff! Very unique and I can't wait to go back and try more.
author: Rose H.

description: I walked into this place to see an old friend, but walked out in a heaven of sorts. Hometown Creamery boasts a variety of exotic flavors and tastes for all to be had. It's hard to pick a favorite ice cream when all of the ice cream here is delicious. What I love the most is the fact that the owners use only the freshest ingredients and it truly is a labor of love. The mint chip tastes like the mint that grows in my mothers garden and the chocolate tastes like the most rich creamy chocolate ice cream I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. I had the flight of ice cream so I could taste as many flavors as possible. All of this ice cream is made in house! Truly, this place is a wonder to behold. The fact that one of the owners painted SF's local neighborhoods on large panels that circle the room, goes to show how much talent lies in this creamery. I highly recommend stopping by at this ice cream shop to experience heaven on earth.
author: Talia S.

description: I do not think I could be any happier than my neighborhood got such an awesome ice cream spot! I feel like they made ice cream into an art here, the concoction of flavors is incredible! Great job guys. I also loved the San Francisco neighborhood paintings on the wall, and even more so love the door mat that says hello in so many languages. This place represents everything I like about San Francisco. Now, as to the ice cream flavors, I loved both the Peach Lemon Thyme Sorbet and the Earl Grey Lavender. As you can tell from the ingredients, both flavors are not your typical Safeway ice cream, but if you are into having your taste buds go wild, take the chance. I brought my mom here after a nice trip to the De Young, and she really enjoyed her scoop of Chocolate sorbet. I really wanted to get the flight of ice cream, but she wasn't up for the challenge, so I will come back to try more flavors and get the flight.
author: Nikita K.

description: Peanut butter chocolate fudge was ridiculously great. It wasn't too peanut buttery where that's all you taste but had equal amount of fudge flavors. Super creamy, especially in that home made waffle cone. Yes, $4 for a scoop, but what do you expect, most ice cream places in SF now are around that price.
author: Jackie S.

description: I don't have much of a sweet tooth so I might not be the best judge of ice cream, but I enjoyed what I had here.  Great quality vanilla that stands up to pretty much any I've had outside of the Mexican Vanilla at Amy's in Austin, TX.  The "smidge" is the perfect amount if you just want a little something sweet without committing to a normal full portion.  I like what they've done with the old Hotei space too.  All in all a nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: Joshua W.

description: The worst ice cream I've ever had! I tried the Madagascar vanilla- so bland and tasteless. My boyfriend has the pineapple sorbet- same! Bland, underwhelming flavors. How do you mess up ice cream?
author: Emily R.

description: Best mint chip and cinnamon ice cream ever. The flight sampler is a great way to try out all the different flavors.
author: Joseph A.

description: Pricey place. The fresh mint chip was pretty good. It tasted like real mint leaves. But they should turn their music down. I can't go anywhere in SF to hang out and relax without blaring speakers. Seems like every place in town has bar syndrome.
author: Opal L.

description:
HOORAY! This neighborhood needed a new ice cream joint, and deliver they did. Boyfriend and I stopped by today after dinner.The line was out the door! I am glad all the local neighbors are stopping by to support :) The two brothers were the only ones running the show, but the line went pretty fast and they were plenty generous with samples for the customers. 

We tried their peanut butter w/ chocolate fudge, and their strawberry balsamic in a "smidge" size. I was very happy with the strawberry balsamic, but the peanut butter chocolate was PHENOMENAL. If the line wasn't so long, I might have went back to buy another scoop. 

PROS: 
-Very fair prices
-Great and unique ice cream flavors - I'm looking forward to the earl grey + lavender
-Friendly service
-They use metal spoons for samples instead of disposables (environmentally friendly!)
-EVERYTHING in the shop is freshly made. 
-They have ice cream flights! 

No cons yet. Looking forward to all the other flavors they will come up with!
author: Sam T.

description: Friendly people, yummy/fresh chocolate cookies. Cafe Mocha ice cream tasted like coffee grounds, mint chocolate chip tasted like a mint leaf, and chocolate sorbet was even too chocolatey for a 6 year old.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Literally just finished my sorbet and regret not getting a larger size, lol!! First time in here today, loved the simple, wooden ambiance of the shop, and the friendly workers. They have three different sizes, one is a mini scoop called "the Smidge" for $2.50. I ordered that size in Honey Lemon Rosemary, and it was so yummy... Definitely will be coming back here.
author: Debra K.

description: Walking into the Hometown Creamery, it's very roomy and has a nice atmosphere for an ice cream parlor. I had the Peanut Butter Fudge ice cream - which was deliciously rich, and we were able to sit down and enjoy it without problems. Definitely a great spot to get some ice cream and chill. Get it?
author: Adam C.

description: Nice to see a mom & pop joint flourish on a corner surrounded by tourist traffic and overpriced boba/frozen yogurt shops. I tried the Rosemary Lemon ice cream. There was another flavor in there (raspberry?) which I forgot - all three ingredients were evenly highlighted. Not creamy, but definitely not sherbet. Yum. Can't wait to try the other flavors! As an added bonus, the owners were super friendly, having only been open 15 min.  :-)
author: Jaime Y.

description: I'm torn between 4 and 5 stars! Will need to come back to try more flavors. Tasted 5, 3 were amazing: choc sorbet and peach-lemon sorbet and choc peanut butter! Definitely worth the line!
author: Ana C.

description: I love this place. There is original artwork on the walls depicting San Francisco neighborhoods. The ice cream is made from scratch and delicious. My favorite is the peanut butter chocolate. The owners are super friendly and play great music. The bathroom is clean. There is lots of seating and the atmosphere is such that you actually want to sit down and enjoy your desserts. This is a wonderful addition to an already great neighborhood - the Inner Sunset.
author: june j.

description: Interesting ice cream texture. I remember the rosemary lemon had a very dense texture. It was definitely really good. Can't wait to come back!
author: Kelly O.

description: Awesome ice cream. Super fresh ingredients- my mint chocolate chip ice cream actually tasted like MINT (imagine that?) yummy homemade cones too and great decor. Great place!
author: Ilona W.

description: MMM!  Excellent ice cream & baked goods. They have a small, deliberate selection of flavors & a viewing window to see them brewing their magic!  It is dangerously in walking distance from our spot... (:
author: Lindsey D.

description: This place is amazing! Homemade ice cream  made on site, with natural ingredients and unusual combinations.  Try the Cantuccini, which tastes just like biscotti with anise, raisins, and almonds.  The Mint Chip is made with real mint so the flavor is potent.  Support these two talented brothers and their creativity!
author: Winnie F.

description:
As a local resident I was very excited to have another choice besides the frozen section of Andronicos, Holy Gelato, and JJ Ice Cream.

My first visit was on a Friday evening after dinner. We were not able to purchase or sample any of their products because it was very crowded. People were crowding around the cashier and the ice cream. Although the freshly made cones smelled delicious, I and a few others decided not to figure out the queue and walked out.

Wanting to really offer our patronage, I decided to visit on a Wednesday evening when it wasn't as busy. I was able to sample a few flavors, but the sample the gentlemen was scooping for me was not enough to really get a sense of the taste. It was literally just a thin sheet. I also noticed there were a lot of options for gelato mixed in with ice cream. It would have been nice to see the gelato and ice creams arranged together so it will be easier to distinguish what is what. After sampling a few ice cream flavors, none really hit home to me so I went for the safety flavor, Vanilla. So I ended up getting a single scoop of the Madagascar Vanilla and it was a huge disappointment. It was not creamy, but hard, icy, and grainy. 

There might be some growing pains the brothers might be figuring out. The layout and flow from selecting and paying for the product was confusing when it was crowded. The sample sizes were pathetic and for a "creamery"... might as well grab a pint of Ben and Jerry's from your local freezer section.

Maybe there are some kinks the brothers need to work out, but I'm willing to try it again in a few months.
author: country g.

description: I've got a soft spot for local, homemade spots, and I have a hard time saying no to ice cream.  We loved this place!  Robert got Strawberry balsamic, and I got Honey lemon rosemary.  Both were excellent, and came in a waffle cone that's made on site.  We chatted with the owners for a bit and found out everything is actually made on site!  We will definitely be stopping in on our walks home from the Academy of Sciences!
author: ROB L.

description: Amazing ice cream. Great people and its awesome to that everything is made on site from the waffle cone to every flavor of ice cream. New favorite ice cream spot in SF!
author: Curtis Y.

description: This place was great! The ice cream tasted super fresh. Who knew mint chocolate chip ice cream was actually white and not green ;)
author: Kristen R.

description: We got the ice cream flight, and it was the perfect amount of each flavor for three people. It came in cute little shot glasses, and the flavors were so good. A little pricey, though.
author: Sarah J.

description: Excellent ice cream. A bit pricy but worth it!!! We got the flight and loved every single flavor, chic mint, rocky road, chocolate, vanilla and tea!!!
author: Adelaide B.

description:
The first time I was there, Saturday, July 11, I tried the chocolate sorbet.  Today I went back and had the chocolate sorbet once again (I tend to get into a rut rather quickly).  I must say that it is the best, most chocolatey, sorbet I have ever had.  I must try another flavor next time.

The shop looks nicely kept, the two brothers who own and operate it are very personable and knowledgeable about their products, the waffle cones come at no additional cost, and the chocolate sorbet is really good!
author: Ralph J.

description: One of the owners was helping us out as we sampled the different flavors. The service was amazing, and the various flavors were so delicious. Make sure to get the freshly-made waffle cone at least as a topping if you decide to get it in a cup.
author: Sumeet V.

description: Be sure to ask for a cup if you get a cone. There's a hole at the bottom of the cone. Overall. The flavors are unique and might even be vegan. They lack the milky taste. The mint chip tastes like a mint mojito which was pretty entertaining.
author: Angela P.

description: Try some homemade waffle cone with chocolate sorbet, that was super delicious omg!! Refreshing for super hot day . Gonna go back and try some sour ice cream next time
author: Nichapatr P.

description: I'm not sure why this place has 5 stars. The ice-cream is just bad. People need to try birite and they will forget this place. The ambience is not bad. Has a neighborhood feel. That's it.
author: Gulshan L.

description: We were walking in the Inner Sunset and stumbled on to this place and we're so glad we did! Had a flight of ice cream and it was perfect for us to try different flavors! Good stuff!
author: Pam A.

description: An owner who's kind and welcoming coupled with high quality ice cream offered in very creative flavor combinations, this place is worth the journey from wherever you are.
author: Allison G.

description: I love the sizes available. Smidge is the best. It is tiny and is also available in cone as well as cup. Great size for a delicious desert. There both ice creams and sorbets. 9 flavors available. Ice cream flavors were rather so so. Macchaccino flavor was the best of all ice creams
author: Victoria H.

description: My husband and I Fell in love with Honey Lemon Rosemary and Fresh Mint flavor... I was so full from dinner, I wish I could have had more. Coming back soon.
author: Uma M.

description: I come here once a month or so on "date night" with my four year old son.  He is a tried and true fan of the chocolate, which is super rich and creamy.  This week we tried the sampling of 5 favors.  In addition to our usual chocolate, we had peach-lemon, cardamon, vanilla, and honey-lemon-rosemary.  I agree with another reviewer that the consistency is more gelato than creamy on most of them, but that doesn't take away from the deliciousness.  In addition to the unusual flavors to choose from, I love that they have the "smidge" size that is tiny for just when you want a taste.  I also highly recommend the cookies.  Their chocolate chip ones are AMAZING!!
author: Kathryn H.

description: Not worth it for $3.90 one scoop ice cream here. Honey lemon rosemary without dairy so I think it should called Sorbet. It melts really quickly and too sweet. I would rather to go Marco polo Gelato on Taravel St or Bi-Rite. Home made waffle was too hard and too thick to eat.
author: Jenny C.

description: I tried two flavors - a honey rosemary and vanilla. The initial lick was great - good balance, no individual flavor dominating. They definitely have that part of the process down. What I didn't like was the actual ice cream part - seems like it wasn't made well as there were large ice clusters which gave it a grainy, not creamy texture. It also melted fast. I'll try it once more, but for now I can't recommend it.
author: matt d.

description: Walked in and smelled the fresh waffle cones. I wish they had more flavors but that should come with time since this place is new. I had a single peach lemon thyme sorbet. I will come back to try the flight of 5 flavors for $11.95. I sampled the chocolate peanut butter and it was rich and flavorful. The mint chip tastes like fresh mint (it's the real deal).
author: Janelle O.

description: Who doesn't love ice cream? Unfortunately this place kind of killed my excitement. The options for flavors seemed kind of limited with several sorbets and not many ice creams. I got the strawberry balsamic & the mint, and on first lick I found the flavor of both kind of boring. After finishing my bowl, my impression was that I found the flavor of the ice cream to be more ice than cream. It seems like they read a book about making ice cream but haven't quite mastered the craft. The guys running the place are very friendly but not very efficient. The serving space isn't used well with the sink and scooper located behind the freezer so that the sever has to go back and forth constantly. The place is very clean, which is nice.I do wish this place luck, but on my first taste, I wasn't impressed and what they're selling isn't worth the price they're charging.
author: Anthony S.

description: Like the idea, and very tasty, but seems so overpriced! I've never seen such a small serving as the "smidge." Couldn't have been more than 5 bites. Better to at least get the single scoop, although at $4, I'll probably continue to frequent Holy Gelato. Also, the guy scooping the ice cream was using his bare hands and touching the waffle cones without any sort of napkin or barrier - I think they should take better sanitary precautions.
author: Alicia A.

description: the "smidge" is really that. maybe one bite. the flavor options left a lot to be desired. i got cookies and cream and it was good, don't get me wrong, but i think i would have needed much more of it in order to feel satisfied. it's not really rich, so I guess if thats what youre looking for, it's all yours. staff was super friendly though and the shop had a cool vibe to it!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Really cute late evening snack after night life at California academy of science! I had a smigde of Peanut butter chocolate fudge, just the right amount without being too full! Cool guys working there who were more than happy to let us sample! It's definitely a nice space to chill and relax!
author: Eimear H.

description: Fun flavors.  Have an ice cream flight I would have loved trying with someone else. Definitely worth a try if you are around the area. I had the peach thyme sherbert which was delicious and light.  Have the option for super small ice cream cups, if you are in the mood just for a taste of ice cream.
author: Lauren A.

description: Yes, as good as it gets! I am an ice cream freak and actually have ice cream blind tastings at my house with friends (also ice cream aficionados). And the winner is.........Hometown Creamery.  I like the fact that everything is made in house with clever and delicious pairings of ingredients, the quality is excellent and the guys running the place are friendly and accommodating, go treat yourself today.
author: Charles L.

description: Such unique flavors! Had a nice minty one that really lingered on the tongue.
author: Rajesh S.

description: Mint chocolate chip in a waffle cone.  Drop the mic.  You are welcome.  Oh and the black & tan with a side of salted caramel sauce is ridic.  Customer service is totally gracious and wonderful and the line moves fast.  Love at first bite!
author: Hannah H.

description: Awesome little ice cream shop, spacious and great service. Love the cone, and a possible hit.
author: E. O.

description: I had the strawberry single in a cone. It was dripping good. Cone was freshly made and still warm.
author: Chu N.

description: I don't know why people would have anything but the caipirinha sorbet from this place! I had to come here twice in 3 days! I'm addicted!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Funky and clean.  Good prices.  Very VERY tasty wholesome organic real healthy Sundae.  You can taste the mint leaves!  This is how dessert is supposed to be!
author: Anon A.

description: Worth the wait! Line was long but worth it! The fresh mint chip was indeed fresh , it tasted like it was made of fresh mint leaves , no artificial green coloring . It is pricey for a small scoop but I think the price is comparable to other shops. Great neighborhood spot !
author: Sophia C.

description: This place is awesome. It's cozy, warm and inviting. The owners switch the flavors, daily and that's pretty fun. The ice cream is delicious, creamy and unique. It's on the pricey side, so don't come looking for cheap desserts. I don't mind the price if I enjoy it, and I did. I usually won't choose ice cream as my dessert, but I totally would, if I could get a scoop from here. I will come back for more, and am looking forward to the new flavors.
author: Natalie N.

description: Couldn't have been happier with this place! Amazing service, delicious flavors, cool place. I loved my experience here and will return!! Thank you SF Hometown Creamery :) !!
author: Steph L.

description: Awesome vanilla and they offer a tiny cone and scoop called a "smudge". It's the perfect amount for just a taste! The owner seems very nice. Love it! Homemade waffles right there
author: Mel M.

description:
This is a small new ice cream place on the corner of 9th and Irving. There was quite a line on a weekend at noon but it was much quieter a few hours later. Inside, there were nice local touches like wall paintings of SF neighborhoods and Sly and the Family Stone playing on the speakers. They offer ice cream, milkshakes, and other treats. The flavors are not that crazy-sounding, but I left wishing I had tried all of them.

I got the Fresh Mint Chocolate Chip in a waffle cone. Its taste was both completely unexpected and exactly what it sounds like. The scoop was bursting with the flavor of fresh mint leaves! It was not your supermarket Mint Chocolate Chip. And the waffle cone was delicious, but maybe a bit too sweet. It tasted like a large, crispy cookie. I might get the free "waffle bits" as a topping next time instead.

Overall, a great new addition to the neighborhood. I hope it sticks around! And that the weather would play along more often.
author: Jesse I.

description: This place has just been opened for a month. I'm down from Alaska and was amazed. I had a smidge of the Baklava ice cream and the Honey Lemon Rosemary sorbet. They were both great. The background music is from the 70's and you want to dance. I'll be back again in November.
author: Jor V.

description: When the Japanese restaurant at this site went out of business, we were sad and worried about who/what would move in.  I couldn't be happier, and this is our new favorite place for dessert.  I love the unusual and creative flavors, and the smidge size is perfect for me.  (It helps minimize the guilt associated with starting to be a "regular" at an ice cream shop!)  The freshly baked waffle cones are an extra bonus.  Favorite flavors: Tea Time (Earl Grey tea with lavender) and the new vanilla/peach/oat.  Everyone who works here has been friendly, patient and helpful.  Do yourself a favor and stop by!
author: Flora K.

description:
Pros:
- homemade ice cream and cones.
- shop is clean

Cons:
- flavors are subpar...there's no wow factor or desire to go back for more.
- prices are too high for what you get.
- not enough flavors
author: A L.

description: Was craving dessert and my friend was craving a beer. SO we decided to do both BUT FIRST DESSERT. Was in the neighborhood and found this little gem so we decided to try it out. I couldn't decide on a flavor but wanted something light, so I got to sample the Hawaiian sorbet and the Fresh Mint Chip and decided that the FMC was my favorite pick of the day. Very refreshing, creamy, and light. They also have a size SMIDGE (1 scoop just enough for my light appetite cravings). Will definitely be back to try other flavors when in the area.
author: Virginia L.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco!!!  Amazing staff as well! Make guest feel so welcome! They create a wonderful atmosphere where you are able to enjoy and learn about all the delicious flavors they create in house. We love coming here often and keep bringing friends to experience!
author: Adelina M.

description:
The ice cream was alright, but there's a lot of misleading 5 star reviews for this place written by yuppies (yes a bit old school term for the influx of new people of SF that don't really know what they're talking about only that they're part of something "new" or "cool").

Pros:
1) The owners are very friendly
2) Layout is family friendly
3) Favors are pretty unique

Cons:
1) Prices are a bit steep for what you're getting. You can get much bigger scoops and a waffle cone from Mitchell's across town. But hey, it's across town.
2) For a place that says creamery, it's actually more sorbet or gelato.
3) There's only one person serving the ice cream while another runs cash register causing a really long unnecessary line especially if a new customer wants to try some samples. What they should be doing is having both guys taking orders and serving the ice cream while the 3rd guy in the back doing stock should have been in the front running the register. Speaking of serving customers....
4) TOTALLY UNSANITARY SERVING CONDITIONS!!!!!! The person serving the ice cream,which included mostly waffle cones, did so with his BARE HANDS!!!! Now if you think I'm over reacting then take into account during the 10 minutes I was waiting in line, I saw the server wipe the his hands onto the side of shirt and towards the back of his pants. Every now and then he'd stick his thumbs into his pockets! What made things loud and clear that these people have not worked in the food industry at all was that the same server scratched the back of his head and later wiped the sweat of his forehead with his BARE HANDS! To top it off, when the cashier and server switched roles, at no time did I see the new server wash his hands after handling the cash and coins from how many customer which is a HUGE HEALTH CODE VIOLATION!!!!!!
These guys need to be wearing gloves when handling food.
Their hands should not be touching any part of their person or clothing.
Anyone handling food needs to thoroughly WASH THEIR HANDS WITH SOAP before preparing and serving food!
5) They should change the name of their Mint Chocolate ice cream to Moquito, be cause it really does taste like I'm having a Moquito than a mint chocolate.
6) They also really need more than 8 flavors (actually 7 flavors today since they sold out of peanut butter chocolate). They really do. Go to any ice cream shop in the Bay Area, and they literally have 2x-3x as many flavors.
author: John Paul C.

description: MY FAVORITE ICE CREAM PLACE. great service and great original flavors :)
author: Michelle D.

description: I first tried this place when it first opened and I am glad they are still doing so well. The staff is super friendly and would always greet us with a big smile on their faces. The decor inside is really nice and it makes you feel like you're not in the Sunset. You can ask for samples so you can try the flavors to see what you want. There are some flavors that are very unique and are worth the try! I have tried different flavors from them but my favorite is still the Fresh Mint Chip. Take the name literally because it actually tastes like the fresh mint leaves and it is delicious! This flavor may be a hit or miss for you, so please taste it first before you order it. If you are someone that likes the artificial mints that you get from generic brands, this is not the flavor for you. The ice cream here is fresh and tastes great! I just wish that it didn't melt so quickly. Also, the waffle cones are made fresh and tastes so buttery... Mmmmm thinking about it makes me drool. I would definitely come back when I am in the area. It is too difficult to find parking here during the day.
author: Solana T.

description: Friendly staff.  Great space.  The lemon poppy seed ice cream is like a home made muffin.  The lemon rind makes the treat exceptional.
author: Heather R.

description: This place is amazing. SF Creamery was the first place I took my gf on a date. Some unique ice cream flavors with a couple nice vegan options. Chocolate sorbet is super rich! Get it if you're a chocolate lover.
author: Tyler F.

description: Amazing flavors, especially the mint, as mentioned by others.  The owner was there and showed us how he steeps fresh mint leaves in the mix.  We liked the crème fraiche with ginger as well - you could taste the tanginess of the crème fraiche.  Nice service and ambience, too.  After your visit to Golden Gate Park, stroll over here and get a treat.
author: David J.

description: Hometown Creamery makes good solid ice cream but nothing spectacular compared to other ice cream shops out there. The shop has a very homey and casual ambience with tables and chairs for customers to chat and enjoy the ice cream, which I liked. However, the ice cream flavors and textures could be improved. San Francisco has many good ice cream shops, and the flavors here just do not compare with others in terms of how unique they are. The textures also did not impress; for the cost of a scoop, I expected much creamier ice cream, with attention to the smoothness and feel of a spoonful. The texture was mediocre, and the thing that keeps me coming back to an ice cream shop is not only the flavors, but most importantly the textures. The only thing that seemed impressive to me was that each flavor actually tasted like the name and not a sugary overdone rendition. I'm glad I tried this creamery, but I probably will not be coming back.
author: Annie C.

description: My wife and I love this place. The flavors that we have tried and recommend include the mint, Madagascar vanilla, cafe mocha and tea time (earl grey with lavender). They sell ice cream in really small sizes as well if you're like my wife and just want to try out multiple flavors. I also recommend getting a waffle cone since they're pretty good too! I believe everyone has different tastes when it comes to ice cream so ask for a taste. I'm sure they will have something you like
author: Daniel C.

description: Not bad at all but I think I ordered the wrong thing from the wrong person. Two stars for nice design, cleanliness, friendly staff and mostly good product. I tried green apple cider sorbet and pear ginger sake sorbet, both were good but a bit icier texture than i prefer. Husband had honey lemon rosemary ice cream which was very good. The main issue is i asked for whip cream .75 extra. I assumed it would be some delicious home made whip cream, because duh so easy to make and you're making ice cream already right? Nope. Girl grabs a can of generic whip cream and does not even know how to use it. she's shaking and shaking the can and trying to spray it on sideways.  several other employees watching did not try to help. shes getting frustrated and keeps shaking the can while i watch so I just say "try turning the can completely upside down" and it works, but she then puts the smallest dab ever on, like a tablespoon and hands it to me. wow lady. really? I'm sure another visit may be better but come on. dont charge .75 for generic cool whip in a can and not even remotely know if your staff can operate a whip cream can. disappointing.
author: B S.

description: Cardamom with salted caramel and earl grey lavender as a double smidge cone. Soooo delicious. I love that tiny smidge cone - all the goodness without the guilt. It was pretty cold and windy out so my friend tried their new hot spiced fresh pressed apple cider and pecan bar. Pecan bar baked on site. Said it was the best she 'd ever had. Hung out and listened to the great music playing and watched the world go by on 9th ave. Really love the vibe at this place.
author: Vicki H.

description: My husband and I had the Lemon Speculoos and Turrion double scoop on Christmas Day 2015. Excellent!
author: Esha M.

description: The ice cream at the Hometown Creamery is ok but way overpriced.  We paid $4 for a tiny ball of ice cream.  I would definitely not return here but instead patronize ice cream makers like Bi-Rite Creamery that delver greater value and better ice cream for the money.
author: Tom W.

description: Ok - this was just a walk by - but so glad we did.  The ice cream is creamy, tasty and goes great with the homemade waffle cone.  PB chocolate fudge was a hit with all of us!!
author: Nicole C.

description: I was REALLY excited about this place. It's very homey and basic, which is what I loved. I tried two different ice creams: madagascar vanilla, baklava and they were nothing special. The baklava wasn't very good. The vanilla was very milky and creamy and actually gave me a stomach ache after. There is only one line with either one or two people helping you out but with three people in front of me it took a good 10 minutes to check out. The service is very slow due to the checkout setup but the employees are nice.
author: Lissette L.

description: We went to San Francisco Hometown Creamery on a Sunday night of a hot SF weekend (the third of the summer!). Short line, and we were at the counter. We had initially made up our mind to get the end of summer s'mores and the peanut butter fudge, but were blown away by the mint chip when we tasted it. It had such a fresh mint flavor that wasn't overwhelming (think very fresh mohito without the alcohol). We ending up going with the peanut butter fudge and the mint chip in their freshly made waffle cones. We agree with other reviewers' assessment that the ice cream isn't as "creamy" as other SF favorites (ie BiRite), but we highly enjoyed the flavors and the location-- just down the street-- means we will certainly be back. We hope they continue to stay in business and plan to support them as they improve their method.
author: T K.

description: Delicious ice cream spot with nice decor. I wish there was a Richmond district mural to represent where I live, but I guess the others will do. Nice addition to the inner sunset!
author: J O.

description: I had the mint chocolate chip; the ice cream was very creamy and was filled with big chunks of chocolate.  I had it with a freshly made waffle cone, WOW! I believe this is the best home made ice cream I have ever had. The staff was very friendly and the shop was extremely clean; it was accommodating for enjoying inside the store. I will definitely return.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: It's great that the ice cream is made in shop, but the flavors aren't that good and there's nothing that really separates themselves from other ice cream shops. There's no edge they have against the competition except they are new and of course people want to try new stuff. My advice to the shop is make flavors that are unique and taste good. Check out Holy Gelato if you want ice cream that's made at the shop and they have unique flavors that taste good. Prices here are also more than the competition.
author: Mike W.

description: We were walking to Jamba Juice when we noticed this place and decided to try it on a lark based on the line almost out the door.  Can't say enough good things about this place.  The vibe is very SF.  You are greeted with great music and a very friendly staff.  An amazing choice of ice creams it's available.  I had an ice cream sandwich with Snickerdoodle cookies and caramelized banana ice cream.  Delicious.  The rest of my family had root beer floats and they were all delighted.
author: Kyle S.

description: Really delicious honey lemon ice cream-sorbet and stellar service. Can't wait to try all the flavors
author: Seghel Y.

description: I am so happy we have a new ice cream place in the Inner Sunset. And I feel even better about it knowing everything is made on premises with local ingredients. I've tried most of the flavors and they're all good. Cinnamon, peanut butter fudge and Aztec chocolate are my favorites so far. I really liked the Newsomes too but they have gone away for some reason :( The place is spacious and attractive, the guys who work there are friendly and efficient. I'm going to be a regular.
author: Delia T.

description: Homemade ice cream in SF, with unique flavors and good flavors, not too fruity booty style guyayahumpioupoa , u get me? Progressive cool ice cream, Is there such a thing? Why yes in SF new hipster town there is such a thing. ANd I actually like it -though Im old school. GOod stuff.
author: SForiginal T.

description: The smell of fresh waffle cones in Hometown Creamery is AMAZING! Plus, the ice cream is delicious and everyone who works there is always smiling.
author: Emily M.

description: The kind of ice cream you dream about at night!  The meyer lemon poppyseed was SO good! It's pretty pricey for ice cream ($9 a pint), but it's worth every penny!
author: Annie W.

description: I JUST had their "Tea Time on the Thames (Earl Grey and Lavender)" ice cream. It was AMAZING. It wasn't too creamy and the flavor wasn't too overpowering. I felt like this was a good blend of a creamy and aromatic taste.
author: Lily K.

description: I have been here about three times and I tried giving it a chance. The ice cream flavors are very bland and flat. I paid over $5 for my ice cream and it was small and tasteless. The service is so slow. This is no Bi-rite and no ice cream bar. I rather go up the block to Holy Gelato.
author: Jay V.

description: Reallly, reallly really delicious ice cream, all made from scratch -- including the yummy waffle cones. I love that they're constantly experimenting with flavors. The meyer lemon poppyseed and the pluot sorbet are a couple of recent hits.
author: Ruth R.

description: A brilliant addition the the Inner Sunset! The ice cream is unbelievable-exceptional quality, excellent new flavors and FRESH! Adar and Saadi are delightful people with genuine ear to ear grins!
author: Dannielle S.

description: Loved this place! Went with the family for an after-lunch treat and was impressed with every part of the experience. Lovely space with lots of clean seating (no sticky table tops here), friendly and patient staff (it took us a while to decide), and amazing ice cream and treats. Everythig here is made on site; the ice cream, the cookies, the waffle cones....yum! The chocolate sorbet, the madagascar vanilla ice cream, the aztec chocolate ice cream and a chocolate chocolate chip cookie were tried and everyone raved about their choices. Will definitely be coming back!
author: J M.

description: I was so excited to have a homemade ice cream shop in my hood. Anyone who knows me, knows that I am an ice cream connoisseur. Well, this spot, was sub par. Expensive, small portions, and a very limited selection of flavors. I mean this place has ample room many more displays of flavors. The taste was almost too creamy, buttery, leaving a film on the roof of my mouth that didn't subside for over an hour. Maybe it needs some time, as all new businesses so. While they are working on getting it right, I'll be in Cole Valley at The Ice Cream Shop!
author: Missy S.

description: Great first stop by a new Inner Sunset spot.  The highlight here is the positivity of the owners and the general vibe inside.   Just oozes joy from the moment you walk in.  Ice Cream could be a bit creamier and the cones a bit more like Ice Cream bar.  Sad to see Hotei go, but happy to stop in here for a happy fix.  I hope they make it!  We are rooting for them.
author: Carolyn J.

description: This ice cream is incredibly delicious! We sampled every flavor and ALL were great, but our two stand-out favorites, Fresh Mint Chip and Honey Lemon Rosemary, were superb! I have never tasted ice cream with such fresh, pure flavor. I would describe the flavors as strong, but perfectly balanced and not at all over-powering. One bite, and I could tell the home-made difference. Clearly, a lot of thoughtfulness goes into the recipes and ingredient selection here. Along with the warm, inviting smiles of the owners, groovy music and awesome decor (hand-painted panels representing SF neighborhoods painted by one of the owners), this place is FUN! On the day we visited, 9 awesome flavors were offered, which is plenty to select from. The place is immaculately clean, and there's plenty of room to hang out. Not surprised at all to see them recognized recently as one of the BEST ice cream shops in the Bay Area (http://redtri.com/san-francisco/the-best-ice-cream-in-the-bay-area/)!
author: Amy C.

description: excited to see new business, an ice creamery no less! tried one of few ice cream flavors available in a seemingly freshly made waffle cone. server broke the waffle cone while picking it up and proceeded to use it. my "smidgeon" scoop was so small the first bite i took caused the broken cone to fall apart. ice cream tasted so so but definitely was not worth the $4 i paid. i also echo a few posted reviews that suggest server wash his hands more and/or wear gloves. i may try this a place in a few months but for now a pint of B+J's is money better spent.
author: D L.

description: Walked in on a Saturday night after dinner.  We were drawn in by the welcoming smell of the warm waffle cones and decided to try it out.  Each of us asked for a taste.  The lady who was serving us gave us such a small taste that we hardly tasted the sample at all.  If you are going to give a sample, then commit.  I think the small dollop of ice cream on a front of the small tasting spoon cannot give you a "true" taste of what the ice cream tastes like.  None of us ordered what each of us sampled, e.g. banana, strawberry balsamic and chocolate sorbetto. Instead we went with the vanilla, mint chip and coconut.  Flavors were light and enjoyable.  The "smidge" size is fairly small and at $2.95, seems pretty steep (although the fresh waffle cone should count for something - but the cup and cone are the same price).  If craving ice cream and I'm in the neighborhood, I would stop by but I can't say I would make a special trip to go there.
author: Will L.
